translated: The nature of things can be analyzed only in terms of what is grasped as the evidence for the realization of something.

original: dper na skad cig ma zhes bya bar ldog pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa dang / nus pa zhes bya ba dbyibs dang / dkar po zhes bya ba gzugs su rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skad cig ma zhes bya bar ldog pa'i bdag nyid du rtogs pa dang / nus pa zhes bya ba dbyibs dang / dkar po zhes bya ba gzugs su rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the realization of something called ‚Äúmomentary‚Äù is in terms of the nature of cessation, the realization of something called ‚Äúpotent‚Äù is in terms of shape, and the realization of something called ‚Äúwhite‚Äù is in terms of form.

original: des na ji ltar dkar po'i dkar po nyid yin pas der 'khrul pa med pa de bzhin du sha pa nyid kyang shing la mi 'khrul te sha pa nyid bzhin no zhes 'di gnyi ga yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na ji ltar dkar po'i dkar po nyid yin pas der 'khrul pa med pa de bzhin du sha pa nyid kyang shing la mi 'khrul te sha pa nyid bzhin no zhes 'di gnyi ga yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the whiteness of white is not mistaken in that way, the postness of the post is not mistaken in the tree, just as the postness is. Both of these will be explained.

original: des na gang las gsum la tshul gsum yod pa dang / rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir rtogs par 'gyur ba de nyid bshad pa'i phyir gsum nyid la de nye bar bsdus so //
analyzed: des na gang las gsum la tshul gsum yod pa dang / rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir rtogs par 'gyur ba de nyid bshad pa'i phyir gsum nyid la de nye bar bsdus so //
translated: Therefore, since the three modes exist in that and there is a reason for the realization, in order to explain that, the three modes are subsumed in that.

original: de la yang nge yod pa dang rtogs pa dag gi rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir gsum la tshul gsum yod mod /
analyzed: de la yang nge yod pa dang rtogs pa dag gi rgyu mtshan yod pa'i phyir gsum la tshul gsum yod mod /
translated: Because there is a reason for the existence of that and for the realization of that, the three modes do exist.

original: gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba des na de ni rnam pa gsum nyid ces bya ba'i nges pa mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan yang yod par 'gyur ba des na de ni rnam pa gsum nyid ces bya ba'i nges pa mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: Moreover, because of the existence of that, it is not reasonable to say that there is a restriction of just three modes.

original: gzhan du zhes smos so //
analyzed: gzhan du zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise‚Äù is stated.

original: ji ltar bshad pa'i nges par byed pa med na /
analyzed: ji ltar bshad pa'i nges par byed pa med na /
translated: If there is no restriction as explained,

original: tha dad pa gzhan don tha dad pa gzhan dag dang / nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang yin pa ste de las rang gi ngo bo thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med na ci ste med /
analyzed: tha dad pa gzhan don tha dad pa gzhan dag dang / nges par yod pa'i nges pa gang yin pa ste de las rang gi ngo bo thob pa ma yin pa'i phyir de med na ci ste med /
translated: then what is the restriction of the existence of something different that is different from something else, since its own nature is not obtained from that? If it does not exist, why does it not exist?

original: des na ji ltar yod pa nges pa yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar yod pa nges pa yin /
translated: Therefore, how is existence a restriction?

original: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos zhes bya bas ni /
analyzed: don gzhan rgyu mtshan can gyi chos zhes bya bas ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa phenomenon that is the reason for something else‚Äù

original: de yod pa tsam dang rnges @199b su 'brel pa nyid med par brjod do //
analyzed: de yod pa tsam dang rnges @199b su 'brel pa nyid med par brjod do //
translated: indicates that it is not merely the existence of that and the mere connection with that.

original: des na 'di tha dad par 'gyur bas de'i bdag med do //
analyzed: des na 'di tha dad par 'gyur bas de'i bdag med do //
translated: Therefore, since it is different, it does not have that as its nature.

original: gos la tshon bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid med na gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gos la tshon bzhin no zhes bya ba ni de'i bdag nyid med na gdon mi za bar yod par nges pa med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLike a cloth and its color‚Äù means that if they are not of the same nature, then they are definitely not existent.

original: 'dir gzhan du zhes bya ba 'brel pa'i bdag nyid las kyang gzhan du gyur pa yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med na gzhan dag dang nges par yod pa'i nges pa med bar bstan pas tha dad pa'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid kyang med
analyzed: 'dir gzhan du zhes bya ba 'brel pa'i bdag nyid las kyang gzhan du gyur pa yin pas na rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po med na gzhan dag dang nges par yod pa'i nges pa med bar bstan pas tha dad pa'i dngos po la de'i bdag nyid kyang med
translated: Here, ‚Äúother‚Äù is connected to the nature of the relation, and since they are not of the same nature, if the relation of cause and effect does not exist, then they are definitely not existent.

original: pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid med pa yang brjod par nus mod kyi /
analyzed: pa'i phyir de'i bdag nyid med pa yang brjod par nus mod kyi /
translated: Since this is demonstrated, although it is possible to say that the nature of difference is not of the same nature,üîΩnevertheless, mere nondifference is not of the same nature.

original: de lta na yang tha dad pa med pa tsam ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos gcig gi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang tha dad pa med pa tsam ni de'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos gcig gi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: However, it is of the same nature as a single phenomenon.

original: des na de med par bstan pa'i phyir de nyid de ltar brjod de /
analyzed: des na de med par bstan pa'i phyir de nyid de ltar brjod de /
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate that, it is said to be just that.

original: de yod tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yod tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa 'phen par byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is merely existent and is related to the impelling, it is of the same nature as that.

original: yang na gzhan du zhes bya bas ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: yang na gzhan du zhes bya bas ni de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa'i mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'o //
translated: Or else, ‚Äúin another way‚Äù means that it is different from the characteristic that is related to that much.

original: gos la ni tshon don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos yin te /
analyzed: gos la ni tshon don gzhan gyi rgyu mtshan can gyi chos yin te /
translated: The cloth is the property that has the color as a different object for its reason.

original: des na gos de la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na gos de la gdon mi za bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the cloth is necessarily so.

original: gos yin ba tsam gyis ni sgrub par brjod mi nus so //
analyzed: gos yin ba tsam gyis ni sgrub par brjod mi nus so //
translated: But it cannot be said to be established by the mere fact that it is cloth.

original: des na gos ni tshon don gzhan las 'gyur ba'i phyir de la gos mi 'khrul pa ma yin te //
analyzed: des na gos ni tshon don gzhan las 'gyur ba'i phyir de la gos mi 'khrul pa ma yin te //
translated: Therefore, since the cloth is produced from the color that is a different object, it is not non-erroneous with regard to the cloth.

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no relation.

original: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo ma yin par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: bar skabs kyi tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba ni mdo ma yin par brjod pa'o //
translated: The so-called ‚Äúintermediate verse‚Äù is not a s≈´tra statement.

original: des na de ltar 'brel pa nyid las gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: des na de ltar 'brel pa nyid las gtan tshigs go bar byed pa yin par bsgrubs te /
translated: Therefore, in this way, the proof of the reason that is understood from the relation itself is established.

original: gang dag don gzhan gyi rgyu can yang dngos po'i rang bzhin du khas blangs nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos gcig gi bdag nyid kyis 'thob pa de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid spong ba de dag la 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i don
analyzed: gang dag don gzhan gyi rgyu can yang dngos po'i rang bzhin du khas blangs nas mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyi chos gcig gi bdag nyid kyis 'thob pa de tsam dang rjes su 'brel pa nyid spong ba de dag la 'brel pa bsgrub pa'i don
translated: Those who accept that which is caused by something else to be the nature of things, and who obtain the nature of things such as impermanence by means of a single nature, refute mere connection and association.üîΩ

original: nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: nyid dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: Those who accept that even that which has a cause that is a different object is the nature of a thing, and that it is obtained by the identity of a single quality such as impermanence, and who reject mere connection with that, for the sake of establishing a connection with that,

original: gzhan yang zhes smos so //üîΩgang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid gyi mtshan nyid @200a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes smos so // gang gi phyir mi rtag pa nyid gyi mtshan nyid @200a * //
translated: say, ‚ÄúMoreover, . . .‚ÄùüîΩBecause the characteristic of impermanence is said to be the meaning of the word, it follows that it is expressed as possessing the exclusion of other.

original: sgra'i don yin no zhes gsungs pa la gzhan sel ba dang ldan par brjod par thal ba'i phyir na 'dir yang slob dpon rang nyid kyis /
analyzed: sgra'i don yin no zhes gsungs pa la gzhan sel ba dang ldan par brjod par thal ba'i phyir na 'dir yang slob dpon rang nyid kyis /
translated: Therefore, here too the master himself says,

original: rang dbang med phyir de ldan min //üîΩzhes gsal ba gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ro zhes pha rol po dag brjod do //
analyzed: rang dbang med phyir de ldan min // zhes gsal ba gang yin pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs su 'gyur ro zhes pha rol po dag brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause it is not independent, it does not possess it.‚ÄùüîΩThis is the position of those who possess that.üîΩThus, when it is said that it is an exclusion,

original: 'di ltar sel bar byed pa na sel ba ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar sel bar byed pa na sel ba ste /
translated: it is an exclusion.

original: zlog par byed pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid med pa dngos po med pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: zlog par byed pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid med pa dngos po med pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: The negation of that is the expression of the non-existence of the nature of another.

original: gal te de sgra'i don yin na bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don kho nar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te de sgra'i don yin na bum pa la sogs pa'i sgra rnams don kho nar 'gyur te /
translated: If that is the meaning of the word, then the words pot, etc. would have only the meaning of the negation,

original: med par dgag pa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par dgag pa la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no difference in the negation of non-existence.

original: thams cad du dgag par bya ba kho na tha dad par zad kyi bkag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thams cad du dgag par bya ba kho na tha dad par zad kyi bkag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In all cases, the difference is only in the object of negation, not in the negation,

original: dngos po med pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa ni khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because non-existence is without distinction.

original: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: bsal bar bya ba tha dad pas tha dad pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is there difference due to the difference in the object of exclusion,

original: phra bo la ba lang ma yin pa med la dang pa la rta ma yin pa med pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta tha dad kyang dgag ba'i don thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phra bo la ba lang ma yin pa med la dang pa la rta ma yin pa med pa'i phyir ba lang dang rta tha dad kyang dgag ba'i don thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because, although the cow and the horse are different, there is no difference in the object of negation in all cases, since there is no non-cow in the cow and no non-horse in the horse.

original: des na ba lang ma yin pa las tha dad pa la brten nas ba lang gi sgra ba lang la 'jug par brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: des na ba lang ma yin pa las tha dad pa la brten nas ba lang gi sgra ba lang la 'jug par brjod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the word cow is said to apply to the cow in dependence on the difference from the non-cow.

original: dper na gzhan dag gis ba lang nyid la brten nas ba lang la sgra 'jug go zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na gzhan dag gis ba lang nyid la brten nas ba lang la sgra 'jug go zhes brjod pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, others say that the word cow is used in dependence on cowhood.

original: des na gzhan sel ba'i yul la de dang ldan pa'i phyir phyogs su thal bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba'i yul la de dang ldan pa'i phyir phyogs su thal bar 'gyur ro zhe'o //
translated: Therefore, because the object of other-exclusion possesses that, it follows that it is a part.üîΩSince the master uses the term in the treatise, this objection appears to them.

original: 'di ni slob dpon gyis bstan bcos kyis gras tha snyad mdzad pas na de dag la rgon 'di lta bur snang ba yin gyi 'on kyang der sgro btags pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro /üîΩpa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ni slob dpon gyis bstan bcos kyis gras tha snyad mdzad pas na de dag la rgon 'di lta bur snang ba yin gyi 'on kyang der sgro btags pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro / pa'i phyir ro //
translated: However, because it is applied by mere superimposition,

original: sel ba zhes bya ba sel ba'i sgra'i don du gyur pa ni med kyi /
analyzed: sel ba zhes bya ba sel ba'i sgra'i don du gyur pa ni med kyi /
translated: there is no such thing as an object of exclusion that is the meaning of the word exclusion.

original: 'on kyang don gyi rang gi ngo bo kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang don gyi rang gi ngo bo kho na'o //
translated: However, it is the meaning‚Äôs own nature.

original: des na nyes pa ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na nyes pa ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore there is no fault.

original: bum pa'i rnam pa nyid du bum pa'i sgras brjod pa yin gyi sgra thams cad don gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba gang yin pa bum pa med par bkag pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bum pa'i rnam pa nyid du bum pa'i sgras brjod pa yin gyi sgra thams cad don gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba gang yin pa bum pa med par bkag pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The word pot expresses the aspect of a pot, but it is not the case that the pot is the negation of the nonexistence of pot, which would make all words have the same meaning.

original: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir de la skyon 'dir 'gyur ro //üîΩ'grel pa'i sgra'i don gzhan sel ba gzhan la yang zhes bya bas de nye bar brjod pa'i rang bzhin nyid bshad pa'o //üîΩdes khyad par du bya ba brjod pa ma yin par ni sel ba'i yul can @200b nyid du mi 'thad pas ni /
analyzed: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag ni tha dad pa'i phyir de la skyon 'dir 'gyur ro // 'grel pa'i sgra'i don gzhan sel ba gzhan la yang zhes bya bas de nye bar brjod pa'i rang bzhin nyid bshad pa'o // des khyad par du bya ba brjod pa ma yin par ni sel ba'i yul can @200b nyid du mi 'thad pas ni /
translated: Since the class and that which possesses it are different, this fault would ensue.üîΩThe meaning of the term ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù in the Commentary is explained by ‚Äúin regard to another,‚Äù which is to say, it is the nature of the expression itself.üîΩSince it is not tenable that the object of exclusion is the nature of the expression,

original: des khyad par du byas pa brjod pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa thams cad mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /üîΩskyon chags pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i phyogs nye bar brjod pa'o zhes mdo'i dgongs pa bshad pa'o //
analyzed: des khyad par du byas pa brjod pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la brjod pa thams cad mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes smras pa gang yin pa ste /üîΩskyon chags pa'i phyir de dang ldan pa'i phyogs nye bar brjod pa'o zhes mdo'i dgongs pa bshad pa'o //

original: khyad par can nyid kyang dbyig pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par du bya ba dang / khyad par du bya ba'i dngos pos ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang der sgro btags pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par can nyid kyang dbyig pa la sogs pa bzhin du khyad par du bya ba dang / khyad par du bya ba'i dngos pos ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang der sgro btags pa nyid kyis 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the particular is not a particular in the sense that a stick, for example, is a particular, but rather it is a particular in the sense that it is a superimposition.

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la yang spyi dang ldan pa'i rdzas snang ba ni med kyi /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la yang spyi dang ldan pa'i rdzas snang ba ni med kyi /
translated: And in the case of the subject that possesses the universal, the substance that possesses the universal is not manifest,

original: 'on kyang der sgro btags pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'on kyang der sgro btags pa nyid kyis so //
translated: but rather it is a superimposition.

original: ji ltar bsal zhe na de la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar bsal zhe na de la ni zhes smos so //
translated: How is it eliminated? He says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: don gzhan la brten nas gzhan la 'jug pa la gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: don gzhan la brten nas gzhan la 'jug pa la gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur gyi /
translated: When one engages in something else in dependence on something else, then it is dependent on something else.

original: ldog pa la ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa la ni tha dad pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the case of elimination, there is no difference.

original: 'di ltar gal te spyi nyid 'di yul yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te spyi nyid 'di yul yin na /
translated: Thus, if the universal itself is the object,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la bstan pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshe der sgro btags nas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa zhes bya ba mi 'grub ste sgro btags kyang spyi de tsam yul yin pa'i phyir de'i gzhan dbang du gyur pas gzhan yul du mi 'gyur ba'i
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la bstan pa med pa'i phyir de'i tshe der sgro btags nas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa zhes bya ba mi 'grub ste sgro btags kyang spyi de tsam yul yin pa'i phyir de'i gzhan dbang du gyur pas gzhan yul du mi 'gyur ba'i
translated: Because the intrinsic identity is not taught, at that time, the superimposition of that is not established as engaging the intrinsic identity.  Because even though there is superimposition, that mere universal is the object, it is not the case that the other is the object, because it is under the power of that.

original: phyir ro // des na sgro btags pa'i don kyang mi 'thad do //
analyzed: phyir ro // des na sgro btags pa'i don kyang mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of superimposition is also not tenable.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni slob dpon gyis gsungs pa gzhan dag rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni slob dpon gyis gsungs pa gzhan dag rtogs par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù is for the purpose of understanding other statements by the master.

original: ji ltar log pa don gzhan ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar log pa don gzhan ma yin zhe na /
translated: How is the exclusion not a different object?

original: gnyis gas zhes smos so //
analyzed: gnyis gas zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúboth‚Äù is stated.

original: ldog pa dang log pa'i sgra gnyi gas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo gcig kho na brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa dang log pa'i sgra gnyi gas rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rang gi ngo bo gcig kho na brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both the words ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù and ‚Äúexcluded‚Äù express only the intrinsic identity of a single intrinsic reality.

original: da ni bsgrub pa'i yul can gyi phyogs las khyad ci yod ce na /
analyzed: da ni bsgrub pa'i yul can gyi phyogs las khyad ci yod ce na /
translated: Now, what is the difference between the subject of the probandum and the subject of the proof?

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: It is the subject of the exclusion of other.

original: gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin /
translated: What is this so-called exclusion of other?

original: gal te ldog pa'i khyad can gyi don yin na /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa'i khyad can gyi don yin na /
translated: If it is the meaning that is qualified by the exclusion,üîΩwhat is that exclusion that is to be qualified?

original: gang zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa de ci zhig / de la ni dngos po gzhan med kyi /
analyzed: gang zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba'i ldog pa de ci zhig / de la ni dngos po gzhan med kyi /
translated: There is no other entity than that.

original: gang zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med //
analyzed: gang zhig khyad par du 'gyur ba ni 'ga' yang med //
translated: There is nothing at all that is to be qualified.

original: 'on te rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i don tsam yin no //
analyzed: 'on te rang gi rang bzhin la gnas pa'i don tsam yin no //
translated: Or, it is just the meaning that remains in its own nature.

original: de ltar na sgrub pa'i yul can gyis kyang de nyid yul du bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na sgrub pa'i yul can gyis kyang de nyid yul du bya ba yin gyi /
translated: In that case, the subject that affirms also takes that as its object.

original: gzhan ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni 'ga' yang ma yin no //
translated: There is no other at all.

original: des na mngon sum yang de lta @201a * //üîΩbur gyur ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: des na mngon sum yang de lta @201a * // bur gyur ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: Therefore, perception also is just such a subject.

original: de'i yul can nyid kyis sel ba'i yul can yin na ni de yang sel ba'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i yul can nyid kyis sel ba'i yul can yin na ni de yang sel ba'i yul can du 'gyur ro //
translated: By being the subject of that, it is the subject of the exclusion, and that also becomes the subject of the exclusion.

original: de bas na rig pa'i byed pa don gyi yul can du khas blangs nas sgrub pa'i yul can las 'da' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rig pa'i byed pa don gyi yul can du khas blangs nas sgrub pa'i yul can las 'da' ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, having accepted that the function of awareness has an object that is a meaning, one does not go beyond the subject that affirms.

original: 'dir smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir smras pa /
translated: Here, someone might say this:

original: 'di sngon po ma yin snyam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di ji lta ba bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: 'di sngon po ma yin snyam pa'i rnam par shes pa 'di ji lta ba bzhin sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid do //
translated: This consciousness that thinks ‚ÄúThis is not blue‚Äù is the subject that excludes blue, etc., in accordance with the way it is.

original: 'di ltar 'dir dgag pa'i don yan lag tu gyur pas de ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir dgag pa'i don yan lag tu gyur pas de ltar rtogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni bsal ba yin no //
translated: In this way, since the object of negation is a part of this, the nature of the cognition that understands it in that way is exclusion.

original: des na shes pa 'di ni sgro btags pa'i sngon po ma yin pa dang 'dre ldog par byed pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid rtogs pas rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid yin par brjod do //
analyzed: des na shes pa 'di ni sgro btags pa'i sngon po ma yin pa dang 'dre ldog par byed pa'i sgo nas ngo bo nyid rtogs pas rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid yin par brjod do //
translated: Therefore this consciousness is said to be the subject that excludes by way of understanding the nature of the object that is the opposite of the superimposition that this is not blue.

original: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa sngon po la sogs pa dag la sngon po ma yin bar sgro 'dogs pa ;
analyzed: de bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa sngon po la sogs pa dag la sngon po ma yin bar sgro 'dogs pa ;
translated: In the same way, the consciousness of blue, etc., excludes the superimposition that blue, etc., are not blue, etc.

original: zlog par byed pa nyid kyis dngos su na don gyi yul can du gyur pa rtogs pa po'i zhen pa la ltos nas rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du rtogs pa dag kyang gzhan bzlog pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir sel ba'i yul can du brjod do
analyzed: zlog par byed pa nyid kyis dngos su na don gyi yul can du gyur pa rtogs pa po'i zhen pa la ltos nas rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid du rtogs pa dag kyang gzhan bzlog pa'i sgo nas rtogs pa'i phyir sel ba'i yul can du brjod do
translated: The cognition that is the direct object of the exclusion is understood in terms of the eliminator, but it is also understood in terms of the excluded, since it is understood by way of the exclusion of other.

original: // de ltar ni don de yang sel bar 'gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: // de ltar ni don de yang sel bar 'gyur pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the object is also an exclusion.

original: phyogs nyid bum pa med pa yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyogs nyid bum pa med pa yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the very place itself being the absence of a pot.

original: rang gi ngo bo las log pa yin na yang sgro 'dogs kyi dbang gis 'dres par gyur pas de'i dus na sngon po med pa'i log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo las log pa yin na yang sgro 'dogs kyi dbang gis 'dres par gyur pas de'i dus na sngon po med pa'i log par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is the opposite of its own nature, it is mixed up by the power of superimposition, and at that time, it is the opposite of the nonexistence of blue.

original: des na 'di gzhan las log pa yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa log pa'i yul can du brjod kyi /
analyzed: des na 'di gzhan las log pa yul du 'gyur ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa log pa'i yul can du brjod kyi /
translated: Therefore, since it is the object that is the opposite of other, it is said to be the object of a conceptual cognition.

original: mngon sum ni ma yin te rang gi ngo bo tsam la rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ni ma yin te rang gi ngo bo tsam la rnam par gnas pa'i dngos po'i rang bzhin nyid kyis rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is not a direct perception, because it is understood by the nature of things that abide in their own nature.

original: des na ngo bo'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa nyid gzhan sel ba'i yul can gyi /
analyzed: des na ngo bo'i yul can gyi rnam par rtog pa nyid gzhan sel ba'i yul can gyi /
translated: Therefore, the conceptual consciousness that has an entity as its object is a conceptual consciousness that has an object of exclusion.

original: ji ltar med pa dgag pa'i yul can du blo ngan dag 'dod pa ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa dgag pa'i yul can du blo ngan dag 'dod pa ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not, as the logicians claim, a conceptual consciousness that has a nonentity as its object.

original: ngo bo yul can nyid kyis rnam par gcod pa'i rtog pa rnams kyi rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngo bo yul can nyid kyis rnam par gcod pa'i rtog pa rnams kyi rnam par gcod pa'i yul can nyid 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is tenable that conceptual consciousnesses that have an entity as their object are conceptual consciousnesses that have an object of exclusion.

original: gal te ngo bo nyid gzhan bsal ba'i sgo nas rtogs pa sel ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo nyid gzhan bsal ba'i sgo nas rtogs pa sel ba yin na /
translated: If it is understood that the entity itself is excluded by the exclusion of another entity,

original: 'o na slob dpon @201b phyogs kyi glang pos gzhan sel ba pa spyi'i mtshan nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na slob dpon @201b phyogs kyi glang pos gzhan sel ba pa spyi'i mtshan nyid du zhal gyis bzhes pa mi 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: then it is not tenable that the master DignƒÅga accepts exclusion as the general definition of a conceptual consciousness.

original: de smras pa da ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de smras pa da ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúNow, . . .‚Äù

original: log pa gcig gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir gcig gi sgra sbyor bas na de la ltos nas gnyis pa gzhan yin no //
analyzed: log pa gcig gzhan gyi rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir gcig gi sgra sbyor bas na de la ltos nas gnyis pa gzhan yin no //
translated: Because one negation does not follow another, the word ‚Äúone‚Äù is used. In dependence on that, the second is called ‚Äúanother.‚Äù

original: de bas na gcig gnyis pa dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan las ldog pa spyi yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gcig gnyis pa dang rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ji ltar gzhan las ldog pa spyi yin zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no single universal that is concomitant with two, how can the exclusion of other be a universal?

original: gzhan sel ba ni log pa'i don gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba ni log pa'i don gyi rang gi ngo bo nyid yin na /
translated: If the exclusion of other is the intrinsic reality of a non-entity,

original: log pa yang log pa gzhan la rjes su mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: log pa yang log pa gzhan la rjes su mi 'gro'o //
translated: then a non-entity does not follow another non-entity.

original: rjes su 'gro ba med par yang spyi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar gzhan sel ba'i spyi yin na /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba med par yang spyi'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar gzhan sel ba'i spyi yin na /
translated: And without following, it is not a universal. Therefore, how can the exclusion of other be a universal?

original: gang gis spyi bsal nas 'di brjod par bya ba nyid du brtag /'di ni khyad par gyi ngo bor mi 'thad do //
analyzed: gang gis spyi bsal nas 'di brjod par bya ba nyid du brtag /'di ni khyad par gyi ngo bor mi 'thad do //
translated: By what means is a universal excluded and this [exclusion of other] imagined to be the object of expression? It is not tenable as the intrinsic reality of a particular.

original: sgra'i don khyad par brjod bya dang / rjod byed du ni 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun phyung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgra'i don khyad par brjod bya dang / rjod byed du ni 'dod pa ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pas sun phyung ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is refuted by statements such as The meaning of a word is not accepted as either the object of expression or the means of expression.

original: 'di spang pa'i phyir de'i blo la zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di spang pa'i phyir de'i blo la zhes smos so //
translated: To refute this, [DignƒÅga] says in the cognition of that.

original: gzhan las ldog pa'i blo la de ltar spyi'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan las ldog pa'i blo la de ltar spyi'i ngo bo nyid du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because in the cognition of the exclusion of other, it appears as the intrinsic reality of a universal.

original: gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is that?

original: de'i blo la zhes bya ba la de zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel te de'i blo la de de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i blo la zhes bya ba la de zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de dang 'brel te de'i blo la de de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In the cognition of that, that is related to the expression ‚Äúthat,‚Äù because that appears in that way in the cognition.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul du rnam par gnas pa gzhan las ldog pa'i yul nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa rnams gzhan sel ba'i blo nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul du rnam par gnas pa gzhan las ldog pa'i yul nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa rnams gzhan sel ba'i blo nyid du bsgrubs pa yin no //
translated: The conceptual thoughts are established as the cognition of the exclusion of other, by the object that is the negation of other, in the manner that has been explained.

original: de la yang gzhan sel ba spyi'i ngo bor snang ste /
analyzed: de la yang gzhan sel ba spyi'i ngo bor snang ste /
translated: And in that, the exclusion of other appears as a universal.

original: des na 'di spyi zhes brjod do //
analyzed: des na 'di spyi zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is called a universal.

original: 'di nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir spyi zhes bya ba ni 'gal yang med kyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir spyi zhes bya ba ni 'gal yang med kyi zhes smos so //
translated: In order to establish this very point, he says, ‚ÄúA universal is not a non-entity.‚ÄùüîΩIt would be an entity, as imagined by others,

original: ji ltar gzhan dag gis brtags pa lta bu dngos por 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag gis brtags pa lta bu dngos por 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or it would be the nature of the exclusion of other, as imagined by some.

original: gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo de ltar dogs pa gang yin pa ni thams cad med pa'i phyir 'ga' yang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo de ltar dogs pa gang yin pa ni thams cad med pa'i phyir 'ga' yang zhes bshad do //
translated: Any such doubt is explained by ‚Äúnothing at all,‚Äù because everything is nonexistent.

original: dngos por gyur pa'am ldog pa yang bla ste /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'am ldog pa yang bla ste /
translated: It is fine if it is an entity or a negation.

original: spyi thams cad ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi thams cad ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: The universal does not exist.

original: ldog pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa rjes su 'gro ba dang ldan pa ni 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not tenable that the exclusion has pervasion.

original: gcig la yod pa ni gzhan la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gcig la yod pa ni gzhan la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: What exists in one does not exist in another,

original: gcig la yang 'di yod pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig la yang 'di yod pa po nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not established that it exists in one.

original: ba lang ma yin pa khra bo bzhin du ser skya la yang med par zad kyi de @202a * //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin pa khra bo bzhin du ser skya la yang med par zad kyi de @202a * //
translated: It is just like the non-cow, the variegated animal, which does not exist in Kapila.

original: ltar gnyi ga la yod pa 'ga' zhig ni khas blang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na /
analyzed: ltar gnyi ga la yod pa 'ga' zhig ni khas blang bar 'gyur ba ma yin pas na /
translated: Thus, it is not accepted that anything exists in both.

original: 'dir rjes su 'gro ba ci zhig yin /
analyzed: 'dir rjes su 'gro ba ci zhig yin /
translated: So what is the pervasion here?

original: dngos por gyur pa med pa ni mdun na 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa med pa ni mdun na 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The non-existent thing will be explained later.

original: des na dngos po'i gnas pas gzhan sel ba spyir bshad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po'i gnas pas gzhan sel ba spyir bshad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the universal as the exclusion of other is not based on real things.

original: de dngos po la med pa'i phyir spyi'i blo gang yin pa 'di ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin bas na /
analyzed: de dngos po la med pa'i phyir spyi'i blo gang yin pa 'di ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin bas na /
translated: Since this cognition of the universal does not exist in real things, it has the exclusion of other as its object.

original: gzhan sel ba spyi'i ngo bor khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba spyi'i ngo bor khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the exclusion of other is accepted as the nature of the universal.

original: gal te spyi 'ga' yang med na ji ltar de blo la yang med na de ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi 'ga' yang med na ji ltar de blo la yang med na de ltar snang bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If there is no universal at all, how can there be a cognition of it, and how can there be an appearance of it?

original: sgra'i rten can gyi blo zhes smos so //
analyzed: sgra'i rten can gyi blo zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa cognition that has sound as its basis‚Äù is used.

original: brjod pa dang 'drer rung bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brjod pa dang 'drer rung bar snang ba rnam par rtog pa dang bcas pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is a conceptual cognition that appears as if it were mixed with the expression.

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las log pa chos ma 'dres pa dag kyang sre zhing skye'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rigs mthun pa dang mi mthun pa las log pa chos ma 'dres pa dag kyang sre zhing skye'o //
translated: A cognition of a universal arises that mixes together the particulars of a thing, such as a pot, and its difference from what is not that thing.

original: 'di dag gi 'dre ba yang gcig dang rtogs pa gzhan dag ngo shes par byed pa ltar gcig tu byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'dre ba yang gcig dang rtogs pa gzhan dag ngo shes par byed pa ltar gcig tu byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The mixing of these particulars is not like the recognition of a single thing that is perceived in different moments.

original: ji ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes snga phyi mthong ba gcig tu byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis na /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid 'di yin no zhes snga phyi mthong ba gcig tu byed pa'i rang bzhin gyis na /
translated: The nature of recognition is to connect what is seen at different times into a single thing, as when one says, ‚ÄúThat very thing is this one.‚Äù

original: ngo shes pa mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i rnag bzhin yin pa de bzhin du 'dir ni khyad par khyad par gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ngo shes pa mtshams sbyor bar byed pa'i rnag bzhin yin pa de bzhin du 'dir ni khyad par khyad par gzhan dang mtshams sbyor ba yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, there is no connection of a particular with another particular.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rtog pa yang spyi yod par rig par byed pa ma yin no zhes spyi sel ba'i rab tu byed pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rtog pa yang spyi yod par rig par byed pa ma yin no zhes spyi sel ba'i rab tu byed pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the cognition of a universal is a conceptual cognition.

original: 'o na ji ltar khra bo gang yin pa nyid ser skya yin no zhes ma rtogs par chos sre bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar khra bo gang yin pa nyid ser skya yin no zhes ma rtogs par chos sre bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then is it that one does not understand that the variegated is the tawny?

original: rig pa'i byed pas de lta bu'i dngos por ma grub kyang gcig bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir gcig la dmigs pa'i sgra dang don bya ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba de dag gzhan la ma dmigs pa yin yang de nyid bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir don du
analyzed: rig pa'i byed pas de lta bu'i dngos por ma grub kyang gcig bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir gcig la dmigs pa'i sgra dang don bya ba la sogs pa dang 'brel ba de dag gzhan la ma dmigs pa yin yang de nyid bzhin du 'jug pa'i phyir don du
translated: Although the cognition does not establish such an entity, it is understood as one, and the word, the object, the action, etc., which are related to the observation of one, are related to the other, even though they are not observed.

original: zhen pa bzhin tha mi dad par zhen pa 'di yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes 'og nas rgya cher ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhen pa bzhin tha mi dad par zhen pa 'di yang brjod par bya ba ma yin no zhes 'og nas rgya cher ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, just as the object is not different from the way it is conceived, this conception is also not to be expressed. This will be explained in detail later.

original: ji ltar ma 'dres pa dag la 'dres par zhen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma 'dres pa dag la 'dres par zhen ce na /
translated: How is it that one conceives the mixed in the unmixed?

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu zhes smos so //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi mthu zhes smos so //
translated: The power of beginningless latent impressions is mentioned.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /üîΩma 'dres pa dag la ma 'dres pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur @202b ba gang yin pa rnam par rtog pa 'di dngos po nyams su myong ba bzhin du dngos po nyid kyis dngos po snang ba can du bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi rang gi nye bar len
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te / ma 'dres pa dag la ma 'dres pa nyid rtogs par 'gyur @202b ba gang yin pa rnam par rtog pa 'di dngos po nyams su myong ba bzhin du dngos po nyid kyis dngos po snang ba can du bskyed pa ni ma yin gyi rang gi nye bar len
translated: This is what is being said:

original: pa'i stobs las de ltar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: pa'i stobs las de ltar skye ba yin no //
translated: The non-distinctness of the non-distinct is understood. This conceptualization is not produced by the thing itself, as if it were an experience of the thing, but rather it arises in that way from the power of its own appropriation.

original: de la yang rnam par rtog pa rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rjes su byed par rtogs te /
analyzed: de la yang rnam par rtog pa rnam par shes pa snga ma'i rjes su byed par rtogs te /
translated: And in that case, conceptualization is understood to conform to the prior consciousness,

original: dran ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dran ba'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like a memory cognition.

original: dran pa don las skye ba ma yin te med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dran pa don las skye ba ma yin te med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Memory is not produced from the object, because it does not exist.

original: 'di'i de ltar snang ba ni shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed kyi gzhi las yin no //
analyzed: 'di'i de ltar snang ba ni shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed kyi gzhi las yin no //
translated: Its appearance in that way is from the basis of the formative force of the prior cognition.

original: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa 'di yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur bas 'brel par snang ba na de ltar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa 'di yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug par 'gyur bas 'brel par snang ba na de ltar skye ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, this conceptualization also conforms to the formative force of another conceptualization. Therefore, when it appears to be connected, it is produced in that way.

original: rnam par rtog pa gzhan de yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir bag chags 'di thog ma med pa can yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa gzhan de yang rnam par rtog pa gzhan gyi 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa'i phyir bag chags 'di thog ma med pa can yin no //
translated: And since that other conceptualization is also engaged by the formative influence of another conceptualization, this habitual tendency is beginningless.

original: de la dran pa ni rnam par shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed kyi gzhi las de ltar snang ba yin la /
analyzed: de la dran pa ni rnam par shes pa snga ma'i 'du byed kyi gzhi las de ltar snang ba yin la /
translated: In this regard, memory is the appearance of the basis of the formative influence of previous consciousness.

original: rtogs pa de yang shes pa snga ma'i yul la phyin ci log gis stong pa'i phyir dran pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa de yang shes pa snga ma'i yul la phyin ci log gis stong pa'i phyir dran pa nyid du snang ba yin no //
translated: And that conceptualization is the appearance of memory because it is the error of the object of previous cognition.

original: rnam par rtog pa 'di ni rnag dbang du dngos por zhen pa'i bdag nyid du skye yang dngos pos byas pa'i rig pa'i byed pas stong pa'i phyir na phyin ci log de nyid las shes pa gzhan gyi 'du byed pas byas te de ltar snang yang de ltar
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa 'di ni rnag dbang du dngos por zhen pa'i bdag nyid du skye yang dngos pos byas pa'i rig pa'i byed pas stong pa'i phyir na phyin ci log de nyid las shes pa gzhan gyi 'du byed pas byas te de ltar snang yang de ltar
translated: Although this conceptualization arises as the nature of the adherence to an entity under the influence of the object, it is not the manifestation of memory because it is empty of the activity of the cognition produced by the object.

original: rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa nyid du gsal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin pa'i phyir dran pa nyid du gsal ba ma yin no //
translated: In this way, although it appears, it is not the manifestation of memory because it is not the conceptualization of that.

original: dngos pos byas pa'i dngos po rig pa'i byed pas stong yang rnam pa de lta bu'i bag chags la brten pa zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
analyzed: dngos pos byas pa'i dngos po rig pa'i byed pas stong yang rnam pa de lta bu'i bag chags la brten pa zhes bya ba 'di gang las she na /
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the cognition of an entity is empty of the activity of the entity, it is said to be ‚Äòbased on the latent impressions of that kind.‚Äô How is this?

original: dngos pos nye bar sbyor ba med kyang shes pa gzhan gyi 'du byed kyi rtsa ba can nyid ni dran pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / spyi rtogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa snga ma'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug par grub pa'i phyir dang 'di'i myong ba ma yin pa'i byed pas ni des gzur ba'i yul dang mtshams sbyor bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos pos nye bar sbyor ba med kyang shes pa gzhan gyi 'du byed kyi rtsa ba can nyid ni dran pa la dmigs pa'i phyir dang / spyi rtogs pa nyid kyis rtogs pa snga ma'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug par grub pa'i phyir dang 'di'i myong ba ma yin pa'i byed pas ni des gzur ba'i yul dang mtshams sbyor bar rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though there is no application of an entity, it is the root of the activity of another cognition because it is the object of memory, because it is established that the understanding of a universal is the activity of the previous understanding, and because the activity of that which is not its experience is understood to be the connection with the object that it excludes.

original: des na don gyi yul can gyi spyi'i shes pa gang yin pa da dag gi rgyu mtshan ni gnyis yin te /
analyzed: des na don gyi yul can gyi spyi'i shes pa gang yin pa da dag gi rgyu mtshan ni gnyis yin te /
translated: Therefore, the cause of the cognition of a universal that has an object as its object is twofold.

original: don dmigs par byed pa'i rtogs pa gzhan dang 'du byed de'o //
analyzed: don dmigs par byed pa'i rtogs pa gzhan dang 'du byed de'o //
translated: The other cognition that causes the object to be perceived and the activity.

original: don gyi nye bar sbyor ba med na /
analyzed: don gyi nye bar sbyor ba med na /
translated: If there is no application of an object,

original: 'du byed pa 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'du byed pa 'ba' zhig lus pa yin no //
translated: only the activity remains.

original: de yang spyi smra ba @203a * //
analyzed: de yang spyi smra ba @203a * //
translated: Furthermore, the general is spoken of.üîΩüîΩ

original: rnams kyi ltar na thog ma dang bcas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnams kyi ltar na thog ma dang bcas pa nyid do //
translated: Moreover, according to the general opinion, it is beginningless.

original: spyi rtogs pa mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum gyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi rtogs pa mngon sum nyid yin pa'i phyir dang / mngon sum gyi rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the understanding of the universal is direct perception, and because it has direct perception as its root.

original: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa phyi ma'i dngos po'i sbyor bas stong ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas na de yang rnam par rtog pa yang snga ma'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir thog ma med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rnam par rtog pa phyi ma'i dngos po'i sbyor bas stong ba'i rnam par rtog pa'i rtsa ba can yin pas na de yang rnam par rtog pa yang snga ma'i rtsa ba can yin pa'i phyir thog ma med pa kho na'o //
translated: But here, the understanding of the universal has as its root the conceptualization that is empty of the connection with the entity of the subsequent conceptualization. Therefore, that conceptualization also has as its root the prior conceptualization. Thus, it is beginningless.

original: des na spyi'i blo 'di ni de ltar skye ba yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi'i blo 'di ni de ltar skye ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the understanding of the universal arises in this way.

original: des na de'i snang ba la brten nas ba lang gi tshig gi don spyi dang / autpala nyid sngon po nyid dang gzhi mthun pa nyid do zhes rnam par gzhag par byed do ;
analyzed: des na de'i snang ba la brten nas ba lang gi tshig gi don spyi dang / autpala nyid sngon po nyid dang gzhi mthun pa nyid do zhes rnam par gzhag par byed do ;
translated: Thus, based on the appearance of that , one posits the universal that is the meaning of the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù and the common locus of ‚Äúblue‚Äù and ‚Äúlotus.‚Äù

original: / phan tshun rjes su 'brel bar rtogs pa'i phyir gyi //
analyzed: / phan tshun rjes su 'brel bar rtogs pa'i phyir gyi //
translated: Because it is understood to be mutually related.

original: 'dir gzhir gyur pa'i chos can gsum pa ni 'ga' yang snang ba med do //
analyzed: 'dir gzhir gyur pa'i chos can gsum pa ni 'ga' yang snang ba med do //
translated: But there is no third type of entity that is the basis of the word.

original: 'o na ji ltar gzhi mthun pa'i tshig tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar gzhi mthun pa'i tshig tha dad par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How then can there be a common locus?

original: mu stegs gzhan la grags pa yin par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: mu stegs gzhan la grags pa yin par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that this is accepted by other tƒ´rthikas,

original: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /üîΩdon med bzhin du yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni / don med bzhin du yang zhes smos so //
translated: but not by the power of entities.üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúeven though it does not exist‚Äù is stated.

original: med pa yang yin la don yang yin pa don med pa ste /
analyzed: med pa yang yin la don yang yin pa don med pa ste /
translated: It is a nonexistent object.

original: spyi dang gzhi mthun bdag kyang de lta bu yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang gzhi mthun bdag kyang de lta bu yin no //
translated: A universal and a common locus are also like that.

original: ji ltar zhe na don rnams la zhes smos so //
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na don rnams la zhes smos so //
translated: How so? The phrase ‚Äúin relation to objects‚Äù is stated.

original: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'brel pa dang tha dad pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i rtogs pa'i rgyu mtshan ni 'brel pa dang tha dad pa kho na yin na /
translated: The reason for the conception of a universal and a common locus is only a connection and difference.

original: de gnyis ni don rnams la mi srid do //
analyzed: de gnyis ni don rnams la mi srid do //
translated: Those two are not possible in relation to objects.

original: khra bo la sogs pa tha dad pa las ba lang nyid gzhan ma yin par ji ltar khyad par gzhan dang 'dre bar 'gyur /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa tha dad pa las ba lang nyid gzhan ma yin par ji ltar khyad par gzhan dang 'dre bar 'gyur /
translated: How can cow be different from the different things such as the variegated [cow]?

original: de ltar yang srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible that it is like that.

original: khra bo las gzhan pa'i ba lang nyid dam ser skya de nyid yin ba ni mi srid do //
analyzed: khra bo las gzhan pa'i ba lang nyid dam ser skya de nyid yin ba ni mi srid do //
translated: It is impossible that the cow is just the ox or the tawny one, which are different from the variegated one.

original: de bzhin du gzhi mthun pa yang tha dad pa la brten pa 'dre ba'i mthar thug pa can yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhi mthun pa yang tha dad pa la brten pa 'dre ba'i mthar thug pa can yin no //
translated: In the same way, a common locus is based on the different, and it ends up being a mixture.

original: de rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa'i phyir sngon po'i mtshan nyid kyi chos autpala'i mtshan nyid las tha dad par rtogs pa las /
analyzed: de rtogs pa na ma rtogs pa'i phyir sngon po'i mtshan nyid kyi chos autpala'i mtshan nyid las tha dad par rtogs pa las /
translated: When that is understood, the other is not understood, because the property of the definition of blue is understood as different from the definition of the lotus.

original: yang de ltar rtogs pa na /
analyzed: yang de ltar rtogs pa na /
translated: When that is understood in that way,

original: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba la brten pas de dang rang bzhin gcig nyid du /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su 'gro ba la brten pas de dang rang bzhin gcig nyid du /
translated: based on that concomitance, the nature of that is the same as the nature of the other,

original: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: autpala sngon po la sogs pa'i rtogs pa rnams la snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and it appears in the understanding of the blue lotus, etc.

original: des na 'di gnyi ga yang don rnam par 'grel pa dang tha dad pa'i rtsa ba can yin la /
analyzed: des na 'di gnyi ga yang don rnam par 'grel pa dang tha dad pa'i rtsa ba can yin la /
translated: Therefore, both of these are based on the root of distinguishing the meaning,

original: de gnyis kyang don la srid pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub par 'gyur bar ro//
analyzed: de gnyis kyang don la srid pa ma yin no zhes bsgrub par 'gyur bar ro//
translated: and those two are not possible in the meaning. Thus it is established.

original: @203b de ltar spyi med kyang blo la de ltar snang ngo zhes bstan nas blo de gzhan sel pa'i blo nyid du bstan pa ni de thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: @203b de ltar spyi med kyang blo la de ltar snang ngo zhes bstan nas blo de gzhan sel pa'i blo nyid du bstan pa ni de thams cad kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having thus shown that although there is no universal, it appears as such to the mind, he now shows that mind is itself the cognition of the exclusion of other: ‚Äúof all of them.‚Äù

original: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po la sogs pa de thams cad kyi rten ni gzhan dag las tha dad pa'i don rnams yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po la sogs pa de thams cad kyi rten ni gzhan dag las tha dad pa'i don rnams yin no //
translated: The basis of all those things such as the universal, the common locus, and the substratum is the things that are different from other things.

original: ji ltar gzhan dag las tha dad pa de ston pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan dag las tha dad pa de ston pa ni /
translated: He shows how they are different from other things:

original: de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can nyid kyis zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can nyid kyis zhes smos so //
translated: ‚Äúby virtue of their effects and causes.‚Äù

original: rnam par nges pa can nyid kyis don rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas na de las gzhan pa las ldog pa yin no //üîΩrnam par nges pa nyid kyang khyad par can gyi rgyu can nyid dam /üîΩkhyad par can gyi 'bras bu can nyid dam /
analyzed: rnam par nges pa can nyid kyis don rnams de'i rang bzhin ma yin pas na de las gzhan pa las ldog pa yin no // rnam par nges pa nyid kyang khyad par can gyi rgyu can nyid dam / khyad par can gyi 'bras bu can nyid dam /
translated: Since the things are not of the nature of that [universal], they are distinguished from other things by virtue of their determination.

original: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa khyad par can gyi rang bzhin gyis yin no //
analyzed: sngon po dang ser po la sogs pa khyad par can gyi rang bzhin gyis yin no //
translated: Determination is by virtue of being the cause of the particular or being the effect of the particular, or by virtue of being the nature of the particular, such as blue or yellow.

original: de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu dang rgyu can smos pa ni nye bar mtshon pa yin no //
translated: The mention of the result and the cause of that is by way of illustration.

original: dbye bar bya ba'i don la brten pa nyid kyis spyi la sogs pa'i sa bon ni tha dad pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: dbye bar bya ba'i don la brten pa nyid kyis spyi la sogs pa'i sa bon ni tha dad pa yin par brjod do //
translated: The seed of the universal, etc., is said to be different, because it is the basis of the object to be differentiated.

original: des na blo 'di na sa bon las rang gi ngo bo thob pa'i phyir 'di ldog pa'i blo yin no //
analyzed: des na blo 'di na sa bon las rang gi ngo bo thob pa'i phyir 'di ldog pa'i blo yin no //
translated: Therefore, this cognition is a cognition of difference, because it obtains its own nature from the seed.

original: 'di yang phan tshun du tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon yin zhes bya ba der ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang phan tshun du tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon yin zhes bya ba der ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: And this is the seed of the difference of those from each other. That is what is being shown.

original: des na 'di ldog pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir de la snang bzhin pa dang / ngo bo gang gis snang ba de bzhin ldog pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na 'di ldog pa'i blo yin pa'i phyir de la snang bzhin pa dang / ngo bo gang gis snang ba de bzhin ldog pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, this is a cognition of difference, because it is a cognition of difference. And that which appears as that, and in which nature it appears, that is called the difference.

original: dngos po la dngos po gzhan med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa 'di'i sa bon du 'gyur ba yin pas na 'di ni ldog pa rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: dngos po la dngos po gzhan med pa'i rang bzhin gyi ldog pa gang yin pa de ni shes pa 'di'i sa bon du 'gyur ba yin pas na 'di ni ldog pa rtogs pa yin no //
translated: That difference which is the nature of the non-existence of another entity in an entity becomes the seed of this cognition. Therefore, this is the cognition of difference.

original: de ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa la ltos nas ji ltar rtogs pa'i blo yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir sgras kyang zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis dmigs pa la ltos nas ji ltar rtogs pa'i blo yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir sgras kyang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to show that it is the cognition that understands in dependence on the object, as explained above, he says, ‚ÄúAlso by the word.‚Äù

original: sgras kyang sgro 'dogs pa'i sgro nas mi 'dod pa sbyor ba spangs te zhes bya ba'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pas rtogs pa po 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: sgras kyang sgro 'dogs pa'i sgro nas mi 'dod pa sbyor ba spangs te zhes bya ba'i sgro 'dogs pa rnam par gcod pas rtogs pa po 'jug par byed do //
translated: Also by the word, one should avoid applying the word ‚Äúnonexistent‚Äù through superimposition, and the word ‚Äúexistent‚Äù through denial. Thus, the word causes the cognizer to engage by eliminating superimposition.

original: 'jug pa de yang de ltar rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa rnams gcad pas rtogs par byed pas zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa de yang de ltar rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir sgro 'dogs pa rnams gcad pas rtogs par byed pas zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: And that engagement is called ‚Äúunderstanding‚Äù because it is the understanding of the object in that way.

original: de ltar rtogs pa de yang rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa yin bas gzhan sel ba'i yul can du 'di ji ltar rtogs she na zhes rgol ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa de yang rnam par gcod pa rtogs pa yin bas gzhan sel ba'i yul can du 'di ji ltar rtogs she na zhes rgol ba bkod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis sngar bstan zin to //
translated: How is it that this understanding is the object of other-exclusion? This was previously explained in the context of the objection.

original: med do zhes kyang khas len pa de ltar na yang @204a * //
analyzed: med do zhes kyang khas len pa de ltar na yang @204a * //
translated: Even though one accepts that it does not exist,

original: blo la snang ba yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa spyi la sogs pa don med pa de gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: blo la snang ba yin no zhes bya ba gang yin pa spyi la sogs pa don med pa de gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is this useless universal, etc. that appears to the mind?

original: de rang gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de rang gi ngo bo nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate its nature, he says:

original: de la zhes smos te /
analyzed: de la zhes smos te /
translated: In that regard,

original: don gyi phan 'dogs pa la mi ltos par /
analyzed: don gyi phan 'dogs pa la mi ltos par /
translated: without depending on the benefit of an object,

original: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis de lta bu'i blo skye ba zhes rnam par gnas pa la'o //
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i bag chags kyi dbang gis de lta bu'i blo skye ba zhes rnam par gnas pa la'o //
translated: the mind arises in that way due to the power of beginningless predispositions.

original: gcig po zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig po zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúone‚Äù refers to the nature of a universal.

original: du ma las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i rten gyi don to //üîΩsgra rnams kyi yul du byed cing de yang blo la snang ba'i dbang gis te zlo la snang bar gyur pa'i mthus yin no //
analyzed: du ma las ldog pa zhes bya ba ni gzhi mthun pa'i rten gyi don to // sgra rnams kyi yul du byed cing de yang blo la snang ba'i dbang gis te zlo la snang bar gyur pa'i mthus yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúturns away from many‚Äù means the object of a common basis.üîΩIt makes the objects of words its object, and that is due to the power of the appearance in the mind, due to the power of the appearance in the mind that has become manifest.

original: gang gi phyir blo la rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin du snang ba des na sgra rnams kyi yul du byed pa'i phyir blo la snang ba'i dbang gis yul du byed par brjod do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo la rnam pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin du snang ba des na sgra rnams kyi yul du byed pa'i phyir blo la snang ba'i dbang gis yul du byed par brjod do //
translated: Because the mind appears in that way, with that nature, it makes the objects of words its object. Therefore it is said that it makes its object due to the power of the appearance in the mind.

original: blo la snang ba yang blo'i rnam pa kho na yin pas de lta bur gyur pa'i don ni blo'i rnam pa nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: blo la snang ba yang blo'i rnam pa kho na yin pas de lta bur gyur pa'i don ni blo'i rnam pa nyid yin par brjod pa yin no //
translated: And since what appears to the mind is only the aspect of the mind, the object that is such is said to be the aspect of the mind.

original: gal te de lta bu'i don blo'i rnam pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu'i don blo'i rnam pa nyid yin na /
translated: If the object is the aspect of the mind,

original: da ji ltar spyi 'ga' yang med ces brjod ce na /
analyzed: da ji ltar spyi 'ga' yang med ces brjod ce na /
translated: how can it be said that there is no universal at all?

original: phyi rol gyi don gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos pa zhes smos so //
translated: It is said that it does not depend on the reality of external objects.

original: gal te phyi'i don de lta bu 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
analyzed: gal te phyi'i don de lta bu 'ga' zhig yod na ni /
translated: If there were any such external object,

original: de bzhin du blo yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du spyi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de bzhin du blo yang de ltar snang ba'i phyir sngon po la sogs pa bzhin du spyi dngos po yod par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then just as the mind appears in that way, like blue and so on, the universal would be an existent thing.

original: de ni ma yin pas na spyi med par brjod pa 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni ma yin pas na spyi med par brjod pa 'thad pa yin no //
translated: But since that is not the case, it is tenable to say that the universal does not exist.

original: gal te phyi rol de lta bu yod pa blos rjes su byed na phyi rol gyi de lta bu nyid blos mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te phyi rol de lta bu yod pa blos rjes su byed na phyi rol gyi de lta bu nyid blos mthong ba zhes bya bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If the mind conforms to the existence of such an external object, it is not that the mind sees such an external object.

original: phyi rol med kyang de lta bu'i blo nyid spyir 'gyur mdo ce na /
analyzed: phyi rol med kyang de lta bu'i blo nyid spyir 'gyur mdo ce na /
translated: If you say that such a cognition is a universal because it is a general mental state, even though external objects do not exist,

original: de'i dngos por nges pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i dngos por nges pa zhes smos so //
translated: then the text says, ‚Äúit is ascertained as its entity.‚Äù

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don gyi de kho na nyid ces brjod pa bzung ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi don gyi de kho na nyid ces brjod pa bzung ba yin no //
translated: ‚Äú Its‚Äù refers to the reality of external objects.

original: blo'i snang ba ni phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid du nges pa yin te /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba ni phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid du nges pa yin te /
translated: The appearance of cognition is ascertained as the reality of external objects.

original: 'di shes pa'i rnam pa yang don gyi de kho na nyid du lhag par zhen par byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di shes pa'i rnam pa yang don gyi de kho na nyid du lhag par zhen par byas pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The aspect of the cognition of that is taken to be the reality of the object. This is the meaning of the text.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gal te gzhan dang gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir phyi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
analyzed: gal te gzhan dang gcig tu gyur pa'i phyir phyi'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'am /
translated: If it were the nature of external objects because it is one with them,

original: du ma la sogs pa 'di rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa yin na /
analyzed: du ma la sogs pa 'di rtogs pa'i rang bzhin ltar rang gi bdag nyid la rnam par gnas pa yin na /
translated: or if it were to exist in itself in the way that the nature of the cognition of multiplicity, etc.

original: de'i tshe spyi yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi yin par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: exists, then it would be a universal.

original: de ltar ni ma yin @204b no ;
analyzed: de ltar ni ma yin @204b no ;
translated: But that is not the case.

original: / de ni don 'di nyid du nges pa'i phyir 'di don rnams kyi rang bzhin gcig yin par des pa yin na /
analyzed: / de ni don 'di nyid du nges pa'i phyir 'di don rnams kyi rang bzhin gcig yin par des pa yin na /
translated: Since it is ascertained in this very meaning, it is certain that the nature of the objects is one.

original: blo'i snang bas ni de rnams de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i snang bas ni de rnams de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: But the appearance of the cognition is not like that.

original: de'i phyir spyi ni don med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi ni don med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is meaningless.

original: 'di thams cad ni ldog pa'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na mdor bsdus te brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni ldog pa'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid yin pas na mdor bsdus te brjod pa yin no //
translated: All of this is the nature of the universal of exclusion, so it is stated in brief.

original: de la ji ltar spyi med pa dang dngos po tha dad pa spyi'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang blo'i snang ba sgra'i don dang spyi'i rang bzhin nyid dang don med pa nyid ni 'og nas de dang der rgyas par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la ji ltar spyi med pa dang dngos po tha dad pa spyi'i rgyu mtshan yin pa dang blo'i snang ba sgra'i don dang spyi'i rang bzhin nyid dang don med pa nyid ni 'og nas de dang der rgyas par sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: There, the absence of the universal, the difference of the things, the cause of the universal, the appearance of the cognition, the meaning of the word, the nature of the universal, and the meaninglessness will be established in detail below.

original: ji ltar 'di sgra rnams kyi yul yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di sgra rnams kyi yul yin pa de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yang yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Just as it is the object of words, so it is also the object of conceptual thoughts. This is stated:

original: de nyams su myong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cognition of that . . .‚Äù

original: yang na sgra rnams kyi sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul du byed cing zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yang na sgra rnams kyi sgo nas rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul du byed cing zhes 'brel to //
translated: Or else, the words ‚Äúas objects of conceptualization‚Äù are connected with the words ‚Äúin the form of words.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid 'dzin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the apprehension of external reality.

original: des na phyi rol nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las skye ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
analyzed: des na phyi rol nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las skye ba can gyi rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúarising from the latent impressions of the experience of external things‚Äù is that they are conceptualizations.

original: sngar ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags la rten par byed la /
analyzed: sngar ni thog ma med pa'i bag chags la rten par byed la /
translated: Previously, it was said that they are based on beginningless latent impressions.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags ni thog ma dang bcas pa yin pa des na rnam par rtog pa rnams bag chags nyid las byung bar brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags ni thog ma dang bcas pa yin pa des na rnam par rtog pa rnams bag chags nyid las byung bar brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since the latent impressions of experience are associated with a beginning, it is said that conceptualizations arise from latent impressions.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis ni rnam par rtog pa tsam la snang ba spyi la sogs pa rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyis ni rnam par rtog pa tsam la snang ba spyi la sogs pa rtogs pa yin la /
translated: In this regard, the latent impressions of conceptualization are the understanding of the appearance of mere conceptualization, such as the universal.

original: gzhan dang gzhan tha dad par rtogs pa ni nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis yin no //
analyzed: gzhan dang gzhan tha dad par rtogs pa ni nyams su myong ba'i bag chags kyis yin no //
translated: The understanding of the difference of one thing from another is due to the latent impressions of experience.

original: nyams su myong ba yang sngon po med pa'i don rtogs pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas na rnam par rtog pas sngon po med pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba yang sngon po med pa'i don rtogs pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pas na rnam par rtog pas sngon po med pa'i don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Also, the experience is of the nature of merely understanding the meaning of the absence of blue, and therefore, the conceptual cognition is the cause of understanding the meaning of the absence of blue.

original: de bas na 'dir mngon sum bzhin du mngon sum ma yin pa yang bag chags kyi rten nyid yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bas na 'dir mngon sum bzhin du mngon sum ma yin pa yang bag chags kyi rten nyid yin par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, in this case, even though it is not direct perception like direct perception, it is the basis of latent impressions.

original: zla ba gnyis su rnam par rtog pa la zla ba gnyis su shes pa'am /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis su rnam par rtog pa la zla ba gnyis su shes pa'am /
translated: For example, in the case of the cognition of two moons due to a conceptual cognition,

original: rmi lam du mthong ba'i don rnam par rtog pa la rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du mthong ba'i don rnam par rtog pa la rmi lam gyi shes pa bzhin no //
translated: or in the case of dream cognition due to the conceptual cognition of objects seen in a dream.

original: de ltar na gal te rgyu mtshan gzhan las kyang snga na med pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par 'gyur na /
analyzed: de ltar na gal te rgyu mtshan gzhan las kyang snga na med pa'i rang bzhin rtogs par 'gyur na /
translated: Thus, if the nature of the non-existent were understood from another reason,

original: de'i tshe de yang bag chags 'jog par byed pa yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de yang bag chags 'jog par byed pa yin par 'gyur te /
translated: then that would also be the basis of latent impressions.

original: dper na de ltar yongs su rtogs @205a * //
analyzed: dper na de ltar yongs su rtogs @205a * //
translated: For example, it is like the complete understanding of the non-existent in a dream.

original: par byed pa rnams kyi gtsug lag gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: par byed pa rnams kyi gtsug lag gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yin pa bzhin no //
translated: like the principal scriptures of the NaiyƒÅyikas and the concepts of ƒ™≈õvara, etc.

original: de dag gis bag chags de 'dra ba de yang ga las she na /
analyzed: de dag gis bag chags de 'dra ba de yang ga las she na /
translated: And how is that kind of latent impression in them?

original: log par brtags pa'i rtags kyi rtsa ba can gyi rjes su 'brang ba las so zhes brjod do //üîΩrnam par rtog pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin nam /
analyzed: log par brtags pa'i rtags kyi rtsa ba can gyi rjes su 'brang ba las so zhes brjod do // rnam par rtog pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin nam /
translated: It is said that it is from the pursuit of the root of the misconception.üîΩA concept is not a revealer of a previously unknown object, like a cognition of blue, etc.,

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du snga na med pa'i rtogs par bya ba rtogs par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin du snga na med pa'i rtogs par bya ba rtogs par byed pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: or like a cognition of two moons, etc.

original: ji ltar snga na med pa'i don snang ba can gyis mngon sum mam /
analyzed: ji ltar snga na med pa'i don snang ba can gyis mngon sum mam /
translated: Just as a perception that has the appearance of a previously unknown object

original: der snang bas bskyed pa bzhin du de lta bu'i dngos po'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rtags kyis rtogs pa las kyang skye ba yin no //
analyzed: der snang bas bskyed pa bzhin du de lta bu'i dngos po'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba rtags kyis rtogs pa las kyang skye ba yin no //
translated: or is produced by the appearance of that is born from the pursuit of a reason that is a property of a real entity of that kind.

original: de lta mod kyi de lta bu'i dngos po'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba na /
analyzed: de lta mod kyi de lta bu'i dngos po'i chos kyi rjes su 'brang ba na /
translated: However, when there is the pursuit of a property of a real entity of that kind,

original: mi shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa ltar snang bas snga na med pa'i don rtogs te /
analyzed: mi shes pa ni rjes su dpag pa ltar snang bas snga na med pa'i don rtogs te /
translated: The ignorant, like the one who infers the non-existent pot, understand the meaning of the non-existent.

original: gtso bo la sogs pa yang rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gtso bo la sogs pa yang rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: They also understand the existent, such as the principle.

original: mkhas pa dag la ni yang dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mkhas pa dag la ni yang dag pa'i rjes su dpag pa ste mi rtag pa dang bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rtogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The wise, like the one who infers correctly, understand impermanence, selflessness, and so on.

original: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i sgra thos pa las nyams su myong ba tsam kho nar ni mkhas pa rnams kyis mngon bar zhen par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyams su myong ba'i sgra thos pa las nyams su myong ba tsam kho nar ni mkhas pa rnams kyis mngon bar zhen par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the wise do not conceive of mere experience from hearing the word experience.

original: 'on kyang ji ltar nyams su myong ba'am der snang ba rang gi mthus dngos po 'am /
analyzed: 'on kyang ji ltar nyams su myong ba'am der snang ba rang gi mthus dngos po 'am /
translated: However, when one understands the thing as it is experienced or as it appears through its own power,

original: de las gzhan rtogs par byed pa na rnag gi mthus rtogs par mi nus pa'i rtogs pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de las gzhan rtogs par byed pa na rnag gi mthus rtogs par mi nus pa'i rtogs pa skyed par byed pa de bzhin du /
translated: or when one understands something other than that through the power of that, one generates an understanding that cannot be generated through the power of that.

original: rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bas kyang rnam par rtog pa skye la /
