analyzed: rtags kyi rjes su 'brang bas kyang rnam par rtog pa skye la /
translated: In the same way, when one follows the reason, a conception arises.

original: de ltar de rang dbang du rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de rang dbang du rtogs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: However, it is not that it is understood autonomously in that way.

original: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags yod pa tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa skye ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang de sad pa las yin te /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i bag chags yod pa tsam gyis rnam par rtog pa skye ba yang ma yin gyi 'on kyang de sad pa las yin te /
translated: It is not that a conceptual thought arises merely through the existence of a latent impression of experience. Rather, it arises from the awakening of that latent impression.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If that were not so,

original: rtag tu skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩde'i dngos po nges pa'i don ces don dam par yang de'i dngos po nges pa zhes bya ba la ji ltar dogs pa bsus te sbyar ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: rtag tu skye bar thal ba'i phyir ro // de'i dngos po nges pa'i don ces don dam par yang de'i dngos po nges pa zhes bya ba la ji ltar dogs pa bsus te sbyar ba de bzhin du /
translated: it would follow that conceptual thoughts would arise constantly.üîΩJust as the phrase ‚Äúhaving the nature of ascertaining the object‚Äù is applied in the sense of ‚Äúhaving the nature of ascertaining the object ultimately,‚Äù

original: don dang lhan cig pa'i sgras sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: don dang lhan cig pa'i sgras sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: so too should the phrase ‚Äúhaving the object‚Äù be applied in the sense of ‚Äúhaving the object ultimately.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du de'i dngos po nges pa'i don can rnams kyis zhes 'dogs pa gzhan du yang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du de'i dngos po nges pa'i don can rnams kyis zhes 'dogs pa gzhan du yang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase ‚Äúhaving the nature of ascertaining the object‚Äù should be understood to be used in other contexts as well.

original: 'dir @205b 'don pa gnyis ka las yang gcig pu du ma la sogs pa sgra rnams kyis yul du byed cing zhes de nyid yul du brjod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir @205b 'don pa gnyis ka las yang gcig pu du ma la sogs pa sgra rnams kyis yul du byed cing zhes de nyid yul du brjod par 'gyur ro //
translated: In this context, both the root text and the commentary say, ‚ÄúThe words ‚Äòone,‚Äô ‚Äòmany,‚Äô and so on make that the object.‚ÄùüîΩThat is to say, they make that the object of the mind.

original: de yang blo la snang ba'i dbang gis zhes bya bas blo la snang bar grub pa na /
analyzed: de yang blo la snang ba'i dbang gis zhes bya bas blo la snang bar grub pa na /
translated: And that is established as appearing to the mind, as the phrase ‚Äúthrough the power of appearing to the mind‚Äù indicates.

original: phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol de lta bu nyid bkag na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol de lta bu nyid bkag na /
translated: ‚ÄúNot depending on external reality‚Äù means that when such external reality is refuted,

original: blo la snang ba tsam du grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: blo la snang ba tsam du grub pa kho na'o //
translated: it is established as mere appearance to the mind.

original: de bzhin du don gyi sgra yang logs su 'brel par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du don gyi sgra yang logs su 'brel par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the term ‚Äúobject‚Äù should be understood as a separate connection.

original: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po brjod pa gang yin pa de la phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos par blo la snang ba'i dbang gis yul du byas pa gang yin pa de nyid yin na zhes brjod par bstan pa'i phyir de nyid la
analyzed: chos dang chos can gyi dngos po brjod pa gang yin pa de la phyi rol gyi de kho na nyid la mi ltos par blo la snang ba'i dbang gis yul du byas pa gang yin pa de nyid yin na zhes brjod par bstan pa'i phyir de nyid la
translated: In order to demonstrate that the expression of the relation between the property and the subject is just that, which is made into an object by the power of appearance to the mind without depending on external reality, he says ‚Äújust that‚Äù

original: zhes smos so //
analyzed: zhes smos so //
translated: in the verse.

original: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces ba lang nyid dang de dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi tha snyad gang yin pa de ni de nyid du yin pa'i phyir de chos dang chos can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na de la tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces ba lang nyid dang de dang ldan pa'i chos can gyi tha snyad gang yin pa de ni de nyid du yin pa'i phyir de chos dang chos can gyi ngo bo nyid yin pas na de la tha snyad du 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir
translated: Here, since the convention of ‚Äúcow-ness‚Äù and the property possessor endowed with that is just that, because it is the nature of the property and the property possessor, it is said that ‚Äúit is just that.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni 'di'i chos dang chos can gyi rang bzhin nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni 'di'i chos dang chos can gyi rang bzhin nyid brjod do //
translated: This shows the nature of the property and the property-possessor.

original: des na chos kyi tha snyad dang chos can gyi tha snyad 'di ni de nyid la yin la de yang de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na chos kyi tha snyad dang chos can gyi tha snyad 'di ni de nyid la yin la de yang de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the convention of the property and the convention of the property-possessor are in relation to that, and that is not to be expressed as either the same or different.

original: de nyid ni de'i rang bzhin yin la de las tha dad pa ni gzhan nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid ni de'i rang bzhin yin la de las tha dad pa ni gzhan nyid do //
translated: That is its nature, and different from that is difference.

original: gang la ltos nas brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas brjod par bya ba ma yin pa de bshad pa ni /
translated: That which is not to be expressed in relation to what is explained is

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúmutually.‚Äù

original: chos kyi tha snyad gang yin pa de nyid chos can gyi tha snyad yin la /
analyzed: chos kyi tha snyad gang yin pa de nyid chos can gyi tha snyad yin la /
translated: The convention of the property is the convention of the property-possessor.

original: de nyid gang yin pa de kho na gzhan yin no zhes 'di gnyis phan tshun de'i rang bzhin ni med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid gang yin pa de kho na gzhan yin no zhes 'di gnyis phan tshun de'i rang bzhin ni med pa kho na'o //
translated: That which is that is the other. These two are mutually not its nature at all.

original: gzhan nyid kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Difference is also like that.

original: gal te de nyid kyi chos yin la de nyid chos can yin na /
analyzed: gal te de nyid kyi chos yin la de nyid chos can yin na /
translated: If it is the property of that, and that is the property-possessor,

original: de'i tshe 'di gnyis phan tshun gcig pa nyid na de dag gi tha snyad kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di gnyis phan tshun gcig pa nyid na de dag gi tha snyad kyang gcig nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, if these two were mutually identical, their conventions would be identical.

original: chos kyi tha snyad dang / chos can gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha dad pa rnam grangs tsam gyis byas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi tha snyad dang / chos can gyi tha snyad ces bya ba'i tha dad pa rnam grangs tsam gyis byas par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that the difference between the convention of the property and the convention of the property possessor is merely a matter of enumeration.

original: tha dad na yang tha snyad tha dad pa'i phyir chos dang chos can dag phan tshun de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin na tha snyad kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du brjod do //
analyzed: tha dad na yang tha snyad tha dad pa'i phyir chos dang chos can dag phan tshun de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin na tha snyad kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du brjod do //
translated: If they are different, because the conventions are different, the property and the property possessor cannot be said to be identical or different. Therefore, it is said that even the conventions cannot be said to exist.

original: de nyid kyi phyir chos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩchos ni chos bkar ba'i gzhir gyur @206a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir chos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // chos ni chos bkar ba'i gzhir gyur @206a * //
translated: For that reason, it says, ‚ÄúThe property is not different from the basis of the property.‚Äù

original: pa 'di zhes bstan pa'i chos can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa 'di zhes bstan pa'i chos can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: The property is not different from the basis of the property that is indicated as ‚Äúthis.‚Äù

original: de ni de las bkar ba bzhin pa nyid na de dang 'brel pas de las gzhan nyid du snang ba gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de las bkar ba bzhin pa nyid na de dang 'brel pas de las gzhan nyid du snang ba gzhan pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Because it is the basis of the property, it is not different from that. Because it is related to that, it is not different from that.

original: ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is this understood?

original: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi don gzhan gang yin pa de ni mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi don gzhan gang yin pa de ni mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the meaning of a different nature is not expressed.

original: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces rtogs pa'i don la tha dad pa'i rjod pa ni ci yang med de /
analyzed: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces rtogs pa'i don la tha dad pa'i rjod pa ni ci yang med de /
translated: In the cognition of this, ‚Äúthe nature of an ox,‚Äù there is no expression of difference at all,

original: de ltar rtogs bzhin pa ni de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs bzhin pa ni de las gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is being cognized is not different from that.

original: des na de ltar gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na de ltar gzhan du brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be expressed in that way as different.

original: de nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid du yang brjod par bya ba ma yin par bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation that it is not to be expressed in that way is:

original: de nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyang ma yin te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIt is not even that.‚Äù

original: de brjod pa dag ces bya ba ni chos can rjod pa dag go //
analyzed: de brjod pa dag ces bya ba ni chos can rjod pa dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThat expression‚Äù refers to the expression of the subject.

original: chos can rjod pa ni rnam par gcod pa gzhan 'phen pa yin te /
analyzed: chos can rjod pa ni rnam par gcod pa gzhan 'phen pa yin te /
translated: The expression of the subject is the projection of another exclusion.

original: des na gal te chos brjod pa yin na de ltar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na gal te chos brjod pa yin na de ltar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it is the expression of a property, that is the case.

original: de ltar ni mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni de ltar na ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni de ltar na ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation that it is not tenable in that way is ‚ÄúIn that case . . . ‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa 'di gang la yin zhe na bshad pa /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa 'di gang la yin zhe na bshad pa /
translated: If it is not to be expressed, what is it?

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid 'di ni sgra'i don la yin gyi /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid 'di ni sgra'i don la yin gyi /
translated: This inexpressibility is in regard to the meaning of the word,

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: not in regard to anything else.

original: dngos po la ni chos can las gzhan ma yin la /
analyzed: dngos po la ni chos can las gzhan ma yin la /
translated: In regard to things, the property possessor is not different from the property,

original: chos can yang chos las gzhan ma yin no //
analyzed: chos can yang chos las gzhan ma yin no //
translated: and the property is not different from the property possessor.

original: sgra'i don la ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dag ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don la ni gzhan dang gzhan ma yin pa dag ma yin no //
translated: In regard to the meaning of the word, they are neither different nor not different.

original: chos dang chos can nyid sgra'i don la de ltar yin gyi /
analyzed: chos dang chos can nyid sgra'i don la de ltar yin gyi /
translated: The property and property possessor are like that in regard to the meaning of the word,

original: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa dag ni ma yin no //
translated: but they are not like that in regard to universals and common loci.

original: de nyid bstan pa ni dngos po la ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa ni dngos po la ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To demonstrate just that, he says, ‚ÄúIn regard to things‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
analyzed: ni'i sgra ni gang gi phyir gyi don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause.‚Äù

original: gang gi phyir dngos po la rang gi mtshan nyid las spyi'i mtshan nyid de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi sgra'i don la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir dngos po la rang gi mtshan nyid las spyi'i mtshan nyid de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin gyi sgra'i don la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because in regard to things, the universal is not expressible as either the same as or different from the particular, but in regard to the meaning of the word, it is not so.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig med pa de ni yod pa dang lhan cig rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig med pa de ni yod pa dang lhan cig rang bzhin gcig tu mi 'gyur la /
translated: Thus, that which does not exist does not have the same nature as that which exists.

original: de las gzhan par yang ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan par yang ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is not different from that, because it does not exist.

original: 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bsam pa yin te /
translated: The idea is as follows:

original: sgra'i don la chos kyi sgras rang bzhin de nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i sgo nas tha dad par bstan pas na /
analyzed: sgra'i don la chos kyi sgras rang bzhin de nyid khyad par gzhan spangs pa'i sgo nas tha dad par bstan pas na /
translated: In the case of the meaning of a word, the word ‚Äúnature‚Äù indicates that very nature by way of excluding other attributes.

original: de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan dag tu brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is not to be expressed as either that or other.

original: spyi rnams ni sgra'i don la gzhan pa nyid de /
analyzed: spyi rnams ni sgra'i don la gzhan pa nyid de /
translated: Universals are different from the meaning of a word,

original: ba lang dkar po zhes ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba lang dkar po zhes ba lang nyid dang dkar po nyid gnyis tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the whiteness and cowness in the phrase ‚Äúwhite cow‚Äù are different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gzhi mthun pa la chos @206b rnams tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gzhi mthun pa la chos @206b rnams tha dad pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is only in a common locus that phenomena are different.

original: ji ltar rnam par rtog pas bzung ba'i spyi'i rang bzhin la ltos nas de dngos su na rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa'i phyir dngos po la brjod par bya ba ma yin par brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par rtog pas bzung ba'i spyi'i rang bzhin la ltos nas de dngos su na rang gi mtshan nyid du med pa'i phyir dngos po la brjod par bya ba ma yin par brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the nature of a universal that is apprehended by conception does not exist as its own nature in reality, and therefore is said not to be expressible in things,

original: chos dang chos can dag kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //üîΩji ltar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong bas chod pas rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnam par rtog pa yod pa la ltos nas ni ji ltar nges pa bzhin phyi rol na yod pa'i spyi rnams dang chos dang chos can
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o // ji ltar kun brtags pa'i rang bzhin nyams su myong bas chod pas rnam pa 'ga' zhig gis phyin ci log tu gyur pa rnam par rtog pa yod pa la ltos nas ni ji ltar nges pa bzhin phyi rol na yod pa'i spyi rnams dang chos dang chos can
translated: The property and the property-possessor are also not the objects of expression.

original: rnams gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o ;
analyzed: rnams gzhan ma yin pa kho na'o ;
translated: Since the imagined nature is blocked by the experience of the dependent nature, the conceptual thought that is mistaken in some way in regard to the existence of the aspects is in dependence on the universals that exist externally just as they are ascertained, the properties and the property-possessors are not different.

original: / de la yang 'di gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: / de la yang 'di gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, these two are possible:

original: chos can nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid chos nyid du rtogs pas na 'dir gzhan ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: chos can nyid du rtogs pa gang yin pa de nyid chos nyid du rtogs pas na 'dir gzhan ma yin pa yin la /
translated: That which is understood as the property-possessor is understood as the property itself, and thus they are not different here.

original: spyi rnams ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gang zhig ba lang zhes rtogs pa de nyid dkar po'o zhes rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de las de khyad par gzhan kho na'o //
analyzed: spyi rnams ni dngos po'i rang bzhin gang zhig ba lang zhes rtogs pa de nyid dkar po'o zhes rtogs pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang de las de khyad par gzhan kho na'o //
translated: However, the universals are not understood as the nature of things, such as that which is understood as a cow is understood as white, but rather they are different attributes of that.

original: de dag yod kyang de la tha dad pa mi bden pa'i phyir spyir /
analyzed: de dag yod kyang de la tha dad pa mi bden pa'i phyir spyir /
translated: Even though they exist, they are not truly different from that. Therefore, in general,

original: gzhan ma yin no zhes rnam par spros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan ma yin no zhes rnam par spros par 'gyur ro //
translated: It is not different.üîΩHere, it is said:

original: 'di la chos dang chos can dag / ces smos te /üîΩchos dang chos can dag tha dad pa ma yin na /
analyzed: 'di la chos dang chos can dag / ces smos te / chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa ma yin na /
translated: The property and the property-possessorüîΩare not different.üîΩIf the property and the property-possessor are not different,

original: drug pa la sogs pa mi rung zhes 'chad bar 'gyur ba dang bsgyur nas 'brel to //
analyzed: drug pa la sogs pa mi rung zhes 'chad bar 'gyur ba dang bsgyur nas 'brel to //
translated: the sixth case, etc., are not possible.

original: ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rung zhe na /
translated: How are they not possible?

original: tha dad pa la mthong ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: tha dad pa la mthong ba zhes smos so //
translated: It is said: ‚Äúin the case of difference.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: chos dang chos can dag gzhan nyid du brjod pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag gzhan nyid du brjod pa'i phyir brjod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the property and the property-possessor are expressed as different, they are not inexpressible.

original: chos ni chos can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te zhes gang bshad pa de ni ma yin te /
analyzed: chos ni chos can las gzhan pa yang ma yin te zhes gang bshad pa de ni ma yin te /
translated: The property is not different from the property-possessor.

original: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i drug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i drug pa med par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is not so, because it would follow that the genitive case in ‚Äúhis cowness‚Äù would not exist.

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni ba lang la ba lang nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni ba lang la ba lang nyid do zhes bya ba la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes ‚Äúa cow is a cow,‚Äù etc.

original: nyes pa gzhan yang bsags pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: nyes pa gzhan yang bsags pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: Another fault is stated because of the accumulation:

original: chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa ma yin na /üîΩmang po'i tshig gi bye brag chos can gcig la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa ma yin na / mang po'i tshig gi bye brag chos can gcig la mi rung ngo //
translated: If the property and the property-possessor are not different,üîΩthen the distinction of the pluralizing suffix is not appropriate for a single property-possessor.

original: chos can gcig la gcig gis bstan pas ni tshig gi bye brag ni de la ltos pa nyid kyis ni mang po'i tshig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //üîΩji ltar chos can gcig la tshig gi @207a * //
analyzed: chos can gcig la gcig gis bstan pas ni tshig gi bye brag ni de la ltos pa nyid kyis ni mang po'i tshig la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no // ji ltar chos can gcig la tshig gi @207a * //
translated: Since a single property-possessor is indicated by a single [suffix], the distinction of the pluralizing suffix is not appropriate for a single property-possessor.

original: bye brag mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: bye brag mi rung zhe na /
translated: How is it that the distinction of the pluralizing suffix is not appropriate for a single property-possessor?

original: chos mang pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: chos mang pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the multiplicity of properties.‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe ba lang nyid dang dngos po nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams ni ba lang gi chos yin no zhes chos can ba lang gcig gi chos mang ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig 'jug pa de'i tshe khyed kyi lta ba la 'di mi
analyzed: gang gi tshe ba lang nyid dang dngos po nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa rnams ni ba lang gi chos yin no zhes chos can ba lang gcig gi chos mang ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig 'jug pa de'i tshe khyed kyi lta ba la 'di mi
translated: When the multiplicity of the pluralizing suffix and so on is applied because of the multiplicity of the properties of a single property-possessor, such as cowness, entityness, impermanence, and so on, which are the properties of a single cow, then in your view, this is not

original: rung ngo // gal te tshig gi bye brag 'di chos can la ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos rnams nyid la yin pa des na ji ltar chos can gcig la mi rung zhes brjod /
analyzed: rung ngo // gal te tshig gi bye brag 'di chos can la ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang chos rnams nyid la yin pa des na ji ltar chos can gcig la mi rung zhes brjod /
translated: If this is not the case, then the distinction of words is not with respect to the subject, but rather with respect to the qualities themselves. In that case, why do you say that it is not suitable for a single subject?

original: 'on te chos can gcig la chos mang po mi rung ngo zhes bya bar brjod pa 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid brjod par rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te chos can gcig la chos mang po mi rung ngo zhes bya bar brjod pa 'dod pa yin na de'i tshe de nyid brjod par rigs so zhe na /
translated: If you maintain that it is not suitable for many qualities to belong to a single subject, then it is correct to say just that.

original: brjod pa 'di la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: brjod pa 'di la bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea behind this statement is as follows:

original: gang gi tshe chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: When the qualities and the subject are not different,

original: de'i chos mang ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig gi bye brag tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de chos can nyid la yin par thal bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de'i chos mang ba'i phyir mang po'i tshig gi bye brag tu 'gyur ba gang yin pa de chos can nyid la yin par thal bar 'gyur na /
translated: then it follows that the distinction of words as many would be with respect to the subject itself, because it has many qualities.

original: de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: But that is not the case.

original: chos can gcig la de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos can gcig la de 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is contradictory for a single subject to have many qualities.

original: gal te chos mang mod /
analyzed: gal te chos mang mod /
translated: If you say that there are many qualities,

original: de tsam gyis mang po'i tshig gi bye brag tu ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de tsam gyis mang po'i tshig gi bye brag tu ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: then how could that alone make the distinction of words as many?

original: bshad pa / de la zhes bya ba mang po la mthong ba'o //
analyzed: bshad pa / de la zhes bya ba mang po la mthong ba'o //
translated: The response: ‚ÄúThere‚Äù refers to the many.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad zin to zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad zin to zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute this, it says ‚Äúalready explained.‚Äù

original: ci zhig bshad zin /
analyzed: ci zhig bshad zin /
translated: What was already explained?

original: gal te khyad par gzhan spong ba dang / mi spong ba yin na drug pa tsam gzhung btsugs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gzhan spong ba dang / mi spong ba yin na drug pa tsam gzhung btsugs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If it is the case that the other distinctions are both abandoned and not abandoned, then the mere sixth case would be established as the text.

original: tshig gi bye brag la ji ltar lan du 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: tshig gi bye brag la ji ltar lan du 'gyur zhes dogs pa la /
translated: How could the specific words be the response?

original: 'dir lan du che ba'i bshad zin pa gang yin pa de ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'dir lan du che ba'i bshad zin pa gang yin pa de ston pa ni /
translated: In response to this doubt, the response is taught here:

original: sgra rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sgra rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúWith regard to the words . . .‚Äù

original: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan pa yin te /
translated: This is the teaching:

original: khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong bas nus tshad kyi rnam pa tsam zhig bstan mod kyi /
analyzed: khyad par gzhan spong ba dang mi spong bas nus tshad kyi rnam pa tsam zhig bstan mod kyi /
translated: Although the mere aspect of the measure of ability through abandoning and not abandoning the other distinctions is taught,

original: gcig tu 'chol ba'i rang bzhin gyi sgra'i tha snyad ni sgrub par nus pas na 'dir dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid lan du rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gcig tu 'chol ba'i rang bzhin gyi sgra'i tha snyad ni sgrub par nus pas na 'dir dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid lan du rigs pa yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: since the verbal conventions of the nature that is mixed as one can be established, it is reasonable that the response here is that it is not the object of entities.

original: 'di ni bdag cag la skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag cag la skyon du 'gyur ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not a fault for us.

original: 'on kyang pha rol po rnams nyid la yin no zhes bshad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang pha rol po rnams nyid la yin no zhes bshad pa ni gzhan yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But it is the other party who is so, as it has been explained.

original: rgol ba gang dag gi ltar na tshig ste sgra'i dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang yin gyi /
analyzed: rgol ba gang dag gi ltar na tshig ste sgra'i dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang yin gyi /
translated: Those who argue that the word, the entity of sound, is dependent on something else,

original: lhung gtso cher brjod par 'dod pa la @207b mi brten pa brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa de dag la ni ji skad du brjod pa'i brtsad par rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: lhung gtso cher brjod par 'dod pa la @207b mi brten pa brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa de dag la ni ji skad du brjod pa'i brtsad par rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: but not dependent on what is desired to be expressed, for them alone it is proper to argue as has been stated.

original: 'dir yang brjod par 'dod pa la lhur mi brten pa ni dngos po'i dbang gi gtan tshigs yin no //
analyzed: 'dir yang brjod par 'dod pa la lhur mi brten pa ni dngos po'i dbang gi gtan tshigs yin no //
translated: Here also, not being dependent on what is desired to be expressed is the reason based on fact.

original: brjod par 'dod pa ni ston par byad pa'i 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa ni ston par byad pa'i 'dod pa yin la /
translated: What is desired to be expressed is the desire to teach.

original: de yang dngos po las gzhan du gyur par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po'i dbang dang brjod par 'dod pa la brten pa nyid 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang dngos po las gzhan du gyur par yang 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos po'i dbang dang brjod par 'dod pa la brten pa nyid 'gal ba yin no //
translated: And that also becomes something other than the entity, so it is contradictory to be dependent on both the entity and what is desired to be expressed.

original: des na dngos po la brten par 'grub pa nyid ni dngos po la brten pa dang / 'gal ba brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin na 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na dngos po la brten par 'grub pa nyid ni dngos po la brten pa dang / 'gal ba brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin na 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the establishment of the dependent on the thing is the dependent on the thing, and not the other-dependent which is the object of the desire to express the contradictory.

original: sgra dag gi don gyi yul rtogs par dmigs pas na gnyis srid pa yin te /
analyzed: sgra dag gi don gyi yul rtogs par dmigs pas na gnyis srid pa yin te /
translated: The object of the words is the understanding of the object, and the two are possible,

original: dngos po'i dbang gis rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: dngos po'i dbang gis rtogs pa'am /
translated: because of the power of the thing,

original: ston pa po rnams kyis de ltar 'god pa la'o //
analyzed: ston pa po rnams kyis de ltar 'god pa la'o //
translated: or because of the arrangement of the teachers.

original: des na ston pa po rnams kyis ma bkod na dngos po gzhan dbang nyid do //
analyzed: des na ston pa po rnams kyis ma bkod na dngos po gzhan dbang nyid do //
translated: Therefore, if the teachers do not arrange, it is the other-dependent itself.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa'i phyir dngos po dang 'brel pa la nyes pa de 'jug la /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa'i phyir dngos po dang 'brel pa la nyes pa de 'jug la /
translated: In order to explain just this, he says, ‚ÄúThe fault applies to the connection with the thing,

original: dngos po dang 'brel pa brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin par gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel pa brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin par gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: and not to the other-dependent which is the object of the desire to express the connection with the thing.‚Äù ‚Äú If‚Äù and so on teach this.

original: gal te gzhan la rab tu grags pa'i sgra gzhan la dgod par 'dod pa yin yang dgod par bya mi nus na de'i tshe dngos po dang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan la rab tu grags pa'i sgra gzhan la dgod par 'dod pa yin yang dgod par bya mi nus na de'i tshe dngos po dang gzhan gyi dbang nyid du nges par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If one wishes to apply a term that is well known to others to something else, but is unable to apply it, then it is certain that it is dependent on something else.

original: de bshad pa ni skyes bu rnams kyis rab tu grags pa las gzhan ma grags pa'i yul 'ga' zhig la bya par 'dod du zin kyang byas pa don med pas na bya bar mi nus na'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni skyes bu rnams kyis rab tu grags pa las gzhan ma grags pa'i yul 'ga' zhig la bya par 'dod du zin kyang byas pa don med pas na bya bar mi nus na'o //
translated: The explanation of that is: even if one wishes to apply a term that is well known to beings to some object that is not well known to others, it is not possible to apply it because it would be meaningless.

original: 'di yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'di yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How is this so?

original: dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is related to an entity.

original: de nyid der mi mthun par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid der mi mthun par 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not incompatible with that.

original: de'i tshe ji ltar drug pa la sogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe ji ltar drug pa la sogs par 'gyur zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the objection ‚ÄúHow could it be the sixth and so on?‚Äù would arise.

original: gang zhig gang la mthong ba de gal te /üîΩde dang 'brel pa las der de ltar dmigs pa yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig gang la mthong ba de gal te / de dang 'brel pa las der de ltar dmigs pa yin na /
translated: If what is seen in one thingüîΩis observed in another due to its relation to that,

original: de'i tshe 'di gzhan la mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: de'i tshe 'di gzhan la mi 'gyur ba'i phyir na /
translated: then at that time it would not be different from that.

original: tha dad pa la mthong ba'i drug pa la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa la mthong ba'i drug pa la sogs pa tha dad pa med pa la ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skyon 'dir 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: If they were different, then the error would ensue that the seeing of the one would not be the seeing of the other, and so on.

original: 'di ltar skyes bu brgyar 'dod kyang du ba chu la med pa'i phyir @208a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu brgyar 'dod kyang du ba chu la med pa'i phyir @208a * //
translated: Even though one may desire a hundred men, smoke is not in water.

original: me la mthong ba'i du ba de ni der dngos po'i 'brel pas 'brel pa yin pa des na de gzhan la yod do zhes smra ba'i rgol ba ni sun dbyung par 'gyur gyi de ltar ni ma yin no //
analyzed: me la mthong ba'i du ba de ni der dngos po'i 'brel pas 'brel pa yin pa des na de gzhan la yod do zhes smra ba'i rgol ba ni sun dbyung par 'gyur gyi de ltar ni ma yin no //
translated: Since the smoke seen in fire is related to it by the relation of real entity, the opponent who says that it exists elsewhere is refuted, but not in that way.

original: des na gzhan dag la nye bar 'gyur yang 'dir nyes pa 'di ji ltar med pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des na gzhan dag la nye bar 'gyur yang 'dir nyes pa 'di ji ltar med pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how this error does not occur here, even though it does occur for others, he says,

original: gang gi tshe zhes smos so /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes smos so /
translated: ‚ÄúWhen . . .‚Äù

original: gang gi tshe tshig gang zhig smra ba pos ji lta bur rjod par byed pa nyid du nges par sbyar ba de de bzhin du rjod byed yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshig gang zhig smra ba pos ji lta bur rjod par byed pa nyid du nges par sbyar ba de de bzhin du rjod byed yin no //
translated: When a speaker employs a word in a certain way, that is how it is used.

original: de'i tshe phyi rol don la mi ltos par brjod pa yin no zhes gang gi tshe zhes bya bas 'phangs pa de'i tshe nye bar byas te tha dad pa nyid kyis sbrel par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi rol don la mi ltos par brjod pa yin no zhes gang gi tshe zhes bya bas 'phangs pa de'i tshe nye bar byas te tha dad pa nyid kyis sbrel par bya ste /
translated: When it is asked, ‚ÄúAt what time?‚Äù then it is applied, and it is connected by the word ‚Äúdifferent.‚Äù

original: de lta ma yin na gang 'di mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na gang 'di mthar phyin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would not be completed.

original: 'dis ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bstan par mi nus pa dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang rtsa bar gyur pa nyid yin par bstan nas /
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin bstan par mi nus pa dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang rtsa bar gyur pa nyid yin par bstan nas /
translated: This shows that the power of the thing is the basis for the other-dependent nature, which cannot be taught as one wishes.

original: bstan pas nus pa nyid kyis dngos po la mi ltos par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: bstan pas nus pa nyid kyis dngos po la mi ltos par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Since it can be taught, it is explained that it does not rely on things.

original: des na dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir du ba la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin dgod par nus pa nyid kyis drug pa la sogs pa tha dad pa la grags pa yang tha mi dad pa la mi ldog gi
analyzed: des na dngos po'i gzhan gyi dbang ma yin pa'i phyir du ba la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba ji ltar 'dod pa bzhin dgod par nus pa nyid kyis drug pa la sogs pa tha dad pa la grags pa yang tha mi dad pa la mi ldog gi
translated: Therefore, since it is not the other-dependent nature of things, it is not like smoke and so on. Since it can be arranged as one wishes, the well-known differences of the sixth and so on are not reversed in the undifferentiated.

original: /'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis 'jug pa kho na'o //
analyzed: /'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis 'jug pa kho na'o //
translated: They are only engaged by the other-dependent nature of desire.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained.

original: tha dad pa la ni zhes bya'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni zhes bya'o //
translated: The genitive case is used when there is difference.

original: tha dad pa la ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa la ni drug pa'o //
translated: The genitive case is used when there is difference.

original: mang po la ni rdzas la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba de yang rang nyid zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mang po la ni rdzas la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba de yang rang nyid zhugs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The locative case is used when there is multiplicity, such as in the expression ‚Äúin substance,‚Äù but it is not used when there is no multiplicity.

original: gal te tha dad pa la drug pa dang / mang po la rdzas pa la sogs pa rang nyid zhugs pa yin na de ltar na tha dad pa la drug pa zhes bya ba rang nyid zhugs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa la drug pa dang / mang po la rdzas pa la sogs pa rang nyid zhugs pa yin na de ltar na tha dad pa la drug pa zhes bya ba rang nyid zhugs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the genitive case and the locative case were used when there is difference and multiplicity, respectively, then the genitive case would be used when there is difference, and the locative case would be used when there is multiplicity.

original: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa la drug pa 'jug par mthong nas tha dad pa la ni drug pa'i zhes bya ba 'di skyes bu rnams kho nas bcug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tha dad pa la drug pa 'jug par mthong nas tha dad pa la ni drug pa'i zhes bya ba 'di skyes bu rnams kho nas bcug pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di la rtsod pa med do //
translated: If that were not so, then since the genitive case is seen to be used when there is difference, there would be no dispute that the genitive case is used by people in the expression ‚Äúin difference.‚Äù

original: dper na sngon po la mngon sum rang nyid zhugs pa la sngon po la mngon sum 'jug go zhes bya ba ni skyes bus bcug pa nyid yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon po la mngon sum rang nyid zhugs pa la sngon po la mngon sum 'jug go zhes bya ba ni skyes bus bcug pa nyid yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the locative case is used in the expression ‚Äúin blue‚Äù when direct perception is used in regard to blue, but it is used by people in the expression ‚Äúdirect perception is used in regard to blue.‚Äù

original: des na don 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning.

original: 'di dag yod na de lta bu'i don rtogs par gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba gang yin pa tha dad pa dang mang po dag skyes bus 'dod pa la mi ltos @208b bar rang nyid drug pa dang rdzas la sogs pa sgrigs bar byed pa ni ma yin
analyzed: 'di dag yod na de lta bu'i don rtogs par gcig tu nges par 'gyur ba gang yin pa tha dad pa dang mang po dag skyes bus 'dod pa la mi ltos @208b bar rang nyid drug pa dang rdzas la sogs pa sgrigs bar byed pa ni ma yin
translated: But it is not that different things and many things are arranged as sixes and substances and so on by themselves, without depending on the desire of a person.

original: no // 'on kyang skyes bus de dag tha dad pa la sogs pa de la de ltar drug pa la sogs pa sbyor bas tha dad pa la ni drug pa'o //
analyzed: no // 'on kyang skyes bus de dag tha dad pa la sogs pa de la de ltar drug pa la sogs pa sbyor bas tha dad pa la ni drug pa'o //
translated: However, a person applies those things that are different and so on to those sixes and so on, and thus one understands that sixes are for different things,

original: mang po la ni byed pa po rnams so zhes de ltar go bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mang po la ni byed pa po rnams so zhes de ltar go bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and agents are for many things.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: don gyi khyad par la skyes bu rnams kyis sbyar ba'i sgra rnams dmigs nas gzhan dag de ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: don gyi khyad par la skyes bu rnams kyis sbyar ba'i sgra rnams dmigs nas gzhan dag de ltar rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Having observed the terms applied by persons to specific meanings, others will understand in that way.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i don rang nyid de ltar mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i don rang nyid de ltar mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because such meanings themselves do not express themselves in that way.

original: des na sbyor ba 'di dag gi rang dbang yin pa'i phyir dang don rtogs pa yang de'i sbyor ba la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir na yul gzhan la yang sbyor ba las don de ji ltar mi rtogs /
analyzed: des na sbyor ba 'di dag gi rang dbang yin pa'i phyir dang don rtogs pa yang de'i sbyor ba la ltos pa yin pa'i phyir na yul gzhan la yang sbyor ba las don de ji ltar mi rtogs /
translated: Therefore, since these applications are independent, and since the understanding of the meaning also depends on their application, why would one not understand that meaning from the application to other objects?

original: de ba shad pa ni /
analyzed: de ba shad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the same way.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir don de la nges pa the tshom med pa'i rgyus brjod par srid bzhin du don gzhan la grags pa'i phyir nges par byed pa ma yin pa sbyor zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir don de la nges pa the tshom med pa'i rgyus brjod par srid bzhin du don gzhan la grags pa'i phyir nges par byed pa ma yin pa sbyor zhe na /
translated: Why, when the cause of ascertaining that meaning is possible, would one apply to another meaning, which is not ascertained, because it is renowned?

original: ji ltar yang rung zhes gsungs te rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las so //
analyzed: ji ltar yang rung zhes gsungs te rgyu mtshan 'ga' zhig las so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn any case,‚Äù it is said, ‚Äúfrom some reason.‚Äù

original: rgyu mtshan de yang chos tha dad pa dang mi ldan pa mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan de yang chos tha dad pa dang mi ldan pa mi shes pa'o //
translated: That reason is not knowing that the reason is not endowed with a different property.

original: des na dngos po'i gzhan dbang ma yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba tsam gyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa rnams rmongs bas kyang sbyor ba srid pa na nges par byed pa ma yin pa nyid lhas byin la mchod sbyin du tha snyad byed pa ltar /
analyzed: des na dngos po'i gzhan dbang ma yin pa'i phyir sbyor ba tsam gyi gzhan dbang du gyur pa rnams rmongs bas kyang sbyor ba srid pa na nges par byed pa ma yin pa nyid lhas byin la mchod sbyin du tha snyad byed pa ltar /
translated: Therefore, since they are not dependent on the power of things, those who are dependent on mere convention cannot be certain about anything, even when they are confused.

original: de dang bral na ldog pa'i chos su 'gyur ba rmongs pa 'di la mtha' yod pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: de dang bral na ldog pa'i chos su 'gyur ba rmongs pa 'di la mtha' yod pa yang ma yin no //
translated: When they are free from that, they will have a dharma that is reversed. But for this confused person, there is no end to that.

original: des na grags pa'i sbyor ba nges pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus te /
analyzed: des na grags pa'i sbyor ba nges pa'i rgyu yin gyi gzhan ni ma yin no zhes brjod par mi nus te /
translated: Therefore, one cannot say that the cause of certainty is the use of terms that are renowned, and not anything else.

original: rmongs pa gting tshugs pa las kyang grags pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rmongs pa gting tshugs pa las kyang grags pa srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because even those who are deeply confused can have renown.

original: des na sgra rnams ni 'di ltar 'jug srid pa'i phyir na sgra'i sbyor ba tsam las ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rtsad ma bcad par nges par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: des na sgra rnams ni 'di ltar 'jug srid pa'i phyir na sgra'i sbyor ba tsam las ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rtsad ma bcad par nges par bya ba ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Therefore, since it is possible for terms to be used in this way, it is explained that one cannot be certain about the nature of things without investigating the meaning of the mere use of terms.

original: de la ni zhes smos so //
analyzed: de la ni zhes smos so //
translated: In response to this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIn that case . . .‚Äù

original: de ltar gnas pa de la sgra rnams kyi 'jug pa sems pa gang du mang po 'jug pa'i bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid can dang / 'jug pa de'i dbang gis dngos po rnam par 'jog pa gang du 'jug ces dpyad nas pa ni ni la sogs pa'i brda'i rjes su 'brangs te /üîΩtha @209a * //
analyzed: de ltar gnas pa de la sgra rnams kyi 'jug pa sems pa gang du mang po 'jug pa'i bya ba de lta bu'i bdag nyid can dang / 'jug pa de'i dbang gis dngos po rnam par 'jog pa gang du 'jug ces dpyad nas pa ni ni la sogs pa'i brda'i rjes su 'brangs te / tha @209a * //
translated: Thus, when one analyzes the engagement of terms in that way, the engagement of many terms in the action of the nature of that, and the positing of things by the power of that engagement, having followed the convention of the suffix ‚Äú-in,‚ÄùüîΩone determines the engagement of terms in difference, etc.,

original: dad pa la sogs pa dag la 'jug pa nges par byas nas dngos po rnam par 'jog pa ni blun par ston pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa dag la 'jug pa nges par byas nas dngos po rnam par 'jog pa ni blun par ston pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: and posits things. This is merely the teaching of a fool.

original: de la re zhig 'jug pa sems pa mi 'thad pa nyid bshad pa ni brjod par bya ba'i yul can la skyes bu la rag las te /
analyzed: de la re zhig 'jug pa sems pa mi 'thad pa nyid bshad pa ni brjod par bya ba'i yul can la skyes bu la rag las te /
translated: Here, first, the explanation of the untenability of the engagement of terms is as follows: The engagement of terms in the object of expression depends on the person.

original: 'jug pa rnams kyang gang du 'jug ces sems pa ni gang du skyes bu dag gis bcug par ro zhes bya bas phyir bya bar nus pa des na 'di'i 'jug pa ci zhig bya /
analyzed: 'jug pa rnams kyang gang du 'jug ces sems pa ni gang du skyes bu dag gis bcug par ro zhes bya bas phyir bya bar nus pa des na 'di'i 'jug pa ci zhig bya /
translated: When one analyzes, ‚ÄúIn what do the engagements engage?‚Äù it is said that they engage in the person. Since the person is able to engage, what is the engagement of that person?

original: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: dngos po rnam par 'jog pa bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to dispel the positing of things, it is said:

original: dngos po yang dag par mi ston pa zhes de skad brjod do //
analyzed: dngos po yang dag par mi ston pa zhes de skad brjod do //
translated: and it is said that they do not reveal the real thing.

original: dngos po yang dag par mi ston pa gang yin pa de las ji ltar sems dang ldan pa /
analyzed: dngos po yang dag par mi ston pa gang yin pa de las ji ltar sems dang ldan pa /
translated: How can one who does not reveal the real thing be said to have a mind?

original: don rnam par 'jog par byed /
analyzed: don rnam par 'jog par byed /
translated: How can he be said to establish the meaning?üîΩIf he does not reveal the real thing, how can he be said to be engaged in verbal activity?

original: gal te dngos po yang dag par mi ston na 'di dag las tha snyad byed pa ji ltar mi ldog / dngos po yang dag par mi ston pas ni tha snyad gting tshugs par 'gyur ba ma yin te ;
analyzed: gal te dngos po yang dag par mi ston na 'di dag las tha snyad byed pa ji ltar mi ldog / dngos po yang dag par mi ston pas ni tha snyad gting tshugs par 'gyur ba ma yin te ;
translated: One who does not reveal the real thing is not engaged in verbal activity,

original: nya phyis la dngul du brjod pa bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: nya phyis la dngul du brjod pa bzhin no zhe na /
translated: just as a mother-of-pearl is not said to be silver.

original: ji ltar goms pa bzhin zhes smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar goms pa bzhin zhes smos te /
translated: It is said that it is in accordance with what is familiar.

original: 'di dag ni rnam par rtog pa ji ltar goms pa bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rnam par rtog pa ji ltar goms pa bzhin te /
translated: These are in accordance with what is familiar, that is, with what is imagined.

original: gang gis rnam par rtog pa gang 'jug par goms pa des de 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: gang gis rnam par rtog pa gang 'jug par goms pa des de 'jug par byed do //
translated: That by which the imagination of what is unreal is familiar with a certain conceptualization, that causes it to engage in that conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa mi 'chad pa nyid kyis ni 'chad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa mi 'chad pa nyid kyis ni 'chad par 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: The imagination of what is unreal does not engage in what is not familiar.

original: de la chos dang zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: de la chos dang zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here it is said that it is in accordance with the Dharma.

original: chos dang chos can la sogs pa sgra dag de ltar zhes bya ba gzhan la rab tu grags pa de dag ci zhig ltar gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag par byas kyi chos can la sogs pa la ldog pa dang / dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las ldog pa la grub pa dab /
analyzed: chos dang chos can la sogs pa sgra dag de ltar zhes bya ba gzhan la rab tu grags pa de dag ci zhig ltar gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes rnam par gzhag par byas kyi chos can la sogs pa la ldog pa dang / dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las ldog pa la grub pa dab /
translated: They are not posited in terms of a different isolate or different entity.üîΩFrom where is this established?

original: mang po las grub pa'i rdzas la sogs pa de dag ni der skyes bu la rag las pas na chos dang chos can la sogs pa la de dag gis ji ltar yang rung med bzhin du rab tu sbyar ba yin gyi /
analyzed: mang po las grub pa'i rdzas la sogs pa de dag ni der skyes bu la rag las pas na chos dang chos can la sogs pa la de dag gis ji ltar yang rung med bzhin du rab tu sbyar ba yin gyi /
translated: Many things are established as substances and so on. They are dependent on the person who posits them. Therefore, they are applied to the property and possessor of the property and so on, even though they do not exist in any way.

original: dngos po nyid de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no zhes ga las shes /
analyzed: dngos po nyid de lta bur gyur pa ma yin no zhes ga las shes /
translated: How do we know that they are not entities that exist in that way?

original: stsogs pa'i sgras ni gang du chos dang chos can gyi dngos por rtogs pa med pa de lta na yang grags pa'i sgra don las phyin ci log pa yod pa dper na da ta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams te de bzung ngo //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgras ni gang du chos dang chos can gyi dngos por rtogs pa med pa de lta na yang grags pa'i sgra don las phyin ci log pa yod pa dper na da ta'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams te de bzung ngo //
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù include those words that, even though they do not have the nature of a property and a property-possessor, are still used in a manner contrary to their accepted meaning, for example, the words ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúhorse.‚Äù

original: de bzlog @209b ba'i phyir de lta na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de bzlog @209b ba'i phyir de lta na zhes smos so //
translated: In order to refute that, it says, ‚ÄúIf it were like that . . . .‚Äù

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag par byas nas tha snyad mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i sgo nas rnam par gzhag par byas nas tha snyad mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable to posit them as different things and then use them in a conventional expression.

original: ji ltar tha snyad mi rung zhe na /üîΩchos dang zhes smos te chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa yin na spyi mi rung ngo //
analyzed: ji ltar tha snyad mi rung zhe na / chos dang zhes smos te chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa yin na spyi mi rung ngo //
translated: How is it not suitable?üîΩIt says, ‚ÄúThe property and . . . .‚Äù If the property and the property-possessor were different, a universal would not be suitable.

original: gang gi tshe 'di'i ba lang nyid ces ba lang nyid chos can las gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'di'i ba lang nyid ces ba lang nyid chos can las gzhan ma yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: When cowhood is not different from the property-possessor, then

original: 'di 'di'i spyi'i ngo bor brjod par bya ba yin na /
analyzed: 'di 'di'i spyi'i ngo bor brjod par bya ba yin na /
translated: it is to be called the universal of that.

original: tha dad pa yin na ni spyir 'thad pa ma yin la /
analyzed: tha dad pa yin na ni spyir 'thad pa ma yin la /
translated: If they were different, a universal would not be tenable.

original: de dag gi 'brel pa dang / 'di ba lang zhes gzhi mthun pa dang / ba lang dkar po zhes khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po dag mi rung ngo ;
analyzed: de dag gi 'brel pa dang / 'di ba lang zhes gzhi mthun pa dang / ba lang dkar po zhes khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po dag mi rung ngo ;
translated: The relation between them, the common locus ‚Äúcow,‚Äù and the entity that is the particular ‚Äúwhite cow‚Äù are all untenable.

original: / tha snyad mtha' dag kyang spyi la sogs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: / tha snyad mtha' dag kyang spyi la sogs pa'i yul can yin pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since all conventions have universals and so on as their objects,

original: chos dang chos can dag tha dad nas /üîΩtha snyad mi sgrub cing mi dad pa la 'gyur ba gang yin pa de tha dad par mi rung mod /
analyzed: chos dang chos can dag tha dad nas / tha snyad mi sgrub cing mi dad pa la 'gyur ba gang yin pa de tha dad par mi rung mod /
translated: the property and the basis of the property are different.üîΩIf they are not established as different, then they would not be different.

original: tha mi dad pa la 'thad par ma mthong bar go //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la 'thad par ma mthong bar go //
translated: If they are not different, then this is not seen to be tenable.

original: ji ltar tha dad pa la mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad pa la mi rung zhe na /
translated: How are they untenable if they are different?

original: de nyid kyi ngo bo 'am zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi ngo bo 'am zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf they are the same entity‚Äù is stated.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: tha mi dad pa la yang mi rung ba kho na'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad pa la yang mi rung ba kho na'o //
translated: If they are not different, then this is also untenable.

original: 'di la 'thad pas tha dad pa la mi 'thad par ni mi smra'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'thad pas tha dad pa la mi 'thad par ni mi smra'o //
translated: Here, it is not said that if they are different, then this is untenable.

original: 'o na gnyi ga la mi rung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gnyi ga la mi rung bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Well, then, how is it that both are untenable?

original: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ro zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúThis will be explained‚Äù is stated.

original: rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po la ni mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu'i dngos po la ni mi 'thad pa 'ba' zhig tu ni ma zad do //
translated: But it is not only that such a thing is untenable.

original: sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin na /
analyzed: sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug pa yin na /
translated: If words were to engage in accordance with the entity,

original: dngos po tha dad pa la de ltar rnam par gzhag par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa la de ltar rnam par gzhag par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would be posited in that way with respect to different entities.

original: sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug na ni spyi la sogs pa la yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug na ni spyi la sogs pa la yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If words were to engage in accordance with the entity, then it would not be suitable for them to engage in universals and so on.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug na ni de'i blo mngon sum dang 'dra bar thal bas 'khrul pas gzhag pa'i spyi la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug na ni de'i blo mngon sum dang 'dra bar thal bas 'khrul pas gzhag pa'i spyi la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba 'di yang 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If words were to engage in accordance with the entity, then it would follow that the cognition of that would be like a direct perception, and it would be posited as mistaken because of the absence of universals and so on that are posited by error. This will be explained.

original: des ni de ltar chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa dgag pa'i phyir drug pa la sogs pa mi rung bar sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa de dag brjod par 'dod pa gzhan dbang yin pas bsal te /
analyzed: des ni de ltar chos dang chos can dag tha mi dad pa dgag pa'i phyir drug pa la sogs pa mi rung bar sgrub par byed pa nyid yin pa de dag brjod par 'dod pa gzhan dbang yin pas bsal te /
translated: Thus he proves that the sixth case and so on are untenable in order to refute the nondifference of the property and the object of the property. Since they are dependent on other things that are asserted, they are refuted.

original: da ni gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa ni gal te sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa yin na /üîΩde ltar na drug pa dang tshig tha dad pa la @210a * //
analyzed: da ni gtan tshigs 'di ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa ni gal te sgra rnams dngos po ji lta ba bzhin 'jug pa yin na / de ltar na drug pa dang tshig tha dad pa la @210a * //
translated: If words engage in accordance with things,

original: sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgrub byed du 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: sogs pa tha dad pa'i sgrub byed du 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: then the words ‚Äúsix‚Äù and ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù would be established as different.

original: 'di yang gal te thams cad du mi 'dod na sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di yang gal te thams cad du mi 'dod na sgrub par byed pa ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: But if this is not accepted in all cases, then they are not establishing anything at all.

original: de ltar khas blang bar yang mi nus so zhes smras pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar khas blang bar yang mi nus so zhes smras pa ni /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThis is not possible‚Äù is

original: gang yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äúanything.‚Äù

original: dngos po tha dad na tha dad pa'i phyir sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par dngos pos byas pa kho nar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i btsun mo rnams zhes tha dad rnam par gzhag pa 'am /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad na tha dad pa'i phyir sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par dngos pos byas pa kho nar 'dod pa gang yin pa de'i btsun mo rnams zhes tha dad rnam par gzhag pa 'am /
translated: If things are different, then the difference in the engagement of words is made by the thing itself. What is the reason for positing the queens of that king as different

original: grong drug ces tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa 'di la rgyu ci yod /
analyzed: grong drug ces tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa 'di la rgyu ci yod /
translated: or positing the six villages as undifferentiated?

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par dngos pos byas nas btsun mo rnams grong drug ces bya ba 'di la dngos po tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par gzhung btsugs par brjod dgos so //
analyzed: sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par dngos pos byas nas btsun mo rnams grong drug ces bya ba 'di la dngos po tha dad pa dang tha mi dad par gzhung btsugs par brjod dgos so //
translated: The difference in the application of the term ‚Äúqueen‚Äù must be based on a real difference.

original: 'di ltar bud med gcig la yang btsun mo rnams zhes mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can gyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bud med gcig la yang btsun mo rnams zhes mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can gyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the term ‚Äúqueens‚Äù is used for a single woman.

original: des na bud med gcig la tha dad par ma bsgrubs par ni sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par 'di dngos po tha dad pas byas par mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des na bud med gcig la tha dad par ma bsgrubs par ni sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par 'di dngos po tha dad pas byas par mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, without establishing a difference in the single woman, it is not tenable that the difference in the application of the term is based on a real difference.

original: de bzhin du grong drug ces grong khyer drug po dag gcig gi tshig mtha' can gyis brjod par yang tha mi dad pa med par ji ltar 'gyur /üîΩ'dir ni zad pa ma yin gyi nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'am /
analyzed: de bzhin du grong drug ces grong khyer drug po dag gcig gi tshig mtha' can gyis brjod par yang tha mi dad pa med par ji ltar 'gyur / 'dir ni zad pa ma yin gyi nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes tha dad par rnam par gzhag pa'am /
translated: In the same way, the term ‚Äúsix cities‚Äù is used for the six cities. How could it be used without a difference?

original: mkha' nyid ces tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa la rgyu ci yod //
analyzed: mkha' nyid ces tha mi dad par rnam par gzhag pa la rgyu ci yod //
translated: Here, what is the reason for positing the six cities as different, as in ‚Äúthe nature of space,‚Äù or as nondifferent, as in ‚Äúspace itself‚Äù?

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i drug pas nam mkha' las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes bya ba'i drug pas nam mkha' las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin bstan pa yin na /
translated: The sixth case ending ‚Äúof the nature of space‚Äù indicates a nature that is different from space.

original: gang zhig 'di lta bu drug pas bstan par 'gyur ba tha dad pa de la rgyu ci zhig yod //
analyzed: gang zhig 'di lta bu drug pas bstan par 'gyur ba tha dad pa de la rgyu ci zhig yod //
translated: But what is the reason for that difference, which is indicated by the sixth case ending?

original: rang bzhin de yang mkha' nyid ces bstan pa na /
analyzed: rang bzhin de yang mkha' nyid ces bstan pa na /
translated: And when it is indicated that that nature is ‚Äúof space,‚Äù

original: mkha' sgra 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa spyi yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: mkha' sgra 'jug pa'i rgyur gyur pa spyi yin par 'gyur te /
translated: it is a universal that is the reason for the application of the term ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: yon tan gang yod pas rdzas la sgra dgod par 'gyur ba de brjod pa na tva dang tal gyi rkyen nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro zhes 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa la nyid kyi rkyen khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan gang yod pas rdzas la sgra dgod par 'gyur ba de brjod pa na tva dang tal gyi rkyen nyid ces bya bar 'gyur ro zhes 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod pa la nyid kyi rkyen khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When it is said that the suffix -tva and -tal are used to indicate the reason for the application of a term to a substance, it is accepted that the reason for the application of the term is a reason.

original: khyad par dag la sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang spyi kho na yin te /
analyzed: khyad par dag la sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan yang spyi kho na yin te /
translated: The reason for the application of a term to a particular is a universal.

original: des na 'dir mkha' nyid ces bya ba du ma'i spyi nyid rtogs par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'dir mkha' nyid ces bya ba du ma'i spyi nyid rtogs par bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, here, the term ‚Äúof space‚Äù is understood to be a universal of many.

original: spyi yang tha dad pa dag la yod par brjod pas na /
analyzed: spyi yang tha dad pa dag la yod par brjod pas na /
translated: And since a universal is said to exist in different things,

original: gang la sdud @210b par byed pa'i mkha' nyid yod par 'gyur ba nam mkha' zhes bya ba tha dad pa gang zhig yod //
analyzed: gang la sdud @210b par byed pa'i mkha' nyid yod par 'gyur ba nam mkha' zhes bya ba tha dad pa gang zhig yod //
translated: What is space, which is the locus of the collection? What is space that is different?

original: des na gang gis tha mi dad par brjod pa'i sgra 'dir 'gyur ba mkha' nyid ces bya ba tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod dgos so //
analyzed: des na gang gis tha mi dad par brjod pa'i sgra 'dir 'gyur ba mkha' nyid ces bya ba tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must state the reason for the nondifference that is expressed by the word ‚Äúspace.‚Äù

original: don 'di nyid ni gang gi tshe zhes bya bas 'chad do //
analyzed: don 'di nyid ni gang gi tshe zhes bya bas 'chad do //
translated: This very point is explained by the passage beginning ‚ÄúWhen . . .

original: stsogs pa'i sgra'i don ni bye ma gcig la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: stsogs pa'i sgra'i don ni bye ma gcig la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù The phrase ‚Äúand so on‚Äù means ‚Äúin a single grain of sand.

original: bud med de la gang gis na btsun mo rnams zhes sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par da lta bur 'gyur ba'i mang po nyid ci zhig yod /
analyzed: bud med de la gang gis na btsun mo rnams zhes sgra 'jug pa'i khyad par da lta bur 'gyur ba'i mang po nyid ci zhig yod /
translated: ‚Äù What is the multiplicity that is the basis for the term ‚Äúmany‚Äù in the expression ‚Äúmany women‚Äù?

original: 'di la smras pa /
analyzed: 'di la smras pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: gal te nus pa tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te nus pa tha dad pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is the difference in their capacities,

original: nus pa tha dad pas de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: nus pa tha dad pas de lta bur 'gyur ba yin no zhes 'brel to //
translated: then we reply that it is because of the difference in their capacities that this is so.üîΩThe passage beginning ‚ÄúIf you say . . .

original: dogs pa 'di la da ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dogs pa 'di la da ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚Äù addresses this doubt.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te bud med la nus pa tha dad pas 'dir 'di tha dad pa'i rgyu yin la tha dad pa des las kyang sgra 'jug pa tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te bud med la nus pa tha dad pas 'dir 'di tha dad pa'i rgyu yin la tha dad pa des las kyang sgra 'jug pa tha dad pa yin na /
translated: This is what is being said: because of the different potentials of women, here this is the cause of the different words. If the different words are due to the different actions,

original: de'i tshe shing zhes gcig gi tshig tu mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe shing zhes gcig gi tshig tu mi 'gyur te /
translated: then at that time the word ‚Äútree‚Äù would not be a word for one,

original: de las yang nus pa'i dbye ba mang po nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las yang nus pa'i dbye ba mang po nyid yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there are many different potentials in that.

original: gang la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ba nus pa gcig pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ba nus pa gcig pa ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is nothing that has a single potential that would be a word for one.

original: mang po nyid kyis rtag tu mang po'i tshig grub bzhin du legs par bstan pa'i phyir btsun mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tsheg rnams mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can du ston pa'i 'bad pa yang don med do zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: mang po nyid kyis rtag tu mang po'i tshig grub bzhin du legs par bstan pa'i phyir btsun mo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tsheg rnams mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can du ston pa'i 'bad pa yang don med do zhes ston pa ni /
translated: In order to always properly demonstrate that the word ‚Äúmany‚Äù is established by many, the effort to show that the words ‚Äúqueen‚Äù and so on have the ending of the word for many is pointless.

original: 'bad pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'bad pa yang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù shows that.

original: gal te dngos po tha dad pa la brten nas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po tha dad pa la brten nas shing zhes bya ba la sogs pa dag la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If the word ‚Äútree‚Äù and so on is a word for one in dependence on different things,

original: btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba 'di la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthe queens‚Äù would also be impossible.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /üîΩtha mi dad pa dang nus pa tha dad pa yin pa na /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te / tha mi dad pa dang nus pa tha dad pa yin pa na /
translated: The expression would be ‚Äúthus have I heard at one time.‚ÄùüîΩIf the expression ‚Äúat one time‚Äù is a plural because it is based on a plurality of potentials,

original: gal te nus pa tha dad pa la brten nas ni mang po'i tshig dngos po'i tha mi dad pa la brten nas ni gcig gi tshig yin no //
analyzed: gal te nus pa tha dad pa la brten nas ni mang po'i tshig dngos po'i tha mi dad pa la brten nas ni gcig gi tshig yin no //
translated: then the expression ‚Äúat one time‚Äù would be a singular because it is based on the nondifference of entities.

original: des na 'dir res 'ga' ba'i brjod par 'dod pa la brten nas de lta bu'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: des na 'dir res 'ga' ba'i brjod par 'dod pa la brten nas de lta bu'i dngos por 'gyur gyi /
translated: Therefore, in this case, the expression ‚Äúat one time‚Äù would be based on the desire to express something occasional,

original: de'i tshe rtag tu mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can du ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rtag tu mang po'i tshig gi mtha' can du ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: and it would not be a plural expression at all times.

original: yang na gang gi shing rnams zhes tshig tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang na gang gi shing rnams zhes tshig tha dad par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, the expression ‚Äúthe trees‚Äù would not be a plural expression.

original: dngos po tha mi dad pa mang po'i tshig dang 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po tha mi dad pa mang po'i tshig dang 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: If you say that the expression ‚Äúat one time‚Äù is a plural expression because it is based on a plurality of potentials,

original: btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba 'dir yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: btsun mo rnams zhes bya ba 'dir yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the expression ‚Äúthe queens‚Äù would not be a plural expression.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin na @211a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin na @211a * //
translated: Because if that were so,

original: de'i phyir sgra'i legs pa nyid kyi nges pa dngos po tha dad pa med kyang tshig tha dad pa 'di byed pa na sgra rnams kyi sbyor ba la de ltar nges par byed pa'i 'dod pa rang dbang can du ston pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir sgra'i legs pa nyid kyi nges pa dngos po tha dad pa med kyang tshig tha dad pa 'di byed pa na sgra rnams kyi sbyor ba la de ltar nges par byed pa'i 'dod pa rang dbang can du ston pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though there is no difference in the excellence of the word, when the different words are used, one shows one's independent desire to make a determination regarding the application of the words.

original: dngos po de lta bu ma yin pa gzhan du gyur pa yin yang 'dir nges par bya ji ltar nus /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu ma yin pa gzhan du gyur pa yin yang 'dir nges par bya ji ltar nus /
translated: But even if the thing is not like that, how can one make a determination regarding it?

original: de'i brda la brten nas deng song ba rnams kyang tha snyad byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i brda la brten nas deng song ba rnams kyang tha snyad byed pa yin te /
translated: Those who have come in the present time make conventions based on those signs.

original: gzhan du brda brtags na ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du brda brtags na ni gzhan du yang 'gyur ro //
translated: If one examines the signs elsewhere, they will be different.

original: gal te gcig la yang mang po'i tshig mtha' can legs pa nyid du nges pa byed pa ma yin nam zhe na /üîΩbden mod kyi de lta na yang tha dad par ston par byed pa yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te gcig la yang mang po'i tshig mtha' can legs pa nyid du nges pa byed pa ma yin nam zhe na / bden mod kyi de lta na yang tha dad par ston par byed pa yang 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But isn't it the case that even in one thing, a determination of excellence is made by means of a word ending in a plural?üîΩThat is true, but even so, it is not that one shows it to be different.

original: de tha mi dad par ston pa nyid ni brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de tha mi dad par ston pa nyid ni brjod par 'dod pa'i gzhan dbang ma yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not that it is not shown to be non-different, for it is not independent of what is intended to be expressed.

original: des ni de ltar gang las tshig tha dad par 'gyur ba nus pa tha dad pa ni 'dir tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bsgrub pas tshig tha mi dad pa'i yul la yang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan med par bshad pa rnam par dgrol
analyzed: des ni de ltar gang las tshig tha dad par 'gyur ba nus pa tha dad pa ni 'dir tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin no zhes bsgrub pas tshig tha mi dad pa'i yul la yang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan med par bshad pa rnam par dgrol
translated: Thus, he proves that a difference in power is not the reason for a difference in words. Therefore, he explains that even in the case of a nondifferent object, there is no reason for nondifference.

original: ba'i phyir / grong khyer drug ces bya ba yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: ba'i phyir / grong khyer drug ces bya ba yang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to clarify this, he says, ‚ÄúThe six cities.‚Äù

original: gcig gi tshig nyid bsdu ba'i khyad par la brten par dogs pa sel ba ni /
analyzed: gcig gi tshig nyid bsdu ba'i khyad par la brten par dogs pa sel ba ni /
translated: In order to remove the doubt that the very word ‚Äúone‚Äù is based on a particular collection,

original: grong khyer nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grong khyer nyid kyang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThe city itself.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /üîΩbsdu ba'i khyad par la brten nas /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te / bsdu ba'i khyad par la brten nas /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gcig gi tshig yod pa yin na /
analyzed: gcig gi tshig yod pa yin na /
translated: If the word ‚Äúone‚Äù exists based on a particular collection,

original: de nyid ni gal te gcig por 'ga' zhig med na brda tsam du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de nyid ni gal te gcig por 'ga' zhig med na brda tsam du 'gyur te /
translated: then that very word ‚Äúone‚Äù would be a mere convention if there were no one at all.

original: sgra rnams skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sgra rnams skyes bu'i 'dod pa'i gzhan gyi dbang du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba kho bo cag gi 'dod pa nyid gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the sounds would be dependent on the desire of the person, it would be clear that this is just our assertion.

original: dngos po gcig yod na ni sgra don ji lta ba bzhin 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po gcig yod na ni sgra don ji lta ba bzhin 'jug par 'gyur ba zhig na de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If there were a single entity, then the meaning of the word would be just as it is expressed. But that does not exist.
