original: 'di ltar re zhig grong khyer nyid 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ste des na gang la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ba de dang 'brel pa can sdud pa zhes bya ba gzhan yod par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig grong khyer nyid 'ga' zhig brjod par bya ste des na gang la gcig gi tshig tu 'gyur ba de dang 'brel pa can sdud pa zhes bya ba gzhan yod par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: Thus, first of all, a city must be expressed, and then there would be another, called a collection, which is related to that, in virtue of which it is called a single unit.

original: de nyid de las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de las rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is understood from that.

original: rtogs pa ma yin na ni gcig yan lag ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin na ni gcig yan lag ma yin no //
translated: If it is not understood, then it is not a single unit.

original: gang gis sdud pa gcig tu 'gyur ba grong khyer zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang gis sdud pa gcig tu 'gyur ba grong khyer zhes bya ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is no city at all which would be a single unit.

original: ji ltar grong khyer zhes bya ba cung zad med ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar grong khyer zhes bya ba cung zad med ce na /
translated: How is it that there is not even the slightest city?

original: khang bzangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: khang bzangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, ‚Äúa palace,‚Äù and so on.

original: grong khyer nyid kyang cung @211b zad kyang med na zhes bya bas med pa nyid brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: grong khyer nyid kyang cung @211b zad kyang med na zhes bya bas med pa nyid brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: He does not say that the city itself does not exist at all, by saying, ‚Äúthe city itself does not exist even the slightest bit.‚Äù

original: 'on kyang rdzas ma yin la 'di dag la ldan pa yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rdzas ma yin la 'di dag la ldan pa yang med do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: But they are not substances, nor do they possess substances.

original: grong khyer rnams kyi ldan pa sdud pa yin par 'gyur na /
analyzed: grong khyer rnams kyi ldan pa sdud pa yin par 'gyur na /
translated: If the city is the collection of its parts,

original: de ni grong khyer rnams rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas ldan pa yang med pa'i phyir sdud pa ga la yod /
analyzed: de ni grong khyer rnams rdzas kyi rang bzhin ma yin pas ldan pa yang med pa'i phyir sdud pa ga la yod /
translated: then since the city is not a substance by nature, how could it be a collection, since it does not possess substances?

original: khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa rnams tshogs pa la grong khyer du rtogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: khang bzangs dang skyes bu la sogs pa rigs mi mthun pa rnams tshogs pa la grong khyer du rtogs pa 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The idea of a city arises in regard to a collection of houses, people, etc., which are of different kinds.

original: tshogs pa'i sngon rol du ni 'di dag la grong khyer rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: tshogs pa'i sngon rol du ni 'di dag la grong khyer rtogs pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But prior to the collection, the idea of a city does not exist in regard to them.

original: de dag tshogs pa dag gis rdzas skyes pa zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
analyzed: de dag tshogs pa dag gis rdzas skyes pa zhes bya bar 'gyur na /
translated: If the idea of a city arises in regard to a collection of substances,

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnams ni rdzas rtsom par smra ba rnams kyis khas mi len te /
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnams ni rdzas rtsom par smra ba rnams kyis khas mi len te /
translated: then the proponents of the theory of the composition of substances do not accept that different kinds of substances compose a substance.

original: des na gang las grong khyer rdzas yin par 'gyur ba khang bzangs la sogs pa ni rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: des na gang las grong khyer rdzas yin par 'gyur ba khang bzangs la sogs pa ni rdzas rtsom par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, houses, etc., do not compose a substance from which the idea of a city arises.

original: da ni 'di dag la ldan pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ;
analyzed: da ni 'di dag la ldan pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir bshad pa ;
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that they do not possess these, the root text says:

original: gang gi phyir khang bzangs ni so phag la sogs pa tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa des na tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin la khang bzangs kyi blor 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir khang bzangs ni so phag la sogs pa tshogs pa'i rang bzhin yin pa des na tshogs pa dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin la khang bzangs kyi blor 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Because a mansion is the nature of a collection of bricks and so on, the cognition of a mansion arises in relation to the nature of a collection.

original: de ni rang nyid ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
analyzed: de ni rang nyid ldan pa'i bdag nyid yin pas /
translated: Since it is itself the nature of a collection,

original: grong khyer gyi rang bzhin khang bzangs la sogs pa gzhan dang mi ldan pa'i yang phyir ldan pa med do zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: grong khyer gyi rang bzhin khang bzangs la sogs pa gzhan dang mi ldan pa'i yang phyir ldan pa med do zhes 'brel to //
translated: it does not possess other things, such as a city, because it is not a self.

original: de'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te /üîΩgal te grong khyer rdzas yin na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i bsam pa ni 'di yin te / gal te grong khyer rdzas yin na ni de'i tshe /
translated: The idea is this:

original: de dag gi ldan ba bsdus pa yin par 'gyur te ldan pa ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / de 'ang rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gi ldan ba bsdus pa yin par 'gyur te ldan pa ni yon tan yin pa'i phyir dang / de 'ang rdzas la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a city were a substance, then it would be included among the collections, because possession is a quality and that is based on substance.

original: gang gi tshe grong khyer zhes bya ba rdzas ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gang gi tshe grong khyer zhes bya ba rdzas ma yin gyi /
translated: But when a so-called city is not a substance,

original: 'on kyang so phag rnams kyi khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / skyes bu rnams kyi 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'on kyang so phag rnams kyi khang bzangs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid dang / skyes bu rnams kyi 'dus pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa nyid yin pa de'i tshe /
translated: But if the nature of the house, etc., is the bricks, and the nature of the collection is the nature of the person,

original: ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi grong khyer rnams kyi sdud pa ldan pa yin par ga la 'gyur te /
analyzed: ldan pa'i bdag nyid kyi grong khyer rnams kyi sdud pa ldan pa yin par ga la 'gyur te /
translated: then how could the city, which has the nature of a collection, be a possessor?

original: yon tan rnams la ni yon tan yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: yon tan rnams la ni yon tan yod pa ma yin no //
translated: And qualities do not exist in qualities.

original: de skad du yang yon tan la yon tan brten par ni ma bshad do zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de skad du yang yon tan la yon tan brten par ni ma bshad do zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: And it is said that a quality does not rest in a quality.

original: bya ba'i bdag nyid sdud pa yin yang ldan pa med pa nyid kyis bsal ba logs su bsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bya ba'i bdag nyid sdud pa yin yang ldan pa med pa nyid kyis bsal ba logs su bsal bar bya ba ma yin no //
translated: Even if the nature of the action is a collection, it is not a possessor because it does not exist.

original: sdud par byed pa de ni sbyor bar byed pa yin @212a * //
analyzed: sdud par byed pa de ni sbyor bar byed pa yin @212a * //
translated: And that which collects is that which joins.

original: na 'di dag ni sbyor bar mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag la sdud pa yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: na 'di dag ni sbyor bar mi nus pa'i phyir ji ltar 'di dag la sdud pa yod par 'gyur /
translated: But since these cannot join, how could they be a collection?

original: gal te rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir grong khyer rnams la yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi ldan pa med na /
analyzed: gal te rdzas ma yin pa'i phyir grong khyer rnams la yon tan gyi bdag nyid kyi ldan pa med na /
translated: If the city does not have a possessor that has the nature of a quality because it is not a substance,

original: grangs drug kyang med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: grangs drug kyang med par 'gyur te /
translated: The number six would not exist,

original: de yang yon tan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de yang yon tan gyi bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: because it is the nature of a quality.

original: de khas blangs pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de khas blangs pa'i phyir de nyid kyi phyir zhes smos so //
translated: In order to show that this is accepted, he says, ‚Äúbecause of that.‚Äù

original: grangs shes pa med mod /
analyzed: grangs shes pa med mod /
translated: Although the cognition of number does not exist,

original: 'di ni 'gal ba gzhan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gal ba gzhan yin no //
translated: this is another contradiction.

original: 'di ni gzhan la yang rang gi 'dod pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan la yang rang gi 'dod pa mi 'thad par bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is stated in order to show that the opponent‚Äôs position is untenable.

original: dngos su na ni grong khyer zhes bya ba gcig po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos su na ni grong khyer zhes bya ba gcig po 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: In reality, there is no such thing as a city,

original: 'di ltar skyes bu la sogs pa nyid don dam par yod pa yin la de dag kyang rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir du ma'i bdag nyid can yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar skyes bu la sogs pa nyid don dam par yod pa yin la de dag kyang rdul phra rab kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir du ma'i bdag nyid can yin no //
translated: because only persons, etc., exist ultimately, and they are of the nature of atoms, and therefore are multiple.

original: rdul phra rab gcig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang tha snyad kyi yul du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos por na 'ga' la yang gcig gi tshig yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rdul phra rab gcig gi rang bzhin gang yin pa de yang tha snyad kyi yul du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dngos por na 'ga' la yang gcig gi tshig yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that which is of the nature of a single atom is not the object of conventional cognition, in reality nothing has the word ‚Äúone.‚Äù

original: skyes bu dang khang bzangs la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i grong khyer zhes bya ba yang 'ga' yang snang ba med pas drug pa 'di rnams la dngos po gcig yod par gsal ba ga la zhig / des na grong khyer drug ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni dngos po'i yul canüîΩma yin pa kho na'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dang khang bzangs la sogs pa dang / sa la sogs pa las ma gtogs pa'i grong khyer zhes bya ba yang 'ga' yang snang ba med pas drug pa 'di rnams la dngos po gcig yod par gsal ba ga la zhig / des na grong khyer drug ces bya ba'i sgra 'di ni dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the term ‚Äúsix cities‚Äù is not a term that has a real entity as its object.

original: des na de ltar ldan pa grong khyer yin na tha mi dad pa blo 'di med par bsgrubs te /
analyzed: des na de ltar ldan pa grong khyer yin na tha mi dad pa blo 'di med par bsgrubs te /
translated: Thus, it is established that if something is a city, it is not a different cognition.

original: yod pa yang grong khyer nyid du mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yod pa yang grong khyer nyid du mi rung bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that it is also not tenable for it to exist as a city,

original: gal te zhes smos so //
analyzed: gal te zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúIf it exists,‚Äù etc.

original: grong khyer ni yod pa yin no //
analyzed: grong khyer ni yod pa yin no //
translated: A city exists.

original: gal te de yang thams cad yin na ni kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa yang grong khyer yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de yang thams cad yin na ni kun dga' ra ba la sogs pa yang grong khyer yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is all of those, then a park, etc., would also be a city.

original: des na de yang yin la ldan pa yang yin pa khang bzangs kyi mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa de dang skyes bu de gnyis kyi khyad par byas pa grong khyer yin te /
analyzed: des na de yang yin la ldan pa yang yin pa khang bzangs kyi mtshan nyid kyi ldan pa de dang skyes bu de gnyis kyi khyad par byas pa grong khyer yin te /
translated: Therefore, that which is both that and a possessor is the city, which is the distinction between the possessor of the characteristics of the mansion and the person.

original: khang bzangs dang skyes bu'i yod pa grong khyer yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: khang bzangs dang skyes bu'i yod pa grong khyer yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The existence of the mansion and the person is the city. This is the meaning.

original: dogs pa 'di zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
analyzed: dogs pa 'di zhe na zhes bya bas bsu nas /
translated: This is the doubt:

original: bzlog pa'i phyir bogs dbyung du med pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: bzlog pa'i phyir bogs dbyung du med pa zhes smos so //
translated: In order to dispel it, he says, ‚ÄúIt is not to be enhanced.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang zhig gzhan las tha dad pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni tha dad par byed pa'i khyad par nye bar blangs pas de las @212b tha dad par ston par byed do //
analyzed: gang zhig gzhan las tha dad pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de ni tha dad par byed pa'i khyad par nye bar blangs pas de las @212b tha dad par ston par byed do //
translated: That which has a nature that is different from another is shown to be different from that by the appropriation of a distinction that makes it different.

original: dper na ba lang dkar po khyer shog ces bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ba lang dkar po khyer shog ces bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, ‚ÄúBring the white cow.‚Äù

original: gang la tha dad pa nyid med pa de dag khyad par ldan pas khyad par bstan par bya ba ji ltar yin /
analyzed: gang la tha dad pa nyid med pa de dag khyad par ldan pas khyad par bstan par bya ba ji ltar yin /
translated: How can those that do not have difference be shown to be different by possessing a distinction?

original: gang gis khyad par nye bar blangs pas bstan par bya ba kun dga' ra ba'i yod pa dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i yod pa tha dad pas ni ma yin pas na /
analyzed: gang gis khyad par nye bar blangs pas bstan par bya ba kun dga' ra ba'i yod pa dang skyes bu la sogs pa'i yod pa tha dad pas ni ma yin pas na /
translated: It is not that the existence of the city is different from the existence of the park, etc., which are to be indicated by the specification.

original: des khyad par byed pa'i yod pa grong khyer yin no zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
analyzed: des khyad par byed pa'i yod pa grong khyer yin no zhes bya bar mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that the existence which makes the distinction is the city.

original: des na grong khyer gyi bye brag kyang mi rung bas na grong khyer drug ces bya bar ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: des na grong khyer gyi bye brag kyang mi rung bas na grong khyer drug ces bya bar ga la 'gyur /
translated: Since the distinction of the city is also not tenable, how could it be said that there are six cities?

original: de nyid kyi phyir yod pa yang zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yod pa yang zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore, it is shown that the existence is also one.

original: yod pa ni gcig yod pa'i phyir na dbye ba med pas 'phags pa'i grong khyer ro //
analyzed: yod pa ni gcig yod pa'i phyir na dbye ba med pas 'phags pa'i grong khyer ro //
translated: Since the existence is one, there is no distinction.

original: kla klo'i grong khyer ro zhes khyad par blangs kyang tha dad par mi 'grub pas grong khyer mang po nyid grub pa'i phyir grong khyer rnams shes pa mang po'i tshig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kla klo'i grong khyer ro zhes khyad par blangs kyang tha dad par mi 'grub pas grong khyer mang po nyid grub pa'i phyir grong khyer rnams shes pa mang po'i tshig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the distinction ‚Äúthe city of the ƒÅryas‚Äù and ‚Äúthe city of the barbarians‚Äù is made, since it is not established as different, the existence of many cities is established. Therefore, the word ‚Äúcities‚Äù is not a word for many cognitions.

original: de ltar yod pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir grong khyer nyid yin pa bsal ba na /
analyzed: de ltar yod pa la khyad par med pa'i phyir grong khyer nyid yin pa bsal ba na /
translated: Because there is no difference in existence, when the city is refuted,

original: yod pa dang skyes bu la sogs pa lhan cig pa nyid grong khyer yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yod pa dang skyes bu la sogs pa lhan cig pa nyid grong khyer yin par 'gyur te /
translated: existence, the person, etc., and coexistent things would be the city.

original: yod pa la khyad par med cing yod pa 'thob pa dang skyes bu dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang grong khyer ma yin pas de las khyad par du gyur pa 'ga' zhig de ltar brjod par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu la sogs pa de dag dang yodüîΩpa lhan cig pa'i dngos po grong khyer yin no //
analyzed: yod pa la khyad par med cing yod pa 'thob pa dang skyes bu dang ldan pa la sogs pa yang grong khyer ma yin pas de las khyad par du gyur pa 'ga' zhig de ltar brjod par bya ba'i phyir skyes bu la sogs pa de dag dang yod pa lhan cig pa'i dngos po grong khyer yin no //
translated: Since there is no difference in existence, and since existence, the person, etc., and possession are not the city, in order to specify something that is different from them, the person, etc., and the thing that is coexistent with existenceüîΩare the city.

original: khang bzangs la sogs pa de nyid lhan cig pa'i dngos po grong khyer yin mod /
analyzed: khang bzangs la sogs pa de nyid lhan cig pa'i dngos po grong khyer yin mod /
translated: The mansion, etc., are indeed the city, the thing that is coexistent.

original: yod pas ci bya zhe na de ltar brjod par nus pa bden mod kyi 'on kyang skyes bu la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i yod pa'i grong khyer yin no zhes brjod pas gang gi tshe khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po bsal ba de'i
analyzed: yod pas ci bya zhe na de ltar brjod par nus pa bden mod kyi 'on kyang skyes bu la sogs pas khyad par du byas pa'i yod pa'i grong khyer yin no zhes brjod pas gang gi tshe khyad par dang khyad par can gyi dngos po bsal ba de'i
translated: the qualified is eliminated.üîΩAt that time, since those two are the qualifier and the qualified, the mere

original: tshe / de gnyis khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par du byed pa yin pas na ldan ba'i dngos po tsam de ltar yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tshe / de gnyis khyad par du bya ba dang khyad par du byed pa yin pas na ldan ba'i dngos po tsam de ltar yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur ro //
translated: relation is like that.

original: der gyur pa de grong khyer ma yin ba bsal na gzhan yang bzlog pa grub pa kho na'o //
analyzed: der gyur pa de grong khyer ma yin ba bsal na gzhan yang bzlog pa grub pa kho na'o //
translated: If that were the city, and the non-city were eliminated, then the oppositeüîΩwould be established.üîΩTherefore, in order to avoid that, he says that they are not the object of help

original: des na 'di bzlog pa'i phyir phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa ma yin pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: des na 'di bzlog pa'i phyir phan par bya ba dang / phan par byed pa ma yin pa zhes smos so //
translated: and the helper.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: gang gis 'di ltar 'gyur ba grogs byed pa @213a * //
analyzed: gang gis 'di ltar 'gyur ba grogs byed pa @213a * //
translated: If it were like that, the helper would beüîΩthe thing that is the object of help.üîΩBut that is not the case.

original: yang dngos po cung zad gcig tu brjod dgos so //
analyzed: yang dngos po cung zad gcig tu brjod dgos so //
translated: Therefore, one must say that the helper is a thing of some kind.

original: de yang ldan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du ni mi nus te /
analyzed: de yang ldan pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid du ni mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, it cannot be the characteristic of possession, etc.

original: de ni rdzas la yod pa nyid kyis khang bzangs la yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rdzas la yod pa nyid kyis khang bzangs la yang mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not apply to a mansion, since it exists as a substance.

original: de lta na yang 'di dngos po khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yin pas phan gdags bya 'dogs byed kyi dngos por 'gyur na de ni 'dir med de /
analyzed: de lta na yang 'di dngos po khyad par can du 'gyur ba'i rang bzhin 'ga' zhig yin pas phan gdags bya 'dogs byed kyi dngos por 'gyur na de ni 'dir med de /
translated: Even so, since it would be a particular entity, it would be a thing that is benefited or a thing that benefits. But that does not exist here,

original: yod pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because existence is permanent.

original: phan gdags bya 'dogs byed kyi dngos po yin yang rtogs pa gcig gi rten du gyur pa'i dngos po tha dad pa 'ga' yang ma grub pas na skyes bu dang khang bzangs dang yod pa tsam 'dir lus pa yin na /
analyzed: phan gdags bya 'dogs byed kyi dngos po yin yang rtogs pa gcig gi rten du gyur pa'i dngos po tha dad pa 'ga' yang ma grub pas na skyes bu dang khang bzangs dang yod pa tsam 'dir lus pa yin na /
translated: Even if it were a thing that is benefited or a thing that benefits, since no different thing that is the basis of a single cognition is established, only a person, a mansion, and mere existence remain.

original: de ltar na yang grong khyer zhes gcig gi tshig 'dir ga la 'gyur zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar na yang grong khyer zhes gcig gi tshig 'dir ga la 'gyur zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Even so, how could this be the word for one, namely, ‚Äúcity‚Äù?

original: skyes bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: This is explained in the line ‚Äúa person, etc.‚Äù

original: 'on te de dag 'ga' zhig tu nus pa tha mi dad pa la brten nas gcig gi tshig gzhung 'dzugs na de'i tshe nus pa tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la dngos po bzhin du tha dad pa'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te de dag 'ga' zhig tu nus pa tha mi dad pa la brten nas gcig gi tshig gzhung 'dzugs na de'i tshe nus pa tha mi dad pa'i phyogs la dngos po bzhin du tha dad pa'i phyir mang po'i tshig tu 'gyur ro //
translated: But if they are established as the word of one on the basis of their being the same in terms of some capacity, then, since they are different in terms of the different capacities, they would be the words of many.

original: tha dad pa'i phyogs la yang nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yang tha dad par thug pa med do //
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyogs la yang nus pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yang tha dad par thug pa med do //
translated: And in terms of the different capacities, the capacity to assist would be different, and so on, ad infinitum.

original: de de las tha mi dad na ni phan gdags par bya ba'i nus pa yang tha mi dad pas na gcig gi tshig tu mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de de las tha mi dad na ni phan gdags par bya ba'i nus pa yang tha mi dad pas na gcig gi tshig tu mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not different from that, then the capacity to be assisted would not be different, and so it would not be the word of one.

original: 'di nyid ni gal te 'di lta bu rnams zhes bya ba nas kyi na'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
analyzed: 'di nyid ni gal te 'di lta bu rnams zhes bya ba nas kyi na'o zhes bya ba'i bar gyis bshad do //
translated: This is explained by ‚ÄúIf they are like this . . . ‚Äù up to ‚Äúit is not so.‚Äù

original: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i phyir nam mkha'i zhes smos so //
analyzed: phyed phyi ma bshad pa'i phyir nam mkha'i zhes smos so //
translated: In order to explain the latter half of the verse, ‚Äúspace‚Äù is mentioned.

original: de ltar tha dad pa de yang spyi tha mi dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: de ltar tha dad pa de yang spyi tha mi dad pa nyid du 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: Thus, if that difference is the same as the difference of the universal,

original: de la ni tha mi dad pa mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de la ni tha mi dad pa mi 'thad do zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: it is not tenable that it is not different. This is explained by ‚ÄúIf it is like this . . . ‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to space.

original: gal te de la spyi la yod na de'i tshe 'di tha dad par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ni med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i rang bzhin nyid nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes brjod par 'gyur na de yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: gal te de la spyi la yod na de'i tshe 'di tha dad par yang 'gyur ba zhig na de ni med pa'i phyir nam mkha'i rang bzhin nyid nam mkha'i rang bzhin zhes brjod par 'gyur na de yang mi rung ngo //
translated: If the universal exists in that, then it would be different from it. But since it does not exist, it would be like the nature of space itself, and that is not tenable.

original: des ni de ltar tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des ni de ltar tha dad pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid bsal ba yin no //
translated: Thus he has eliminated the reason for their being different.

original: spyi'i rang bzhin nyid bsal bas ni tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yang spangs par 'gyur bas ngag gcig tu nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin nyid bsal bas ni tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan yang spangs par 'gyur bas ngag gcig tu nye bar bkod do //
translated: Since he has eliminated the reason for their being the same, he has also eliminated the reason for their being different.

original: nam mkha' rnams mang po yin na ni de la spyi yod par 'gyur na /
analyzed: nam mkha' rnams mang po yin na ni de la spyi yod par 'gyur na /
translated: If there were many spaces, then a universal would exist in them.

original: de ni ma yin pas ji ltar de la spyi yod par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ni ma yin pas ji ltar de la spyi yod par 'gyur /
translated: But that is not the case, so how could a universal exist in them?

original: @213b gal te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa spyi'i ngo bor 'thad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: @213b gal te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa spyi'i ngo bor 'thad pa ma yin nam /
translated: If you think that it is not tenable that pervasion, etc. are the nature of universals,

original: bdag la sogs pa bsal ba gzhan la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa bsal ba gzhan la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are eliminated in relation to the self, etc., and they exist in other things as well,

original: des na de dag nyid de ltar tha mi dad par bstan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na de dag nyid de ltar tha mi dad par bstan par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they are taught to be not different in that way.

original: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni khyad pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni khyad pa nyid la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response that it is not so is ‚Äúbecause of the difference, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag la ni mkha' nyid ces brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de dag la ni mkha' nyid ces brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: Space is not said to be that.

original: don gzhan la ni zhes smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan la ni zhes smos te /
translated: ‚Äú In another object‚Äù is stated.

original: gang zhig yod pas gsal ba de la nam mkha'o snyam par rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni nam mkha' nyid ces bya bar brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig yod pas gsal ba de la nam mkha'o snyam par rtogs par 'gyur ba de ni nam mkha' nyid ces bya bar brjod pa yin te /
translated: That which is understood as space because it exists is said to be space itself.

original: ba lang nyid yod pas khra bo la sogs pa la ba lang ngo snyam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid yod pas khra bo la sogs pa la ba lang ngo snyam pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the understanding of a cow because of the existence of cowness.

original: des na gal te khyab pa nyid dang ldan pas nam mkha' nam mkhar 'gyur na /
analyzed: des na gal te khyab pa nyid dang ldan pas nam mkha' nam mkhar 'gyur na /
translated: Therefore, if space is space because it has pervasion,

original: bdag la sogs pa'i gzhan dag kyang khyab pa nyid dang ldan pas nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i gzhan dag kyang khyab pa nyid dang ldan pas nam mkha'i ngo bo nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it follows that other things such as the self would have the nature of space because they have pervasion.

original: de ltar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is not reasonable.

original: de dag ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni de'i rang bzhin yin pa nyid du mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that those are the intrinsic reality of that.

original: gzhan yang khyab pa nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad ni yod pa nyid la bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyab pa nyid ces bya ba ni thams cad ni yod pa nyid la bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, ‚Äúpervasiveness‚Äù is the activity of all that exists.

original: gal te de mkha' nyid yin na ni khyab pa nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: gal te de mkha' nyid yin na ni khyab pa nyid la sogs pa rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If that is space itself, then it follows that pervasiveness and so on are essenceless.

original: de dag kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag kyang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: This is explained by ‚ÄúThose also.‚Äù

original: dper na rdzas rang gi ngo bos ni ba lang dang ba lang ma yin par rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
analyzed: dper na rdzas rang gi ngo bos ni ba lang dang ba lang ma yin par rnam par gzhag par mi nus te /
translated: For example, a substance cannot be posited as a cow or not a cow by its own nature.

original: ba lang nyid dang ldan pas ba lang du rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ba lang nyid dang ldan pas ba lang du rnam par 'jog pa de bzhin du /
translated: It is posited as a cow because it possesses cowness.

original: nam mkha' rang bzhin med pa yang de lta bu'i ngo bo khyad par du gyur pa'i nam mkha' dang ldan pa las yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' rang bzhin med pa yang de lta bu'i ngo bo khyad par du gyur pa'i nam mkha' dang ldan pa las yin no //
translated: In the same way, essenceless space is like that because it possesses space that is a special entity.

original: de yang khyad par nyid la sogs pa yin pas de dag kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang khyad par nyid la sogs pa yin pas de dag kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since those are the distinctions and so on, it follows that they also are essenceless.

original: khyad par rnams kyi khyad par nyid ni rang gi ngo bor rten nye bar sgyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyi khyad par nyid ni rang gi ngo bor rten nye bar sgyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: The difference of differences is the transformation of the nature of the basis itself.

original: des na nam mkha' ji lta ba bzhin nam mkha' nyid kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni 'di rang bzhin med pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na nam mkha' ji lta ba bzhin nam mkha' nyid kyang de lta bu'i rang bzhin du rtogs par bya ba'i phyir ni 'di rang bzhin med pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to understand that space is just like that, i.e., that space is essenceless, it is said that space is essenceless.

original: 'on te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa nam mkhar rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i khyad par rnams rang bzhin med pa ma yin yang nam mkha' nyid rang bzhin med pa yin na /
analyzed: 'on te khyab pa nyid la sogs pa nam mkhar rtogs pa'i rten du gyur pa'i khyad par rnams rang bzhin med pa ma yin yang nam mkha' nyid rang bzhin med pa yin na /
translated: But if the differences that are the basis for the understanding of space as pervasive, etc., are not essenceless, but space itself is essenceless,

original: de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /üîΩba lang nyid dang ldan yang khra bo la sogs pa @214a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe ha cang thal bar 'gyur te / ba lang nyid dang ldan yang khra bo la sogs pa @214a * //
translated: then it follows, absurdly, that

original: ba lang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: even though it possesses cowness, a multicolored cow is not a cow.

original: de bzhad pa ni de yang zhes smos te /
analyzed: de bzhad pa ni de yang zhes smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThat also . . .‚Äù

original: yang gi sgra ni sdud pa'o //
analyzed: yang gi sgra ni sdud pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù is inclusive.

original: des zhes bya bas ni nam mkha' ba zung ba yin no //
analyzed: des zhes bya bas ni nam mkha' ba zung ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to space.

original: de ltar na yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de ltar na yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: Even so, there is no understanding.

original: rtogs pa'i yul ma yin par thal ba'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yul ma yin par thal ba'o //
translated: It follows that it is not an object of knowledge.

original: gal te da lta bu ma yin pa'i khyad bar du gyur pa'i spyi dang ldan yang rang bzhin med pa yin na ni ba lang nyid dang ldan yang ba lang la ba lang ngo zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te da lta bu ma yin pa'i khyad bar du gyur pa'i spyi dang ldan yang rang bzhin med pa yin na ni ba lang nyid dang ldan yang ba lang la ba lang ngo zhes rtogs par mi 'gyur te /
translated: If a universal that is not a present thing and is a special transformation exists, but is essenceless, then even though a cow possesses cowness, one would not understand that a cow is a cow,

original: de dang ldan yang ba lang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan yang ba lang ma yin pa'i rang bzhin nyid srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though it possesses that, it is possible that it would not have the nature of a cow.

original: gal te khyad par nyid la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la yod pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gal te khyad par nyid la sogs pa ni nam mkha' la yod pa nyid yin no //
translated: If a special transformation and so on exist in space,

original: de yang rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' nyid gzhan dang ldan yang de dag rang bzhin med pa ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na brjod pa /
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir nam mkha' nyid gzhan dang ldan yang de dag rang bzhin med pa ma yin par ji ltar 'gyur zhe na brjod pa /
translated: and if they are essenceless, then even though space possesses them, how could they not be essenceless?

original: nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin med pa yin la /
analyzed: nam mkha'i rang bzhin ni rang bzhin med pa yin la /
translated: The nature of space is essencelessness.

original: de'i khyad par yang nam mkha' nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i khyad par yang nam mkha' nyid yin no //
translated: Its special transformations are space itself.

original: khyab par byed pa nyid ni khyab par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: khyab par byed pa nyid ni khyab par byed pa yin no //
translated: The pervader is the pervaded.

original: des na khyab par byed pa nyid kyis ni rang bzhin med pa ma yin no //üîΩdper na rdzas gcig nyid ba lang nyid las ni ba lang nyid du 'gyur zhing khra bo nyid las ni khra bo nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: des na khyab par byed pa nyid kyis ni rang bzhin med pa ma yin no // dper na rdzas gcig nyid ba lang nyid las ni ba lang nyid du 'gyur zhing khra bo nyid las ni khra bo nyid yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, it is not the case that the pervader itself is essenceless.

original: ba lang nyid khra bo ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang nyid khra bo ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the very same substance is a cow with respect to cowness, and it is a cow with respect to being variegated, but it is not a cow that is variegated.

original: de bzhin du dngos po drug gi tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang dngos po drug gi ngo bo rnams kyi tshogs gzhan med pas dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: de bzhin du dngos po drug gi tshogs zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams kyang dngos po drug gi ngo bo rnams kyi tshogs gzhan med pas dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du 'jug par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Similarly, with respect to such terms as ‚Äúthe collection of the six things,‚Äù since there is no other collection of the entities of the six things, how could they apply to the things as they are?

original: de ni spyi ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni spyi ma yin te /
translated: That is not a universal,

original: drug po dag la spyi yod pa'i phyir dang / spyi la yang spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: drug po dag la spyi yod pa'i phyir dang / spyi la yang spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the six things have a universal, and because a universal does not have a universal.

original: grangs dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it a number,

original: de rnams la yon tan yod pa'i phyir dang / de yang yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams la yon tan yod pa'i phyir dang / de yang yon tan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the six things have a quality, and because that is not a quality.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag kyang rtogs par bya'o //
translated: You should understand the others in the same way.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is as follows.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //üîΩdes na de ltar gang phyir dngos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i rang bzhin brjod par sngon du 'gro ba na /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o // des na de ltar gang phyir dngos kun zhes bya ba la sogs pas de'i rang bzhin brjod par sngon du 'gro ba na /
translated: Thus, and so on.

original: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyi tshad ma brjod de /
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyi tshad ma brjod de /
translated: Therefore, in this way, because all entities and so on, having stated its nature, he states the valid cognition that has the object of other-exclusion.

original: de la 'ang gzhan las ldog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi sems gzhan du brjod par dogs pa brjod par rnam par gzhag pa drungs phyung ba nyid kyis lan btab @214b nas /
analyzed: de la 'ang gzhan las ldog pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas slob dpon gyi sems gzhan du brjod par dogs pa brjod par rnam par gzhag pa drungs phyung ba nyid kyis lan btab @214b nas /
translated: There, exclusion from other and so on, having stated the doubt that the master's mind is directed elsewhere, he answers by uprooting the very establishment.

original: da ni gzhan sel ba'i sgo nas yul du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi byed pa gang yin pa de'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs zin pa'i rgol ba nyid bkod do //
analyzed: da ni gzhan sel ba'i sgo nas yul du byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi byed pa gang yin pa de'i skabs dbye ba'i phyir da ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa spangs zin pa'i rgol ba nyid bkod do //
translated: Now, in order to open the section on the function of the conceptual thoughts that take objects through other-exclusion, he states the objection that was already refuted, saying now, and so on.

original: nam mkha'i zhes bya bas bshad zin pa'i lan nyid 'debs so //
analyzed: nam mkha'i zhes bya bas bshad zin pa'i lan nyid 'debs so //
translated: With space, he gives the same answer as before.

original: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows.

original: gal te yang mkha' las tha dad pa'i mkha' nyid ces bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang mkha' zhes mi brjod kyi /
analyzed: gal te yang mkha' las tha dad pa'i mkha' nyid ces bya ba yod pa ma yin pa de lta na yang mkha' zhes mi brjod kyi /
translated: But even if there were no such thing as space that is different from space, still it would not be called space.

original: 'on kyang mkha' nyid ces brjod pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i don gzhan las log pa'i ngo bo nges par bzung bas khyad par gzhan spangs pa byas te ;
analyzed: 'on kyang mkha' nyid ces brjod pa gang yin pa de ni nam mkha'i don gzhan las log pa'i ngo bo nges par bzung bas khyad par gzhan spangs pa byas te ;
translated: Rather, what is called space is the nature of the negation of the object of negation, space.

original: nam mkha' tsam gyi ngo bo khyad par gzhan spangs nas shes par 'dod pa la /
analyzed: nam mkha' tsam gyi ngo bo khyad par gzhan spangs nas shes par 'dod pa la /
translated: When one wishes to know the nature of space alone, having eliminated other features,

original: mkha' nyid ces brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: mkha' nyid ces brjod pa yin no //
translated: one says ‚Äúspace itself.‚Äù

original: de de ltar de'i ngo bo brjod pa bshad pa thob nas /
analyzed: de de ltar de'i ngo bo brjod pa bshad pa thob nas /
translated: Having explained the nature of space in that way,

original: glags rnyed de rtsod pa ni thams cad las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: glags rnyed de rtsod pa ni thams cad las zhes bya'o //
translated: the opponent finds an opportunity to argue: ‚ÄúEverything is space.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what he says:

original: sgro ' dogs rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i yul can gyi dngos por ' gyur ba ngo bo rtogs par byed par yang rnam par gcod pa'i sgo kho nas byed pa'i phyir 'di sngon po ma yin no zhes brjod pa dang mtshungs par
analyzed: sgro ' dogs rnam par gcod par byed pa nyid kyis tha dad pa'i yul can gyi dngos por ' gyur ba ngo bo rtogs par byed par yang rnam par gcod pa'i sgo kho nas byed pa'i phyir 'di sngon po ma yin no zhes brjod pa dang mtshungs par
translated: Because it is a thing that has a different object, it is a thing that is realized by the exclusion of other. It is also realized by the door of exclusion alone. Therefore, it is similar to the statement, ‚ÄúIt is not blue.‚Äù

original: 'gyur ba'i sgra rnams kyang gal te dngos po rjod par byed na cha med pa'i don thams cad las log pa nyid shes pas 'dzin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'gyur ba'i sgra rnams kyang gal te dngos po rjod par byed na cha med pa'i don thams cad las log pa nyid shes pas 'dzin par 'gyur te /
translated: If the words ‚Äúit is‚Äù express a thing, then because of the knowledge of the mere exclusion of all partless objects, it would be apprehended.

original: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the eye and so on.

original: des na bsgrub pa'i yul can kho nar 'gyur bas gzhan sel ba la brten pa'i sgra dang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa nyid nyams par ' gyur ro //
analyzed: des na bsgrub pa'i yul can kho nar 'gyur bas gzhan sel ba la brten pa'i sgra dang tshad ma gzhan 'jug pa nyid nyams par ' gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since it would be only a positive object, the engagement of other words and valid knowledge that are based on the exclusion of other would be undermined.

original: des na dngos po'i yul can yin na thams cad las log pa brjod par 'gyur na de ni mi srid do //
analyzed: des na dngos po'i yul can yin na thams cad las log pa brjod par 'gyur na de ni mi srid do //
translated: Therefore, if it has a thing as its object, it would express the exclusion of all other things, but that is impossible.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs brjod pa'i bsam pas thams cad las log pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo khyad par du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gtan tshigs brjod pa'i bsam pas thams cad las log pa nyid kyis rang gi ngo bo khyad par du byas pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the reason is distinguished by the very fact that it is the opposite of everything, because of the intention to express the reason.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad las log pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad las log pa de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is the opposite of everything,

original: rang gi ngo bo brjod par mi srid de brjod na de lta bur gyur ba nyid du brjod par thal ba'i phyir na /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo brjod par mi srid de brjod na de lta bur gyur ba nyid du brjod par thal ba'i phyir na /
translated: it is not possible to express its own nature, because if it were expressed, it would follow that it would be expressed as such.

original: rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du 'thad pas tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo rig pa'i 'bras bu can nyid du 'thad pas tha dad par byed pa nyid ma yin par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that it has the effect of cognizing its own nature, and so it is not a distinct entity.

original: 'di dgag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di dgag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to refute this,

original: slob dpon gyis ngo bo nyid ces gsungs so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis ngo bo nyid ces gsungs so //
translated: the master [NƒÅgƒÅrjuna] said ‚Äúown nature.‚Äù

original: gang gis @215a * //
analyzed: gang gis @215a * //
translated: By what?

original: na der snang ba'i blo skyed par byed pas de nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba ngo bo de nyid de /
analyzed: na der snang ba'i blo skyed par byed pas de nyid brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba ngo bo de nyid de /
translated: It is that very nature which produces the cognition that appears as that, and that very nature is what is to be expressed.

original: thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo gang yin ba de nyid de /
analyzed: thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo gang yin ba de nyid de /
translated: That very nature which is the opposite of everything is that very nature.

original: sgras blo la 'jog par ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgras blo la 'jog par ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that the word establishes it in the mind.

original: de nyid 'jog pa ma yin no zhes smras pas de ni mi 'jog gi gzhan ni 'jog go zhes brjod pa yin na /
analyzed: de nyid 'jog pa ma yin no zhes smras pas de ni mi 'jog gi gzhan ni 'jog go zhes brjod pa yin na /
translated: But if you say that it is not posited by that, then you are saying that it is posited by something else.

original: de la re zhig de mi 'jog go zhes bya ba de gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dbang pos mi sod pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de la re zhig de mi 'jog go zhes bya ba de gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir dbang pos mi sod pa nyid ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bshad do //
translated: In that case, first, it is not tenable to say that it is not posited by that, because it would follow that it is not imperceptible to the senses, in order to establish that it is posited by something else.

original: gal te dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'dir brjod pas 'jog par 'gyur na ni dbang po'i mngon sum dang 'dra bar gsal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dngos po de'i ngo bo nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'dir brjod pas 'jog par 'gyur na ni dbang po'i mngon sum dang 'dra bar gsal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the nature of an entity that is expressed here were posited by that, then it would be as clear as direct perception by the senses.

original: sgras de'i ngo bo 'jog pa ni don gyi rnam pa can gyi blo skyed pa yin te /
analyzed: sgras de'i ngo bo 'jog pa ni don gyi rnam pa can gyi blo skyed pa yin te /
translated: The expression of the nature of that entity by a word is the production of an awareness that has the aspect of the object.

original: de'i blo nyid kyi don dam pa ni de'i rnam pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i blo nyid kyi don dam pa ni de'i rnam pa tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the ultimate of that awareness is merely its aspect.

original: sgras kyang don gsal bar byed pa na /
analyzed: sgras kyang don gsal bar byed pa na /
translated: And when a word makes an object clear,

original: don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par shes pa nyid bskyed par bya ba yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnas pa'i grub pa'i mtha' la ltos nas bshad pa yin no //
translated: The statement ‚Äúconsciousness itself, which has the aspect of the object, is what is produced‚Äù is made in consideration of the tenets of the VaibhƒÅ·π£ikas.

original: 'di mngon par zhen pa'i yul ni ma yin no //üîΩrnam pa med pa'i don gyi yul can gyi rig pa byed na yang don rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bur gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid don gyi ngo bo de ltar rig par byed pas /
analyzed: 'di mngon par zhen pa'i yul ni ma yin no // rnam pa med pa'i don gyi yul can gyi rig pa byed na yang don rig pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bur gyur pa nyid du rtogs pa de lta bu'i rang bzhin nyid don gyi ngo bo de ltar rig par byed pas /
translated: The object of such a consciousness is not a real entity.üîΩEven if the object of a consciousness is devoid of aspects, the object is still cognized in the form of the consciousness that cognizes it.

original: sgra don rig pa byed pa kho nar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: sgra don rig pa byed pa kho nar 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Thus, the object is cognized in the form of the consciousness that cognizes it.

original: dper na rdza mkhan bum pa mngon par sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: dper na rdza mkhan bum pa mngon par sgrub pa'am /
translated: For example, when a potter produces a pot,

original: so bag bskyed pa na /üîΩbum pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bur gyur pa nyid du /
analyzed: so bag bskyed pa na / bum pa'i rang gi ngo bo ji lta bur gyur pa nyid du /
translated: he produces the pot in the form of the pot.üîΩThe potter produces the pot in the form of the pot.

original: dmigs pa de lta bu nyid byed pa gang gi de ma thag tu dmigs pa'i byed pa des 'dis bum pa byas so zhes brjod la /
analyzed: dmigs pa de lta bu nyid byed pa gang gi de ma thag tu dmigs pa'i byed pa des 'dis bum pa byas so zhes brjod la /
translated: Immediately after the potter has produced the pot, he is said to have made the pot.

original: ji lta bur gyur pas gzhan du gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pas gzhan du gyur pa de ni /
translated: What is the case with the transformation of the cognition?

original: gzhan byas par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhan byas par 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: It is the case that the transformation is made by another.

original: rdza mkhan yin zhes te de la ' gyur ba gang yin pa de thams cad rdza ma nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //üîΩde bzhin du rnam par rtog pa don rtogs par byed pa 'am /
analyzed: rdza mkhan yin zhes te de la ' gyur ba gang yin pa de thams cad rdza ma nyid du 'gyur ba ni ma yin no // de bzhin du rnam par rtog pa don rtogs par byed pa 'am /
translated: But not everything that is transformed into a pot is a pot.

original: sgra don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes khas blangs par gyur kyang don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dpyad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sgra don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no zhes khas blangs par gyur kyang don rtogs pa'i rang bzhin dpyad par bya ba yin no //
translated: In the same way, even if one accepts that the conceptual cognition is the cause of the understanding of the object or the cause of the understanding of the meaning of the word, the nature of the understanding of the object should be investigated.

original: gal te di don rtogs pa ji lta bu yin par dmigs pa de lta bu nyid yin na ni des na 'di don @215b rtogs pa dang sgra don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: gal te di don rtogs pa ji lta bu yin par dmigs pa de lta bu nyid yin na ni des na 'di don @215b rtogs pa dang sgra don rtogs pa'i rgyu yin pa nyid do //
translated: If the understanding of the object is just as it is observed, then it is the cause of the understanding of the object and the meaning of the word.

original: dbang po byed pa dang ldan pas don rig pa na don rtogs pa dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: dbang po byed pa dang ldan pas don rig pa na don rtogs pa dmigs pa yin no //
translated: When the sense faculty is functioning, the cognition of the object observes the understanding of the object.

original: gang la don gsal bar gyur ba'i ngo bo de nyid don rig pa yin la /
analyzed: gang la don gsal bar gyur ba'i ngo bo de nyid don rig pa yin la /
translated: That very nature in which the object becomes clear is the cognition of the object.

original: mngon sum la don gsal ba ni rtsod pa med do //
analyzed: mngon sum la don gsal ba ni rtsod pa med do //
translated: There is no dispute that the object is clear in perception.

original: des na gal te rnam par rtog pa yang don rig pa yin na ni 'dir yang don gsal bar 'gyur bas sgra dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul dbang po las 'das par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gal te rnam par rtog pa yang don rig pa yin na ni 'dir yang don gsal bar 'gyur bas sgra dang rjes su dpag pa'i yul dbang po las 'das par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if conceptual cognition also cognizes objects, then the object would be clear in this case as well. So how could the object of sound and inference be beyond the senses?

original: dbang po las ma skyes pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: dbang po las ma skyes pa'i shes pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say it is because it is a cognition that does not arise from the senses,

original: gsal bzhin pa'i dngos po ni dbang po las ma 'das pa'am /
analyzed: gsal bzhin pa'i dngos po ni dbang po las ma 'das pa'am /
translated: then a thing that is clear is not beyond the senses.

original: mngon sum du brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: mngon sum du brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: It is called manifest.

original: dbang po 'brel pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dbang po 'brel pa tsam gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not merely related to the senses.

original: 'on kyang 'di'i de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni dbang po dang 'brel pa las yin pa'i phyir dbang po las ma 'das par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di'i de lta bur gyur pa nyid ni dbang po dang 'brel pa las yin pa'i phyir dbang po las ma 'das par brjod pa yin no //
translated: However, because it is related to the senses in that way, it is said not to be beyond the senses.

original: des na rig pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po nyid gsal ba dang / mngon du byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rig pas yul du byas pa'i dngos po nyid gsal ba dang / mngon du byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the thing that is the object of cognition becomes clear and manifest.

original: des na gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rig pa zhugs kyang yul gsal bar 'gyur ba'am mngon sum du byas pa ma yin na /
analyzed: des na gal te rnam par rtog pa'i rig pa zhugs kyang yul gsal bar 'gyur ba'am mngon sum du byas pa ma yin na /
translated: Therefore, if conceptual cognition engages but the object is not clear or manifest,üîΩthen it is not clear or manifest.

original: 'o na rig pas yul du byas kyang mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa gsal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'o na rig pas yul du byas kyang mi 'gyur ba gang yin pa gsal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: Well then, what is the object of awareness that is not transformed, but is clear or manifest?

original: mngon sum du byas pa gzhan gang zhig yin /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas pa gzhan gang zhig yin /
translated: What is it that is made manifest?

original: des na don gyi yul can nyid yin na don gsal ba la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir don gyi yul can gyi rtogs pa thams cad ni mngon sum nyid dang / sgra la sogs pa yang dbang po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don gyi yul can nyid yin na don gsal ba la 'khrul pa med pa'i phyir don gyi yul can gyi rtogs pa thams cad ni mngon sum nyid dang / sgra la sogs pa yang dbang po dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, if it has an object that is a thing, since there is no error in the manifestation of a thing, all awarenesses that have an object that is a thing are direct perception, and sound and so on would be equivalent to the sense faculties.

original: gal te ngo bo de blo la mi 'jog na /
analyzed: gal te ngo bo de blo la mi 'jog na /
translated: If that nature is not posited in the mind,

original: 'o na gang 'jog ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang 'jog ce na /
translated: then what is posited?

original: 'di de lta bu zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di de lta bu zhes smos so //
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is like this.‚Äù

original: snga mas ni don gyi rang bzhin 'jog pa bkag la /
analyzed: snga mas ni don gyi rang bzhin 'jog pa bkag la /
translated: The former refutes the positing of the nature of a thing,

original: 'dis ni rang bzhin gzhan 'jog par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni rang bzhin gzhan 'jog par bshad pa yin no //
translated: and this explains the positing of another nature.

original: smra ba bo 'di skabs su bab pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de lta bu de shes par bya'o snyam nas te /
analyzed: smra ba bo 'di skabs su bab pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de lta bu de shes par bya'o snyam nas te /
translated: This proponent thinks, ‚ÄúThe nature that is relevant here should be understood to be like this.‚Äù

original: rtogs pa'i yul du bya'o snyam du bsams kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gtod par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yul du bya'o snyam du bsams kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan gtod par byed pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Even if one thinks, ‚ÄúI will make the object of understanding,‚Äù it is only a projection of a conceptual image.

original: dbang po'i shes pas rtogs pa'i don ni 'di'i gzugs brnyan ji lta bur gyur pa de lta bu nyid do //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas rtogs pa'i don ni 'di'i gzugs brnyan ji lta bur gyur pa de lta bu nyid do //
translated: The object understood by a sense consciousness is just like the image of it.

original: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa de dang 'dra ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa de dang 'dra ba yin te /
translated: It has the same aspect as itself.

original: me long gi gzugs brnyan @216a * //
analyzed: me long gi gzugs brnyan @216a * //
translated: It is like a reflection in a mirror.

original: bzhin no // rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa med par de rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bzhin no // rnam pa de lta bu'i rnam pa med par de rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it did not have that kind of aspect, it would not cognize it.

original: rnam par rtog pas ni don ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar rig pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas ni don ji ltar 'gyur ba de ltar rig pa ma yin te /
translated: Conceptual consciousness does not cognize an object in the way it appears,

original: dbang pos mi sod pa ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na 'di ni gzhan du 'gyur ba rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: dbang pos mi sod pa ma yin par thal ba'i phyir ro // des na 'di ni gzhan du 'gyur ba rig pa'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: because it would follow that it would not be apprehended by the sense faculties.

original: ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa'am /
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin du rig pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is the nature of consciousness to cognize what is different from itself.üîΩIt is not the nature of consciousness to cognize what is the same as itself.

original: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid ni de rig par gyur par nges pa yin pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i gzugs brnyan don dang mi mthun par brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa'i rnam pa dang ldan pa nyid ni de rig par gyur par nges pa yin pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba'i gzugs brnyan don dang mi mthun par brjod do //
translated: Because it is certain that the cognition of such an aspect is the cognition of that object, the aspect is said to be a reflected image that appears to thought but is not in accord with its object.

original: des na don 'dis na /
analyzed: des na don 'dis na /
translated: Thus, this means that

original: rnam par rtog pas gzugs brnyan khyad par du byas so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas gzugs brnyan khyad par du byas so //
translated: thought is qualified by a reflected image.

original: gal te 'dir sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de lta na yang phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bur gyur pa de lta bu nyid 'di la mi snang ste /
analyzed: gal te 'dir sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa de lta na yang phyi rol gyi sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ji lta bur gyur pa de lta bu nyid 'di la mi snang ste /
translated: Even if one understands the nature of blue, etc., in this way, the nature of external blue, etc., does not appear as it is,

original: mngon sum nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow, absurdly, that it would be direct perception.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni phyir rol gyi sngon po dang mi 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni phyir rol gyi sngon po dang mi 'dra ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of thought is not similar to external blue.

original: /'di la mi 'dra ba ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: /'di la mi 'dra ba ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is it that is not similar?

original: ci mi 'dra ba ni mi shes te /
analyzed: ci mi 'dra ba ni mi shes te /
translated: I do not know what is not similar.

original: gang dag mig byed pa med pa na yang rnam par rtog pas gzugs rtogs pa na bdag gis gzugs ma mthong zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa po nyid la dri bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gang dag mig byed pa med pa na yang rnam par rtog pas gzugs rtogs pa na bdag gis gzugs ma mthong zhes bya bar 'gyur ba'i rtogs pa po nyid la dri bar bya ba yin no //
translated: But when the eye is not functioning, and one conceives form through thought, the one who conceives, ‚ÄúI do not see form,‚Äù should be asked about this.

original: des na gzugs rnam par btags pa la yang ma mthong bar rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa rig pa'i yul las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa nyid ci zhig yin /
analyzed: des na gzugs rnam par btags pa la yang ma mthong bar rtogs par 'gyur ba gang yin pa rig pa'i yul las gzhan pa'i dmigs pa nyid ci zhig yin /
translated: Thus, when one conceives ‚ÄúI do not see‚Äù even in regard to a form that is imagined, what is the object that is different from the object of cognition?

original: de'i phyir des na mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni 'dir mi snang gi 'on kyang gzhan nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir des na mthong ba'i yul du gyur pa'i rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni 'dir mi snang gi 'on kyang gzhan nyid snang ba yin pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the nature that is the object of seeing does not appear here, but rather something else appears. Thus, one conceives in this way.

original: des na mi 'dra ba ni de nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na mi 'dra ba ni de nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the difference is just that.

original: blo gros blun po gang dag 'dir yang rang gi ngo bo mi 'dra bar bstan par ma nus pas don byas bar mi nus par byas pas mi mthun pa'i ston pa de dag ni kho bos gzhan du rgyas par bkag zin to //
analyzed: blo gros blun po gang dag 'dir yang rang gi ngo bo mi 'dra bar bstan par ma nus pas don byas bar mi nus par byas pas mi mthun pa'i ston pa de dag ni kho bos gzhan du rgyas par bkag zin to //
translated: The foolish think that since the nature of the self cannot be shown to be different, it cannot perform a function. We have refuted this kind of nonconforming teacher elsewhere in great detail.

original: brtags pa'i don kyang rig bya'i phyir //
analyzed: brtags pa'i don kyang rig bya'i phyir //
translated: And because the object of the investigation is to be known.

original: gzhan rtogs med phyir 'bral dbyer med //
analyzed: gzhan rtogs med phyir 'bral dbyer med //
translated: Because there is no other understanding, there is no separation from the non-separable.

original: de ltar las byed med pa las //
analyzed: de ltar las byed med pa las //
translated: Thus, from the absence of an agent of action,

original: bzlog na sgro 'dogs la shes nyid //
analyzed: bzlog na sgro 'dogs la shes nyid //
translated: The opposite is understood to be reification.

original: ces bsad zin to //
analyzed: ces bsad zin to //
translated: This has been explained.

original: gal te don gyi rnam pa dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan nyid /
analyzed: gal te don gyi rnam pa dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan nyid /
translated: If the mere image that is not like the form of the object

original: rnam par @216b rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan yin na /
analyzed: rnam par @216b rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan yin na /
translated: is the conceptual image,

original: dung ser por shes pa la sogs pa dag gi rnam pa yang rnam par rtogs pa'i gzugs brnyan du 'gyur te /
analyzed: dung ser por shes pa la sogs pa dag gi rnam pa yang rnam par rtogs pa'i gzugs brnyan du 'gyur te /
translated: then the images of the cognition of a yellow conch and so on would also be conceptual images,

original: dkar po la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkar po la sogs pa dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are images that are not like white and so on.

original: 'di dag rnam par rtogs pa'i rnam pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par rtogs pa'i rnam pa yang ma yin te /
translated: But they are not conceptual images,

original: de'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i shes pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because their cognition is non-conceptual.

original: des na don dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan nyid ni //
analyzed: des na don dang mi 'dra ba'i gzugs brnyan nyid ni //
translated: Therefore, the mere image that is not like the object

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan ma yin no //
translated: is not a conceptual image.

original: brjod pa ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dad ni de'i yul dang dus nges pa'i don dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis mi 'dra bar brjod de /
analyzed: brjod pa ser po la sogs pa'i rnam pa dad ni de'i yul dang dus nges pa'i don dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis mi 'dra bar brjod de /
translated: The aspect of the object, such as yellow, is said to be different from the object, because of the restriction of place and time.

original: de'i yul gyi rnam par bcad par gsal ba'i dung ser po de na med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i yul gyi rnam par bcad par gsal ba'i dung ser po de na med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The yellow conch is not present in the place of the conch, because

original: de ni dkar po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dkar po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it has the nature of white.

original: de ltar don de gtan mi srid pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar don de gtan mi srid pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because such an object is absolutely impossible.

original: ser po'i rnam pa'i dung gtan mi srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: ser po'i rnam pa'i dung gtan mi srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The yellow aspect of the conch is not absolutely impossible.

original: 'on kyang de na med pa'i phyir du dung ser por rtogs pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid do //üîΩrnam par rtog pa la ji ltar snang ba'i rnam pa de dang 'dra ba ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang de na med pa'i phyir du dung ser por rtogs pa dngos po'i yul can ma yin pa nyid do // rnam par rtog pa la ji ltar snang ba'i rnam pa de dang 'dra ba ni /
translated: However, the cognition of the yellow conch is not a cognition with a real object, because it does not exist.

original: ye mi srid pa kho na ste /
analyzed: ye mi srid pa kho na ste /
translated: The aspect that appears in a conceptual cognition is absolutely impossible.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa dngos po dang mi mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa dngos po dang mi mthun pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the aspect of a conceptual cognition is not in accord with reality.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa dngos po snang ba ma yin pas mngon sum ltar snang bar bshad de //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa dngos po snang ba ma yin pas mngon sum ltar snang bar bshad de //
translated: Therefore, since the object does not appear in the conceptual cognition, it is said to be like a direct perception.

original: dngos po yod kyang rnam par rtog pa de ltar rtog pa med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: dngos po yod kyang rnam par rtog pa de ltar rtog pa med pa'i phyir la /
translated: Even though the object exists, the conceptual cognition does not conceive it in that way.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni dngos po rtog pa srid kyang de na rnam pa de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa ni dngos po rtog pa srid kyang de na rnam pa de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though it is possible for a double moon and so on to exist as an object, the aspect does not exist in that way.üîΩBecause the object does not appear in the conceptual cognition,

original: rnam rtog dngos mi snang phyir dang // nya bar bslad pa slu ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rnam rtog dngos mi snang phyir dang // nya bar bslad pa slu ba'i phyir //
translated: and because the object is deceptive,

original: mngon sum ltar snang zhes bshad do //
analyzed: mngon sum ltar snang zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said to be like a direct perception.

original: de lta bu'i dngos po ye mi srid do zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: de lta bu'i dngos po ye mi srid do zhes bya bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: How is it understood that such an object is absolutely impossible?

original: de skyes bzhin ba tsam na mngon sum nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyes bzhin ba tsam na mngon sum nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it follows that it would be a direct perception as soon as it arises.

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo rnams ni skyes bzhin pa na mngon sum nyid du srid pa yin yang /
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i blo rnams ni skyes bzhin pa na mngon sum nyid du srid pa yin yang /
translated: Even though it is possible for cognitions of a double moon and so on to be direct perception as soon as they arise,

original: gnod par byed pas sel ba yin no //
analyzed: gnod par byed pas sel ba yin no //
translated: they are eliminated by a countering cognition.

original: 'dir ni srid pa nyid mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'dir ni srid pa nyid mi 'thob bo //
translated: But here, it does not even obtain that it is possible.

original: rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i yul can du smra ba rnams kyang de la tshad ma gzhan du 'khrul pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩdes na 'dir dngos po mi gsal ba nyid kyis dngos po mngon @217a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dngos po'i yul can du smra ba rnams kyang de la tshad ma gzhan du 'khrul pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro // des na 'dir dngos po mi gsal ba nyid kyis dngos po mngon @217a * //
translated: Even those who maintain that conceptual cognition has a real entity as its object are forced to admit that it is erroneous with respect to another valid cognition.

original: sum du byed pa mi srid pa yin no //
analyzed: sum du byed pa mi srid pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is impossible for a cognition to perceive a real entity by means of an unclear entity.

original: des na 'khrul pa yin yang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa las rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'khrul pa yin yang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa las rnam par rtog pa tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, even though it is erroneous, conceptual cognition is different from the cognition of two moons, etc.

original: de dag ni don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: de dag ni don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: They have the nature of the understanding of an object,

original: de kyang med kyang de rtogs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas de ltar 'khrul nas kyang don rig pa'i rang bzhin srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de kyang med kyang de rtogs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa ni ji skad bshad pa'i rigs pas de ltar 'khrul nas kyang don rig pa'i rang bzhin srid pa ma yin no //
translated: and even though that does not exist, they are said to be erroneous because they understand it. But conceptual cognition is not possible as the nature of the understanding of an object, even if it is erroneous, as explained by the above reasoning.

original: des na 'di gzugs brnyan ji lta bur gyur pa de rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di gzugs brnyan ji lta bur gyur pa de rig pa'i bdag nyid kyis ni 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is not erroneous by the nature of the understanding of an object, just as a reflection is not.

original: blo'i zla ba rig pas zla ba gnyis su shes pa 'khrul pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: blo'i zla ba rig pas zla ba gnyis su shes pa 'khrul pa ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of two moons by the cognition of the moon, which is not erroneous.

original: 'on kyang der nges pa phyin ci log pa las yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang der nges pa phyin ci log pa las yin no zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: But it should be said that the ascertainment is due to a mistake.

original: gal te 'di cung zad kyang nges par byed pa ma yin na ni 'khrul pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te 'di cung zad kyang nges par byed pa ma yin na ni 'khrul pa nyid du mi 'gyur te /
translated: If it does not ascertain anything at all, it is not a mistake,

original: gzhan yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has a different object.

original: ji ltar 'di'i gzugs brnyan don de lta bu dang mi mthun par rtogs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di'i gzugs brnyan don de lta bu dang mi mthun par rtogs she na /
translated: How is it that the reflection is understood as having a form that does not correspond to that object?

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa zhes smos so //
translated: It is said that it is not related to its own nature.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig bstan par bsams nas 'di nyam pa po la bzhag pa de'i ngo bo dang 'di 'brel pa de'i rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhig bstan par bsams nas 'di nyam pa po la bzhag pa de'i ngo bo dang 'di 'brel pa de'i rgyu can gyi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: What kind of thing is it that is thought to be indicated by this? It has no characteristic that is related to the nature of that which is its cause.

original: gal te 'di don gyis skyes pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di don gyis skyes pa yin na /
translated: If it were produced by the object,

original: mi 'dra bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: mi 'dra bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: it would not be different.

original: rang gi nye bar len pa'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis mi 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: rang gi nye bar len pa'i rtsa ba can nyid kyis mi 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: But it is different, because it has its own appropriation as its basis.

original: ji skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos don kyang yin la ma mthong ba yang yin pas don ma mthong ba ste /
analyzed: ji skad du slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos don kyang yin la ma mthong ba yang yin pas don ma mthong ba ste /
translated: Since it is an object and it is not seen, it is an unseen object.

original: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po la brjod do //
analyzed: lkog tu gyur pa'i dngos po la brjod do //
translated: It is said that a hidden entity is one that is not seen.

original: de la ni don gyi rnam par rtog pa tsam yin gyi gzhan ni 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: de la ni don gyi rnam par rtog pa tsam yin gyi gzhan ni 'ga' yang ma yin no zhes bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: In that regard, it is merely a conceptual representation of an object, and nothing else at all.

original: rnam par rtog pa la ni rnam pa gnyis srid de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la ni rnam pa gnyis srid de /
translated: A conceptual representation can be of two kinds:

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / de'i ngo bo las don gyi yul can no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / de'i ngo bo las don gyi yul can no //
translated: a conceptual representation and one whose object is an entity that is the nature of that conceptual representation.

original: de la 'dir don de'i yul nyid bkag pas rnam par rtog pa tsam zhig lus pa yin no //üîΩde lta na ngo bo nyid brjod na thams cad las log pa brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la 'dir don de'i yul nyid bkag pas rnam par rtog pa tsam zhig lus pa yin no // de lta na ngo bo nyid brjod na thams cad las log pa brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: Here, since the object of that conceptual representation is refuted, only the conceptual representation remains.üîΩIf you say that the nature of that conceptual representation is expressed, then you are saying that it is the opposite of everything.

original: de yang sred pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de bsal ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de yang sred pa ma yin no zhes brjod pa gang yin pa de bsal ba yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: And that is not tenable, as was explained above.

original: de lta na zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de lta na zhes bya'o //
translated: This is what is being said:

original: de ltar de rnam pa 'dis rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa dag gis rang gi @217b mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang bstan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de rnam pa 'dis rtogs par bya ba dang rtogs par byed pa dag gis rang gi @217b mtshan nyid rtogs pa dang bstan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the realization and the teaching are not of the self-characteristic, by way of the realized and the realizer.

original: gal te rtogs pa'am bstan pa yin na de thams cad la log pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad las log pa brjod par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gal te rtogs pa'am bstan pa yin na de thams cad la log pa yin pa'i phyir thams cad las log pa brjod par 'gyur la /
translated: If it were realization or teaching, it would be the expression of the opposite of all, because it is the opposite of all.

original: de yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: And that is contradictory.

original: de yul du ma byas na ni nyes pa 'di ga la yod de yul du mi byed pa yang de las gzhan kho na yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yul du ma byas na ni nyes pa 'di ga la yod de yul du mi byed pa yang de las gzhan kho na yul du byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not take that as its object, how can there be this fault?
