Because it does not take that as its object, it takes only something else as its object.üîΩIf it takes that as its object, it follows that it is not not apprehended by the sense faculties.üîΩThat which was explained,

original: du yul du byed na dbang pos mi sod pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de /
analyzed: du yul du byed na dbang pos mi sod pa ma yin pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it takes that as its object, it follows that it is not not apprehended by the sense faculties,‚Äù

original: khyad par can gyi yul de nyid kyis gsal bar ston par byed pa ni mtho ris la sogs pa thos pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi yul de nyid kyis gsal bar ston par byed pa ni mtho ris la sogs pa thos pa la yang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: is clarified by that very special object, ‚ÄúEven when one hears about heaven, etc.‚Äù

original: gal te mtho ris kyi sgras mtho ris brjod na mtho ris nyams su myong ba dang 'dra bar rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te mtho ris kyi sgras mtho ris brjod na mtho ris nyams su myong ba dang 'dra bar rtogs par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the word heaven refers to the experience of heaven, then it would follow, absurdly, that heaven would be cognized as similar to the experience of heaven.

original: don gyi yul can du grub na rgyu tha dad pa ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩ'bras chan gyis 'grangs pa'am /
analyzed: don gyi yul can du grub na rgyu tha dad pa ni yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro // 'bras chan gyis 'grangs pa'am /
translated: If it were established as having a referent object, then the difference in cause would not be a part of it.

original: zan dron gyis 'grangs kyang bla sta /
analyzed: zan dron gyis 'grangs kyang bla sta /
translated: It would be the same as saying that one is satisfied by rice or that one is satisfied by barley.

original: khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There would be no difference.

original: de lta na ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa des na gzhan sel ba'i sgo nas kyang mi brjod par thal par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra dang rnam par rtog pa rnams de'i yul can ma yin pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin pa des na gzhan sel ba'i sgo nas kyang mi brjod par thal par 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, since words and conceptual thoughts are not the objects of those, then it would follow, absurdly, that the specifically characterized could not be expressed and that it could not be expressed even by means of the exclusion of other.

original: des na nam mkha' zhes sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu ni ngo bo nyid brjod do zhes ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: des na nam mkha' zhes sgra 'jug pa'i rgyu ni ngo bo nyid brjod do zhes ji ltar brjod /
translated: So how can you say that the cause of the word space is the expression of its own nature?

original: de bzhin du gzhan sel ba'i yul can du yang brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan sel ba'i yul can du yang brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: In the same way, it should not be said that it has as its object the exclusion of other.

original: rnam pa thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid la reg pa med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du rang gi mtshan nyid la reg pa med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it does not touch the intrinsic identity of any object in any way,

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa bzhin no //
translated: like the cognition of a double moon and so on.

original: 'on te ji skad bshad pa'i don dam pa'i gzhan sel ba brjod pas gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin na /
analyzed: 'on te ji skad bshad pa'i don dam pa'i gzhan sel ba brjod pas gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin na /
translated: But if it is a subject that excludes other objects by expressing the ultimate exclusion of other as explained,

original: de ltar na da rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa rtag par sgro 'dogs pa sel ba'i 'bras bu can yin yang mi rtag pa nyid rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir don med par thal lo //
analyzed: de ltar na da rjes su dpag pa'i rnam par rtog pa rtag par sgro 'dogs pa sel ba'i 'bras bu can yin yang mi rtag pa nyid rtogs par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir don med par thal lo //
translated: then it follows that it is pointless, because even though the conceptual cognition that infers it has the effect of excluding the superimposition of permanence, it does not cause the understanding of impermanence.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa gzhan sel ba'i rig pa de ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la rig pa med par 'gyur ba brjod dgos so zhes dgos pa la /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa gzhan sel ba'i rig pa de ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid la rig pa med par 'gyur ba brjod dgos so zhes dgos pa la /
translated: Therefore, it must be explained how that cognition that excludes other conceptual cognitions can be without cognition of intrinsic identity.

original: rang gi 'dod pas sgra rnams ji ltar don brjod par 'dod pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rang gi 'dod pas sgra rnams ji ltar don brjod par 'dod pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show how the terms are asserted to express the object as desired,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúTherefore,‚Äù

original: de'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: and so on.

original: rtogs par byed pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma @218a * //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma @218a * //
translated: The cognition that causes the understanding of the object‚Äôs intrinsic nature

original: rtogs su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa de lta bu kho na la ste /
analyzed: rtogs su zin kyang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo dang ma 'brel pa de lta bu kho na la ste /
translated: Even if one does understand, the form of a conceptual image is not related to the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs pa la yang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ji lta ba bzhin ma rtogs pa la yang rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Even when one does not understand the nature of an entity as it is, a form of a conceptual image arises.

original: de la der ltag par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: de la der ltag par zhen pa ste /
translated: One is attached to it as if it were that.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor lhag par zhen pas rtogs par bya ba'am rtog par byed pa 'di mgu bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor lhag par zhen pas rtogs par bya ba'am rtog par byed pa 'di mgu bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One is attached to it as if it were the nature of an entity.

original: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
analyzed: dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor lhag par zhen pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yin zhe na /
translated: What is this that is called ‚Äúnot understanding the nature of an entity as it is and being attached to the nature of an entity‚Äù?

original: smras pa dngos po'i ngo bo rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: smras pa dngos po'i ngo bo rtogs pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: We reply: It is not the understanding of the nature of an entity.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul nas don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul nas don rtogs pa'i bdag nyid ma yin no zhes sngar bsgrubs zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: We have already proven that a conceptual image is not the nature of an entity that is understood through error.

original: des na 'di ni med pa yul du smra ba la mngon par zhen pa ngan pa rtsa ba med pa can bsal ba mkhas pa rnams kyi rang snang ba'i phyogs yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni med pa yul du smra ba la mngon par zhen pa ngan pa rtsa ba med pa can bsal ba mkhas pa rnams kyi rang snang ba'i phyogs yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the position of the wise, who are self-luminous, in order to eliminate the bad, rootless clinging of those who propound the existence of a nonexistent object.

original: gang gi phyir blo gros ngan pa can rnams kyi phyi rol gyi don snang ba med na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo gros ngan pa can rnams kyi phyi rol gyi don snang ba med na /
translated: If the external object does not appear to those of bad intellect,

original: phyi rol don du mngon par zhen pa nyams su myong bas grub pa gang zhig yin par 'dod gal te phyi rol gyi don rig pa yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol don du mngon par zhen pa nyams su myong bas grub pa gang zhig yin par 'dod gal te phyi rol gyi don rig pa yin no //
translated: what is it that is experienced that is accepted as the establishment of the clinging to external objects? If it is the cognition of the external object,

original: de lta na 'dir med pa yul du smra ba 'di 'thad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na 'dir med pa yul du smra ba 'di 'thad par 'gyur ro //
translated: then this propounding of the existence of a nonexistent object would be tenable.

original: gang gi phyir rig par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid yul yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rig par bya ba gang yin pa de nyid yul yin te /
translated: Because that which is cognized is the object.

original: des na don rig pa ni don gyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na don rig pa ni don gyi yul can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the object would be the object of the object.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa gzugs brnyan de lta bu kho na la der lhag par zhen pas zhes bya ba 'di mi 'thad par ' gyur ro //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa gzugs brnyan de lta bu kho na la der lhag par zhen pas zhes bya ba 'di mi 'thad par ' gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable to say, ‚ÄúIt is just that kind of conceptual image that is conceived to be that.‚Äù

original: 'dis bdag nyid rig pa ni ma yin na /
analyzed: 'dis bdag nyid rig pa ni ma yin na /
translated: If it is not self-cognition,

original: de ji ltar dngos po med pa bdag nyid la rig par 'gyur /
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos po med pa bdag nyid la rig par 'gyur /
translated: How could it be aware of itself as a non-thing?

original: dngos po med pa'i rig pas rig par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar yang dngos po nying ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i rig pas rig par 'gyur ba gang yin pa dngos po med pa gang yin pa de ni ji ltar yang dngos po nying ma yin no //
translated: That which is aware of a non-thing is a non-thing, and it is not a thing.

original: de bas na dngos po'i yul can nyid dngos po rig pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa la dngos po nyid du rig par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na dngos po'i yul can nyid dngos po rig pa yin pa'i phyir dngos po ma yin pa la dngos po nyid du rig par mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, since awareness is the awareness of a thing because it has a thing as its object, it is not tenable that it is aware of a non-thing as a thing.

original: dngos po ma yin pa dang dngos po'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po ma yin pa dang dngos po'i khyad par dang khyad par can gyi ngo bo yang ma yin no //
translated: It is not the distinction between a non-thing and a thing, nor is it the nature of a thing that has a distinction.

original: 'o na nya phyis la sogs pa la dngul du shes pa ji ltar zhe na der yang nya phyis nyid la dngul du rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'o na nya phyis la sogs pa la dngul du shes pa ji ltar zhe na der yang nya phyis nyid la dngul du rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But how is it that mother-of-pearl and so on are known to be silver? Even in that case, mother-of-pearl is not known to be silver.

original: gzhan la gzhan du rig pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan la gzhan du rig pa mi srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is impossible to know one thing as another.

original: de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir @218b ro ;
analyzed: de ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir @218b ro ;
translated: Because it is not the nature of that.

original: / rig par gyur pa'i chos las lhag pa med pa rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: / rig par gyur pa'i chos las lhag pa med pa rig pa yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Since there is no phenomenon that is more excellent than awareness, it is awareness.

original: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa ni don ji lta ba ma yin no //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin ma yin pa ni don ji lta ba ma yin no //
translated: Not in accordance with fact means not in accordance with the way things really are.

original: de nyid kyi phyir /üîΩnges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang //üîΩde ni ji ltar de dag yul //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir / nges pa rnams kyis ma nges gang // de ni ji ltar de dag yul //
translated: For this very reason,

original: zhes bshad do //
analyzed: zhes bshad do //
translated: it is said:üîΩHow can the uncertainüîΩbe the object of the certain?üîΩIt is said that the uncertain is not the object of the certain.

original: nya phyis la sogs pa la ni sgro btags nas de ltar bsnyad pa yin te /
analyzed: nya phyis la sogs pa la ni sgro btags nas de ltar bsnyad pa yin te /
translated: But in the case of mother of pearl, etc., it is said to be so by metaphor,

original: mngon sum gyis nya phyis kyi ngo bo myong nas de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum gyis nya phyis kyi ngo bo myong nas de ltar rnam par rtog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one experiences the nature of mother of pearl by direct perception and then imagines it to be so.

original: de lta mod kyi yul bsam pa na ni dngul du rtogs pa'i yul dngul kho na yin gyi nya phyis la ni rig pa med do //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi yul bsam pa na ni dngul du rtogs pa'i yul dngul kho na yin gyi nya phyis la ni rig pa med do //
translated: But when the object is considered, the object of the cognition that understands silver is silver itself, not mother of pearl, because there is no awareness of mother of pearl.

original: gang gis 'di don nyid du rig par 'gyur ba 'di ni bdag nyid la sred pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis 'di don nyid du rig par 'gyur ba 'di ni bdag nyid la sred pa ma yin no //
translated: And this is not craving for itself, because it is known to be the object.

original: sred na yang rang rig pa'i yul la don nyid du nges par 'di'i yul gang yin zhes yul bsam pa nas /
analyzed: sred na yang rang rig pa'i yul la don nyid du nges par 'di'i yul gang yin zhes yul bsam pa nas /
translated: Even if there were craving, it would be ascertained as the object of self-awareness, so when the object is considered,

original: don nyid yin par brjod kyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don nyid yin par brjod kyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: it is said to be the object, not consciousness,

original: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no such cognition.

original: don rig pa nyid shes pa rig par 'gyur ba gang yin pa shes pa nyid ni don ma yin no //
analyzed: don rig pa nyid shes pa rig par 'gyur ba gang yin pa shes pa nyid ni don ma yin no //
translated: The object itself is the awareness of the object, but the awareness is not the object.

original: des na don nyid yul yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin la /
analyzed: des na don nyid yul yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin la /
translated: Therefore, the object itself is the object, not the awareness.

original: de yang mi 'dod pa gang yin pa ni rig pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de yang mi 'dod pa gang yin pa ni rig pa kho na'o //
translated: And that is not accepted.

original: de'i phyir shes pa ma yin te rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa ma yin te rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, it is not awareness because it is not consciousness.

original: don ma yin te rnam pa de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don ma yin te rnam pa de lta bu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not the object because it does not have that aspect.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni med pa sgro btags pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de ni rang gi phyogs mtshar po'i snga phyi brtags pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i yul ni med pa sgro btags pa kho na yin no zhes zer ba de ni rang gi phyogs mtshar po'i snga phyi brtags pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the object of conceptual consciousness is only a superimposition of the nonexistent.

original: de ltar na 'di don du nges pa nyid la brten nas bdag snang ba spang ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di don du nges pa nyid la brten nas bdag snang ba spang ba yin no //
translated: Thus, in this way, the appearance of the self is eliminated based on the ascertainment of the object.

original: de la gal te don du lhag par nges pa 'di don rig pa yin na /
analyzed: de la gal te don du lhag par nges pa 'di don rig pa yin na /
translated: In that regard, if this ascertainment of the object as the object is the awareness of the object,

original: des na de nyid don rig par rtogs pas /
analyzed: des na de nyid don rig par rtogs pas /
translated: then it is understood that it is the awareness of the object.

original: 'di la yod dam med kyang don snang ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di la yod dam med kyang don snang ba yin te /
translated: Therefore, whether it exists or not, it is the appearance of the object.

original: dper na sngon por myong bzhin ba de nyid sngon por snang ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sngon por myong bzhin ba de nyid sngon por snang ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one experiences blue, it is just as it appears as blue.

original: sngon po myong ba gzhan la snang bzhin pa de lta bu nyid kyi rnam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir don de yang bdag cag gis mngon sum rtogs pa'i phyir gang la de lta bur gyur pa nyid du gsal ba de nyid don rig pa yin no //
analyzed: sngon po myong ba gzhan la snang bzhin pa de lta bu nyid kyi rnam pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir don de yang bdag cag gis mngon sum rtogs pa'i phyir gang la de lta bur gyur pa nyid du gsal ba de nyid don rig pa yin no //
translated: Because it is understood that the aspect of the experience of blue is just as it appears to another, that object is also understood by us. Therefore, the one who has that kind of clarity is the one who knows the object.

original: gal te de ltar gyur pa de med na ni med pa nyid rig par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur pa de med na ni med pa nyid rig par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If it were not so, it would be known as nonexistent.

original: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i sngon po bzhin no //
analyzed: rmi lam du dmigs pa'i sngon po bzhin no //
translated: It would be like the blue that is perceived in a dream.

original: de lta ma yin na yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yod pa kho na'o //
translated: If it were not so, it would be existent.

original: rmi lam du yul med kyang @219a * //
analyzed: rmi lam du yul med kyang @219a * //
translated: In a dream, although there is no object,

original: sngon po ma yin pa rig pa nyid sngon por rig par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po ma yin pa rig pa nyid sngon por rig par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not that the cognition of what is not blue becomes the cognition of blue.

original: des na 'di gal te don rig pa nyid yin na ni don yod dam med kyang bla ste /
analyzed: des na 'di gal te don rig pa nyid yin na ni don yod dam med kyang bla ste /
translated: Therefore, if this is the cognition of the object, it makes no difference whether the object exists or not.

original: sngon po dang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa ltar de don snang ba ji ltar 'gyur ba de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na rnam par rtog pa'i gnas sgrubs na ni dbang po'i shes pa bzhin don snang ba med pa'i phyir don du lhag
analyzed: sngon po dang zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i shes pa ltar de don snang ba ji ltar 'gyur ba de lta bu nyid du 'gyur ba zhig na rnam par rtog pa'i gnas sgrubs na ni dbang po'i shes pa bzhin don snang ba med pa'i phyir don du lhag
translated: But if you claim that it is a basis of conception, then it is not the case that the object appears to it, as it does to a sense consciousness.

original: par zhen pa nyams su myong bas grub pa de gang yin /
analyzed: par zhen pa nyams su myong bas grub pa de gang yin /
translated: So what is it that experiences the object?

original: gal te 'dir don rig pa yod na /
analyzed: gal te 'dir don rig pa yod na /
translated: If you claim that the object is cognized in this case,

original: dngos po de lta bu yod pa na /
analyzed: dngos po de lta bu yod pa na /
translated: then when the object exists in that way,

original: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa rtog pa'i yul gyi don mngon sum pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i rnam pa rtog pa'i yul gyi don mngon sum pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: the aspect of inference would be a direct percept of the object that is the object of conception.

original: sgro btags pa'i don med pa nyid yul yin pa de'i ltar na ni 'di don las bye brag med pa na /
analyzed: sgro btags pa'i don med pa nyid yul yin pa de'i ltar na ni 'di don las bye brag med pa na /
translated: If the object of superimposition, which is nonexistent, were the object, then since it would not be different from the object,

original: de don kho nar 'gyur gyi sgro btags ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de don kho nar 'gyur gyi sgro btags ni ma yin no //
translated: it would be the object itself, not a superimposition.

original: bye brag yod na yang 'di sgro btags pa yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhes mna' chu btung pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bye brag yod na yang 'di sgro btags pa yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no zhes mna' chu btung pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: If you claim that there is a difference, then you would have to swear that it is a superimposition, not a consciousness.

original: don dang shes pa nyid ni 'gal bas gal te der don nyid dor na shes pa nyid du yang rigs la ma yin na ni sgro btags pa nyid du yang ngo //
analyzed: don dang shes pa nyid ni 'gal bas gal te der don nyid dor na shes pa nyid du yang rigs la ma yin na ni sgro btags pa nyid du yang ngo //
translated: Since the object and consciousness are contradictory, if the object is abandoned in that case, it is reasonable that it is consciousness. If it is not, it is also a superimposition.

original: des na 'di don rig pa la brten nas bdag snang ba las kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: des na 'di don rig pa la brten nas bdag snang ba las kyang 'byung ste /
translated: Therefore, this arises from the appearance of self in dependence on the awareness of the object.

original: rtogs pa de'i yul don dang mi 'dra ba smra ba na de nyid du rjes su song ba yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa de'i yul don dang mi 'dra ba smra ba na de nyid du rjes su song ba yin no //
translated: When the object of that realization is said to be unlike the object, it is the same as that.

original: gal te sgro btags pa la don rig pa mi 'dor ba des na 'di don med pa rig pa brjod de /
analyzed: gal te sgro btags pa la don rig pa mi 'dor ba des na 'di don med pa rig pa brjod de /
translated: If the awareness of the object is not abandoned in the superimposition, then this is said to be the awareness of the nonexistent.

original: shes pa la ni don nyid 'gal lo zhe na /
analyzed: shes pa la ni don nyid 'gal lo zhe na /
translated: The object itself is contradictory in consciousness.

original: 'di ni ma brtags par smras pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma brtags par smras pa yin te /
translated: This is a statement without analysis.

original: 'di ltar don rig pa gang yin pa de nyid gal te sgro btags pa rig pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar don rig pa gang yin pa de nyid gal te sgro btags pa rig pa yin na /
translated: Thus, if the awareness of the object itself is the awareness of the superimposition,

original: gsal ba kho nar mi 'du bas na don rig pa gzhan lus pa med pa'i phyir 'di shes pa nyid du mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gsal ba kho nar mi 'du bas na don rig pa gzhan lus pa med pa'i phyir 'di shes pa nyid du mi 'gal lo //
translated: since it is not clearly present, the awareness of the object is not different. Since there is no other remaining, it is not contradictory that it is consciousness.

original: gang las don rig par 'gyur ba de la don dang mi 'dra ba med ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang las don rig par 'gyur ba de la don dang mi 'dra ba med ba ni cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But in the case of the object of a word, there is no difference at all between the object and the word.

original: brtags pa mtha' dag ni /
analyzed: brtags pa mtha' dag ni /
translated: All the various kinds of conceptualization

original: don dang 'gal ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis sel ba yin no //
analyzed: don dang 'gal ba tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag gis sel ba yin no //
translated: are eliminations by means of difference and non-difference from the object.

original: mi 'dra ba med pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba med pa yod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is only non-difference,

original: 'o na don dang sgro btags pa gnyis kyis rig pa gcig gam mi gcig kyang bla ste /üîΩde'i don to zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni don nyid yin @219b bar 'gyur bas don gyi yul can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na don dang sgro btags pa gnyis kyis rig pa gcig gam mi gcig kyang bla ste / de'i don to zhes rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni don nyid yin @219b bar 'gyur bas don gyi yul can du thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then it makes no difference whether the cognition of the object and the superimposition are the same or not.üîΩBut if you say that the object itself is what is understood as ‚Äúthe meaning of that,‚Äù then it follows that the object itself is the object of cognition.

original: sgro btags pa la don nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na re zhig sgro btags kyi bdag nyid ni shes pa dang mi 'gal bas shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs pa yin mod /
analyzed: sgro btags pa la don nyid du rtogs pa yin no zhe na re zhig sgro btags kyi bdag nyid ni shes pa dang mi 'gal bas shes pa nyid de ltar rtogs pa yin mod /
translated: If you say that the superimposition is understood as the object, then the cognition itself, which is not incompatible with the superimposed identity, is certainly the understanding.

original: 'dzin pa tha dad pa yang sgrub byed ma yin te med pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: 'dzin pa tha dad pa yang sgrub byed ma yin te med pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: But the difference in the grasping is not a proof, because it does not exist.

original: / rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang yod pas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / rnam par rtog pa med pa la yang yod pas ma nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not certain that it exists in the absence of conceptualization.

original: don gyi ngo bo rig na sgro btags pa gzhan srid pa ni tshad ma can ma yin no //
analyzed: don gyi ngo bo rig na sgro btags pa gzhan srid pa ni tshad ma can ma yin no //
translated: If the nature of the object is known, it is not valid to superimpose another.

original: don de nyid 'das pa'i ngo bo sngon gyi mthong ba'i yul nyid du lhag par nges pa'i phyir med pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: don de nyid 'das pa'i ngo bo sngon gyi mthong ba'i yul nyid du lhag par nges pa'i phyir med pa yin no zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If it is argued that the object itself is nonexistent because it is ascertained as the object of past seeing, that is not so.

original: don ji ltar mthong ba med pas med pa'i yul can yin ba'i shes pa'i dus su med pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don ji ltar mthong ba med pas med pa'i yul can yin ba'i shes pa'i dus su med pas ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not that the object is nonexistent at the time of the cognition that has a nonexistent object, because the object is not seen as it is.

original: thams cad mkhyen pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gzigs kyang med pa'i yul can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad mkhyen pa'i don ji lta ba bzhin gzigs kyang med pa'i yul can du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the object of omniscience is seen as it is, it follows that it has a nonexistent object.

original: gzhan yang 'das pa'i dus rtogs pa gal te 'das pa'i dus kyi yul nyid la de'i dus nyid du 'dzin pa na don med pa nyid du 'gyur na /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'das pa'i dus rtogs pa gal te 'das pa'i dus kyi yul nyid la de'i dus nyid du 'dzin pa na don med pa nyid du 'gyur na /
translated: Moreover, if the realization of the past is the object of the past itself, it would be pointless.

original: de lta na yang mi 'dod pa dngos po'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na yang mi 'dod pa dngos po'i yul can nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even so, it would be unacceptable that it has an existent object.

original: yul ma yin pa ni 'das pa'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid kyi phyir med par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni 'das pa'i don rtogs pa med pa'i phyir 'das pa nyid kyi phyir med par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: But if the object is not the object of that consciousness, how can it be nonexistent?

original: de bas na gang zhig don gyi yul can nyid kyis bdag nyid yul ma yin par 'gyur ba de la don ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig don gyi yul can nyid kyis bdag nyid yul ma yin par 'gyur ba de la don ni 'ga' yang rtogs pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if something is not an object because it is the object of consciousness, then it is not the case that it does not realize any object.

original: gzhan yang don snang bzhin pa na yang de ltar snang ba de yul gyi gzugs brnyan rtogs par yang cis mi 'thad na gang gis rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa nyid du mi 'dod /
analyzed: gzhan yang don snang bzhin pa na yang de ltar snang ba de yul gyi gzugs brnyan rtogs par yang cis mi 'thad na gang gis rnam par shes pa'i rnam pa nyid du mi 'dod /
translated: Moreover, when an object appears, why is it not tenable that the appearance is the realization of a reflection of the object? Why is it not accepted as the aspect of consciousness?

original: don ji lta bu de lta bur gyur pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin srid pa ni bden mod kyi /
analyzed: don ji lta bu de lta bur gyur pa rtogs pa'i rang bzhin srid pa ni bden mod kyi /
translated: It is certainly possible that consciousness realizes an object that is just like the object.

original: de lta na yang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan de ni shes pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang shes pa'i gzugs brnyan de ni shes pa kho na yin te /
translated: However, the reflection of the object is consciousness itself.

original: de las don nyid rtogs pa yang 'gal ba yin no //
analyzed: de las don nyid rtogs pa yang 'gal ba yin no //
translated: It is contradictory that consciousness realizes the object.

original: des na chos mi mthun pa'i rnam pa mtha' dag brtags kyang don gyi rang bzhin yong par 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: des na chos mi mthun pa'i rnam pa mtha' dag brtags kyang don gyi rang bzhin yong par 'dod pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, although all the aspects of the dissimilar are investigated, the nature of the object is not accepted as existent.

original: sdang bas ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: sdang bas ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But not by hatred?

original: des na sgro btags pa nyid du khas len to zhe na /
analyzed: des na sgro btags pa nyid du khas len to zhe na /
translated: If you accept that it is a superimposition,

original: yun ring por brtags shing brtags pa'i cha so sor rnam par phye yang dngos po gsal ba'i zhad tsam yang mi 'bag pa ni don rtogs par smra ba'i rjod byed kyis ma @220a * //
analyzed: yun ring por brtags shing brtags pa'i cha so sor rnam par phye yang dngos po gsal ba'i zhad tsam yang mi 'bag pa ni don rtogs par smra ba'i rjod byed kyis ma @220a * //
translated: then even though you have analyzed and investigated for a long time, you still do not understand the meaning of the statement that the object is understood.

original: btang pas 'di la ci byar yod /
analyzed: btang pas 'di la ci byar yod /
translated: What can be done about this?

original: gang gi tshe don la gsal ba yang shes pa nyid du 'thad pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe don la gsal ba yang shes pa nyid du 'thad pa de'i tshe /
translated: When it is tenable that the object is consciousness itself,üîΩthen why do you accept that a reflection is a superimposition?

original: gang gis gzugs brnyan sgro btags pa nyid du khas len par byed pa 'di rgyu mtshan ci zing khas blangs nas gzugs brnyan nyid sel bar byed /
analyzed: gang gis gzugs brnyan sgro btags pa nyid du khas len par byed pa 'di rgyu mtshan ci zing khas blangs nas gzugs brnyan nyid sel bar byed /
translated: What reason do you have for denying the reflection itself?

original: don rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam ma yin te /
analyzed: don rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni tshig tsam ma yin te /
translated: The statement that the object is understood is not mere words.

original: 'on kyang gsal ba kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba kho na'o //
translated: It is only the clear object.

original: de yang 'ga' zhig gsal bar ma gyur par mi 'thad pas na gang zhig 'di la gsal ba de don gyi rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin na de'i tshe 'di don kho na yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig gsal bar ma gyur par mi 'thad pas na gang zhig 'di la gsal ba de don gyi rang bzhin thun mong ma yin pa nyid yin na de'i tshe 'di don kho na yin gyi shes pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, since it is not tenable that some are not clear, if that which is clear here is the uncommon nature of the object, then at that time it is only the object and not consciousness.

original: gang gi tshe de ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin de shes pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos su 'thad pa de'i tshe ni rnam par shes pa las tha dad par don nyid du nges par byed pa gang yin pa rang bzhin tha dad par rnam par 'byed pa gang zhig
analyzed: gang gi tshe de ltar gsal ba'i rang bzhin de shes pa'i gzugs brnyan gyi chos su 'thad pa de'i tshe ni rnam par shes pa las tha dad par don nyid du nges par byed pa gang yin pa rang bzhin tha dad par rnam par 'byed pa gang zhig
translated: When it is tenable that the nature of clarity is the quality of a reflection of consciousness, then at that time, what is the nature that distinguishes it as different from consciousness and ascertains it as an object that is different?

original: yin / don bya ba byed pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: yin / don bya ba byed pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: If you say it is the performance of an object‚Äôs function,

original: de ni don bya ba dang 'brel pa las nges par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni don bya ba dang 'brel pa las nges par bya ba yin no //
translated: then it is ascertained from the connection with the performance of an object‚Äôs function.

original: des na gang gi tshe 'di rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bor me long la shing dang 'bar ba dag bzhin du rnam par gnas par bzod pa de'i tshe /
analyzed: des na gang gi tshe 'di rgyu dang 'bras bu gnyis kyi gzugs brnyan gyi ngo bor me long la shing dang 'bar ba dag bzhin du rnam par gnas par bzod pa de'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when it is tenable that the two, cause and effect, are the nature of a reflection, like a tree and a flame in a mirror,

original: 'di dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: 'di dag ni rgyu dang 'bras bu nyid yin gyi /
translated: These are causes and effects,üîΩbut they are not like causes and effects.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no zhes ga las rtogs pa la /üîΩdes na rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rang bzhin gsal bzhin pa las tha dad pa 'am /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i gzugs brnyan ni ma yin no zhes ga las rtogs pa la / des na rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rang bzhin gsal bzhin pa las tha dad pa 'am /
translated: How do we know?üîΩTherefore, it is not possible to ascertain an object as different from the nature of the manifestation of the thought,

original: gzhan shes pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad par don du nges par ni mi nus so //üîΩgsal ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pas de ltar nges ba de shes pa'o snyam pa dang bral bas don to snyam pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na don to zhes shes pa dang thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa de rtogs bzhin du yang thun mong ma
analyzed: gzhan shes pa'i rang bzhin las tha dad par don du nges par ni mi nus so // gsal ba'i rang bzhin las tha dad pas de ltar nges ba de shes pa'o snyam pa dang bral bas don to snyam pa 'jug pa'i phyir ro zhe na don to zhes shes pa dang thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa de rtogs bzhin du yang thun mong ma
translated: or as different from the nature of the consciousness that is different from it.üîΩIf you say that it is ascertained as different from the nature of the manifestation, then the thought ‚ÄúI know‚Äù is absent, and the thought ‚ÄúI see an object‚Äù occurs.

original: yin par ji ltar mi ston /
analyzed: yin par ji ltar mi ston /
translated: Even though the thought ‚ÄúI know‚Äù is absent, why does it not occur that ‚ÄúI know‚Äù is not common to the object?

original: der ni gzugs brnyan nyid la yang srid pa ma yin par de bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: der ni gzugs brnyan nyid la yang srid pa ma yin par de bzhin du rtogs pa gang yin pa de ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, it is not possible that ‚ÄúI know‚Äù is not common to the object, just as it is not possible that a reflection is not an object.

original: gal te thun mong ma yin yang thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa kho nar gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te thun mong ma yin yang thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa kho nar gyur pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: If it is not common, is not the realization of the uncommon just the uncommon?

original: bden te thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rnag bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bden te thun mong ma yin par rtogs pa ni thun mong ma yin pa'i rnag bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: It is true, but the realization of the uncommon is not the realization of the uncommon as it is.

original: de la rnam par shes pa dngos por @220b mi srid ba'i de ltar rtogs pa gang zhig ces de nyid 'dir brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par shes pa dngos por @220b mi srid ba'i de ltar rtogs pa gang zhig ces de nyid 'dir brgal zhing brtag par bya ba yin no //
translated: Here, the question is: what is the realization of consciousness as a thing?

original: des na de ltar rig ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na ni /
analyzed: des na de ltar rig ba'i rang bzhin rtogs pa med pa'i phyir na ni /
translated: Therefore, because of the non-existence of the realization of the nature of consciousness in this way,

original: rig pa med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: rig pa med pa kho na'o //
translated: there is no consciousness at all.

original: don rtogs pa nyams su myong bas grub pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: don rtogs pa nyams su myong bas grub pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is the experience of the realization of the object not established?

original: bden  te rtogs par bya ba thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba med pa'i phyir dang rig par bya ba khyad par med par rig pa'i khyad par mi 'grub pa'i phyir 'di ni de rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa lhag par zhen pa
analyzed: bden  te rtogs par bya ba thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin gsal ba med pa'i phyir dang rig par bya ba khyad par med par rig pa'i khyad par mi 'grub pa'i phyir 'di ni de rig pa'i bdag nyid ma yin pa lhag par zhen pa
translated: True, but because the nature of the object to be realized is not clear, and because the difference of the cognizer is not established without the difference of the cognized, this is merely the adherence to the non-existence of the nature of the cognizer.

original: 'ba' zhig go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig go zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus it is said.

original: de nyid kyi med pa'i yul can nyid bkag pa yin no zhes zhar la brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid kyi med pa'i yul can nyid bkag pa yin no zhes zhar la brjod do //
translated: And this is a refutation of the fact that the object is non-existent.

original: 'o na ji ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin ma rtogs par dngos por lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar dngos po'i rang bzhin ma rtogs par dngos por lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin zhes bya bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can it be the nature of the adherence to the thing when the nature of the thing is not realized?

original: 'di skad brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod do //
translated: This is what is said.

original: 'di la dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dngos po'i ngo bor lhag par zhen pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor mngon par zhen pa mngon par rlom pa shes pa'i chos so //
analyzed: 'di la dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo ma rtogs pa rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan la dngos po'i ngo bor lhag par zhen pa dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor mngon par zhen pa mngon par rlom pa shes pa'i chos so //
translated: The nature of the adherence to the thing is the superimposition of the nature of the thing on the conceptual image, which is the non-realization of the nature of the thing, the superimposition of the nature of the thing, the conceit of knowledge of the thing.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar lhag par zhen pa de lta bur gyur pa'i yul yang gsal na ni ' dod chags la sogs pa bzhin shes pa'i rang bzhin des khyad par du byas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar lhag par zhen pa de lta bur gyur pa'i yul yang gsal na ni ' dod chags la sogs pa bzhin shes pa'i rang bzhin des khyad par du byas pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: If the object is clear in just the way it is conceived, then it would be qualified by the nature of consciousness, just like desire and so on.

original: dper na bye brag pas khas blangs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na bye brag pas khas blangs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is just like the Vai≈õe·π£ika‚Äôs assertion.

original: de bzhin du ji ltar 'di'i yul gsal ba de kho na bzhin mngon par rlob par 'gyur ro //üîΩgang gi tshe mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang / shes pa mi 'dra ba'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa'i phyir yul gsal ba'i cha bzlog par byas pa de'i tshe mngon par rlom pa tsam kho na lus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ji ltar 'di'i yul gsal ba de kho na bzhin mngon par rlob par 'gyur ro // gang gi tshe mngon sum gyis mthong ba'i rang bzhin dang mi 'dra ba'i phyir dang / shes pa mi 'dra ba'i thun mong ma yin pa'i rang bzhin snang ba med pa'i phyir yul gsal ba'i cha bzlog par byas pa de'i tshe mngon par rlom pa tsam kho na lus pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, just as the object is clear, so too would the conceiver be.üîΩWhen the object is refuted because it is not similar to the nature that is seen by direct perception, and because the appearance of the uncommon nature of dissimilar consciousness does not exist, at that time, only the mere conceiver remains.

original: de yang 'ga' zhig gsal ba med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir na shes pa'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa sngon po'i rnam pa snang ba nyid ni 'jug pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'ga' zhig gsal ba med par mi 'thad pa'i phyir na shes pa'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa sngon po'i rnam pa snang ba nyid ni 'jug pa yin no //
translated: And because it is not tenable that that is without clarity, the appearance of the aspect of blue that is the nature of consciousness itself is the engagement.

original: des na rang gi rnam pa phyi rol ma yin pa las yang phyi rol du mngon bar rlom pas phyin ci log tu brjod do //
analyzed: des na rang gi rnam pa phyi rol ma yin pa las yang phyi rol du mngon bar rlom pas phyin ci log tu brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the appearance of the object is erroneous because it is imagined to be external, although it is not external.üîΩThus, the nature of the object of those who are in error with respect to silver, etc. is investigated as silver.

original: des na 'di ltar dngul la sogs par phyin ci log pa rnams kyi yul gyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pa dngul nyid yul yin pa de bzhin du phyin ci log 'di'i yul ni don nyid @221a * //üîΩma yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ltar dngul la sogs par phyin ci log pa rnams kyi yul gyi rang gi ngo bo rnam par dpyad pa dngul nyid yul yin pa de bzhin du phyin ci log 'di'i yul ni don nyid @221a * // ma yin no //
translated: In the same way, the object of this error is not a real object.

original: 'di ni der mngon par rlom pa dag 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
analyzed: 'di ni der mngon par rlom pa dag 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi /
translated: It is only imagined to be so.

original: de gsal ba ni ma yin la /
analyzed: de gsal ba ni ma yin la /
translated: It is not a manifestation of that.

original: de gsal ba med par yang de'i rig pa nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de gsal ba med par yang de'i rig pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: And without the manifestation of that, there is no cognition of it.

original: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa'i bslad pa rnams la mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dmigs pa ni de lta bu'i kun dga' ba de nyid yin gyi yul dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log las ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rmi lam la sogs pa'i bslad pa rnams la mngon par 'dod pa'i yul dmigs pa ni de lta bu'i kun dga' ba de nyid yin gyi yul dang bcas pa'i phyin ci log las ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, in the case of the objects of desire that are perceived in such contaminations as dreams, it is just that pleasure which is desired, not an error along with an object.

original: de bzhin du 'dir rang gi bdag nyid snang bzhin ba na yang don du nges pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir rang gi bdag nyid snang bzhin ba na yang don du nges pa yin gyi /
translated: In the same way, here, when one‚Äôs own nature appears, it is ascertained as an object.

original: bdag nyid snang ba ni ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid snang ba ni ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: But the appearance of the self is not reversed,

original: zla ba gnyis snang ba na zla ba snang pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis snang ba na zla ba snang pa bzhin no //
translated: just as the appearance of the moon is not reversed when there is the appearance of two moons.

original: ji ltar de nyid du zla ba gnyis bzhin du don rig pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar de nyid du zla ba gnyis bzhin du don rig pa yang ma yin la /
translated: And just as there is not one moon, so too there is not an object of awareness.

original: ma 'khrul pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'khrul pa ma yin te /
translated: And it is not nonerroneous,

original: lhag par zhen pa phyin ci log pas 'khrul pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa phyin ci log pas 'khrul pa nyid du brjod pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is said to be erroneous due to the error of adherence to what is in excess.

original: rig pa phyin ci log pa las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rig pa phyin ci log pa las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not due to the error of awareness.

original: gal te bzung ba'i rnam pa rang rig pa'i yul yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gal te bzung ba'i rnam pa rang rig pa'i yul yin gyi rnam par rtog pa'i yul ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: If the aspect of the object is the object of reflexive awareness, it is not the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: rig pa gzhan yang khas mi len la /üîΩrang gis rig pa yang rtogs pa'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa gzhan yang khas mi len la / rang gis rig pa yang rtogs pa'i yul ma yin te /
translated: We do not accept other awarenesses.üîΩAnd reflexive awareness is not the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: rang gis rig la yang rtogs mi 'dod //
analyzed: rang gis rig la yang rtogs mi 'dod //
translated: It is not asserted that reflexive awareness is the object of conceptual consciousness.

original: gzhan la rnam par rtog phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan la rnam par rtog phyir ro //
translated: Because it is conceptual with respect to other.

original: zhes gang bshad pa bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes gang bshad pa bzhin no //
translated: This is what is explained.

original: rig pa gzhan khas ma blangs par rtogs pa yang 'dir gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: rig pa gzhan khas ma blangs par rtogs pa yang 'dir gang zhig yin par 'gyur /
translated: If other awarenesses are not accepted, what is it that realizes here?

original: brtags pa yang rjes su yod pa ma yin par slob dpon rnams kyis bstan te /
analyzed: brtags pa yang rjes su yod pa ma yin par slob dpon rnams kyis bstan te /
translated: The masters have taught that even the investigation is not subsequently existent.

original: des na 'dir lan ci yod ce na /
analyzed: des na 'dir lan ci yod ce na /
translated: So what is the answer here?

original: 'di skad brjod de /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod de /
translated: This is said:

original: sngon po'i rnam pa gsal ba bdag nyid kyi ngo bo la don nyid du mngon bar rlom pa ni rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: sngon po'i rnam pa gsal ba bdag nyid kyi ngo bo la don nyid du mngon bar rlom pa ni rnam par rtog pa zhes brjod do //
translated: The vivid aspect of blue is the nature of one‚Äôs own entity, and the manifest pride in it as an object is called a conceptualization.

original: de'i sngon po'i rnam pa nyid gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sngon po'i rnam pa nyid gsal ba gang yin pa de ni rang gis rig pa yin pa'i phyir rang gi ngo bo la rnam par mi rtog pa yin no //
translated: The vividness of the aspect of blue is one‚Äôs own awareness, and therefore it is nonconceptual with respect to its own entity.

original: rnam pa de lta bu de ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi mthar thug pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bu de ni rang gi ngo bo tsam gyi mthar thug pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: That kind of aspect is not limited to one‚Äôs own entity alone.

original: 'on kyang de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis don la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di dag la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis don la brten pa nyid yin pa'i phyir 'di dag la rnam par rtog pa yin te /
translated: However, because it is dependent on an object by the power of such an exaggerated adherence, it is conceptual.

original: dbang po'i shes pa nyid mngon sum ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pa nyid mngon sum ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the sense consciousness itself not being a direct perception.

original: lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin de ni rnam par rtog pa las yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin de ni rnam par rtog pa las yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: That exaggerated adherence is by nature conceptual.

original: des na de nyid 'di @221b rnam par rtog pa nyid do //
analyzed: des na de nyid 'di @221b rnam par rtog pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, it is just a conceptualization.

original: sngon po tsam gsal ba ni dbang po'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sngon po tsam gsal ba ni dbang po'i shes pa la yang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere clarity of blue exists in a sense consciousness.

original: gang gi phyir 'di snga ma dang phyi ma'i myong ba'i 'du byed pa sad pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa de nyid kyi phyir don to snyam du shes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di snga ma dang phyi ma'i myong ba'i 'du byed pa sad pa'i rtsa ba can yin pa de nyid kyi phyir don to snyam du shes pa yin no //
translated: Because it is the root of the activation of the formative forces of prior and subsequent experience, it is known as the object.

original: de nyid kyis na rnam par rtog pa lhag par zhen pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyis na rnam par rtog pa lhag par zhen pa med pa'i rang bzhin yin no //
translated: Therefore, conceptualization has the nature of non-attachment.

original: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni lhag par zhen pa yin pa de yang sngon po'i rnam pa rang gi bdag nyid la snga ma dang phyi mar mthong ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par zhen ba ji lta bur gyur ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa de lta
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa ni lhag par zhen pa yin pa de yang sngon po'i rnam pa rang gi bdag nyid la snga ma dang phyi mar mthong ba'i rang bzhin du lhag par zhen ba ji lta bur gyur ba nyid du lhag par zhen pa de lta
translated: Therefore, conceptualization is attachment, and that is the attachment to the nature of the prior and subsequent perception of the aspect of blue as its own nature.

original: bu'i rnam pa brtags pa yin par brjod do //
analyzed: bu'i rnam pa brtags pa yin par brjod do //
translated: It is said that the conceptualization is imagined in such a way.

original: snga phyir mthong ba'i don gyi rang bzhin shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin pas na /
analyzed: snga phyir mthong ba'i don gyi rang bzhin shes pa'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba ni yod pa ma yin pas na /
translated: But since the nature of the object seen earlier and later does not exist as the nature of consciousness,

original: kun brtags pa rdzas su med par brjod do //
analyzed: kun brtags pa rdzas su med par brjod do //
translated: it is said that the imagined does not exist substantially.

original: de med kyang med pa snang ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de med kyang med pa snang ba ni ma yin te /
translated: But even though it does not exist, its appearance is not nonexistent.

original: zhen pa ni snang ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te ji skad bshad zin ba bzhin no //
analyzed: zhen pa ni snang ba med pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te ji skad bshad zin ba bzhin no //
translated: Because attachment has the nature of the appearance of an object, as has already been explained.üîΩBecause attachment does not occur without an appearance, it is said that the imagined is the nature of consciousness, because attachment to the object occurs only in the form of the appearance of the object in the aspect of the object, and because attachment does not occur without the appearance of the object.

original: 'ga' zhig snang ba med par yang lhag par zhen pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de lta bu kho na la don du lhag par zhen pas zhes de lta bu nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid kho na yul du brjod pa yin no
analyzed: 'ga' zhig snang ba med par yang lhag par zhen pa mi 'jug pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de lta bu kho na la don du lhag par zhen pas zhes de lta bu nyid kyis rang gi bdag nyid kho na yul du brjod pa yin no

original: // mgu pa yang shes pa'i chos kho na ste /
analyzed: // mgu pa yang shes pa'i chos kho na ste /
translated: The object of attachment is only the appearance of

original: shes pa des rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs kyang de'i gzugs brnyan la rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir de rtogs pa'i don du thabs gzhan tshol ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa des rang gi mtshan nyid ma rtogs kyang de'i gzugs brnyan la rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir de rtogs pa'i don du thabs gzhan tshol ba la rgyab kyis phyogs pa'o //
translated: Although that consciousness does not understand its own nature, it is turned away from seeking another method for understanding it, because it is fixated on the reflection of that as its own nature.

original: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni de ltar lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: des na rnam pa de lta bu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni de ltar lhag par zhen pa tsam gyis brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the nature that is such an aspect is an object of expression merely by such fixation.

original: gang gi phyir thams cad las log pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba 'am /
analyzed: gang gi phyir thams cad las log pa'i rang gi ngo bo brjod par bya bar 'gyur ba 'am /
translated: Because it is not the nature that is the opposite of everything, it is not an object of expression.

original: de ltar ma yin na ni brjod pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin na ni brjod pa don med pa nyid du 'gyur ba /
translated: If it were not so, then expression would be pointless.

original: don dam par de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: don dam par de'i yul yin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not because it is the object of the ultimate.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs des na'o //
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni gtan tshigs des na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means ‚Äúbecause of that reason.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù means

original: rang gi gzugs brnyan la rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa 'dis ni rang gi mtshan nyid bstan to zhes brjod do //üîΩgang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi @222a * //
analyzed: rang gi gzugs brnyan la rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa 'dis ni rang gi mtshan nyid bstan to zhes brjod do // gang gi phyir rang gi mtshan nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi @222a * //
translated: The form of the word that has the nature of the special adherence to its own intrinsic identity is said to be the expression of its intrinsic identity.

original: rtogs pa skyed pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid brjod kyi /
analyzed: rtogs pa skyed pa de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid brjod kyi /
translated: Because it generates the understanding of the nature of the special adherence to its own intrinsic identity, therefore, the intrinsic identity is expressed.

original: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan gyis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not expressed in any other way.

original: ci'i phyir rnam pa 'di kho nar zad kyi /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rnam pa 'di kho nar zad kyi /
translated: Why is it only this way and not any other?

original: gzhan med ce na bshad pa /üîΩsgra'i don rtogs pa ni de lta bu kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan med ce na bshad pa / sgra'i don rtogs pa ni de lta bu kho na yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is said:üîΩBecause the understanding of the meaning of a word is just like that.

original: gang gi phyir sgra las don rtogs pa gang yin pa ni rang gi bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yang de ltar lhag par zhen pas 'jug pa de lta bu kho na yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa 'di kho na yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra las don rtogs pa gang yin pa ni rang gi bdag nyid de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa la yang de ltar lhag par zhen pas 'jug pa de lta bu kho na yin pa de'i phyir rnam pa 'di kho na yin no //
translated: Because the understanding of the meaning of a word is just like that, it engages in the nature of what is not its own intrinsic identity through the special adherence to it. Therefore, it is only this way.

original: rnam par gzhan med pa nyid bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bos snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par gzhan med pa nyid bshad pa ni rang gi ngo bos snang ba ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of the absence of any other mode is ‚Äúbecause of the appearance of their own nature.‚Äù

original: 'dir da ni zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: 'dir da ni zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: Here now he says,

original: don dam par thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo yul du ma byas pa'i phyir gcig brjod pas kyang chos thams cad brjod par thal ba'i nyes pa rjes su 'brel pa med mdo /
analyzed: don dam par thams cad las log pa'i ngo bo yul du ma byas pa'i phyir gcig brjod pas kyang chos thams cad brjod par thal ba'i nyes pa rjes su 'brel pa med mdo /
translated: Since the nature of all things is the opposite of everything else ultimately, they are not objects of operation. Therefore, the fault of the absurd consequence that everything is described by the description of one thing does not apply.

original: de ltar lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod par smras la de yang gcig tu ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na spyi'i rnam pa nyid ga la yod /
analyzed: de ltar lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas ni rang gi mtshan nyid kho na brjod par smras la de yang gcig tu ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na spyi'i rnam pa nyid ga la yod /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the adherence to the particular, the description of the particular is stated. Moreover, since the particular is the nature of the opposite of everything else, how can it have a universal aspect?

original: de lta na yang de brjod pa spangs te spyi'i yul can du khas len pa ji ltar mi 'gal snyam du bsams pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang de brjod pa spangs te spyi'i yul can du khas len pa ji ltar mi 'gal snyam du bsams pa'o //
translated: Even so, how can it be non-contradictory to accept that it is the object of a universal, having abandoned its description as a particular?

original: 'di nyid ston pa ni gcig tu log pa'i ngo bo can rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid ston pa ni gcig tu log pa'i ngo bo can rnams la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He demonstrates just this when he says, ‚ÄúThe description of the particular is stated in dependence on the adherence to the particular.‚Äù

original: gtan tshigs smras pa ni de dag la 'brel pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gtan tshigs smras pa ni de dag la 'brel pa'i phyir dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He states the reason when he says, ‚Äúbecause of the relation to them.‚Äù

original: rang gi ngo bo ma 'brel pas ni ldog pa nyid du grub bo //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ma 'brel pas ni ldog pa nyid du grub bo //
translated: Since they are not related by way of their own nature, they are established as being different.

original: gcig tu zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don smras pa ni /
analyzed: gcig tu zhes bya ba'i tshig gi don smras pa ni /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is stated in the line:

original: gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Because there is no other.

original: gal te 'di dag la gzhan yod na ni rang gi ngo bos log pa rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel par 'gyur ba yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'di dag la gzhan yod na ni rang gi ngo bos log pa rnams kyang de'i bdag nyid kyis 'brel par 'gyur ba yin na /
translated: If there were another, then even those that are different by way of their own nature would be related by way of their own nature, but

original: de med pas na gcig tu log pa nyid do //
analyzed: de med pas na gcig tu log pa nyid do //
translated: since that does not exist, they are only different.

original: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa spyi ji lta bu yin pa ni bshad zin te zhes smos te /
analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa spyi ji lta bu yin pa ni bshad zin te zhes smos te /
translated: In order to refute this, the text says, ‚ÄúThe general explanation has already been given.‚Äù

original: de'i blo la de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: de'i blo la de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogs pas so //
translated: Because the mind appears to be like that.

original: der yang rnam pa gnyis bshad de //
analyzed: der yang rnam pa gnyis bshad de //
translated: There, two types are explained:

original: de'i blo'i dbang gis de spyir brjod la de yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyis de gzhan sel pa'i ngo bo yin pa'o //
analyzed: de'i blo'i dbang gis de spyir brjod la de yang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid kyis de gzhan sel pa'i ngo bo yin pa'o //
translated: The mind is called ‚Äúgeneral‚Äù because it appears to be like that, and it is the nature of the exclusion of other because it is the subject that excludes other.

original: de la blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis spyi yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni tha dad dngos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad zin @222b pa rnams kyis bstan pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de la blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis spyi yin no zhes bya ba 'di ni tha dad dngos rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'dir rgyas par 'chad par 'gyur ba'i phyir bshad zin @222b pa rnams kyis bstan pa ma yin gyi /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is a universal because of the power of the mind‚Äù is not taught by the previous explanations, but it will be explained extensively here by the statement ‚Äúwith regard to different things . . .‚Äù

original: 'on kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: However, it does teach that the object of other-exclusion is a universal.

original: ma 'dres pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa ngang pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni khra bo la sogs pa ngang pa la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams dang ma 'dres pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúUnmixed‚Äù means that the various things such as a cow are not mixed with the various things such as a horse.

original: de la gcig kyang thams cad dang ma 'brel pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gcig kyang thams cad dang ma 'brel pa yin no //
translated: In that case, each is not related to all.

original: thams cad kyang gcig dang ngo //
analyzed: thams cad kyang gcig dang ngo //
translated: And all are not related to each.

original: de la thams cad gcig dang ma 'brel pa la ltos nas ni spyi rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de la thams cad gcig dang ma 'brel pa la ltos nas ni spyi rnam par 'jog go //
translated: In that case, a universal is posited in dependence on all not being related to each.

original: 'di ltar khra bo la sogs pa'i khyad par mtha' dag rta dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar khra bo la sogs pa'i khyad par mtha' dag rta dang ma 'dres pa yin no //
translated: In that case, all the particulars such as a cow are not mixed with a horse.

original: des na khra bo la yang rta med la /
analyzed: des na khra bo la yang rta med la /
translated: Therefore a cow is not a horse.

original: ser skya la yang med cing de bzhin du gsal ba gzhan dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: ser skya la yang med cing de bzhin du gsal ba gzhan dag la yang ngo //
translated: And so on for other instances.

original: rta ma yin pa'i gsal ba so so la rta zhes so so re re la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rta ma yin pa'i gsal ba so so la rta zhes so so re re la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúhorse‚Äù is not in each individual non-horse, because each one is not a horse.

original: ba lang rnams kyi rta dang ma 'brel ba ni spyir 'gyur te /
analyzed: ba lang rnams kyi rta dang ma 'brel ba ni spyir 'gyur te /
translated: The non-connection of the cows with the horse is a universal,

original: re re la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not in each individual.

original: de bshad pa ni ma 'dres pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni ma 'dres pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The explanation of this is ‚Äúin the non-mixed.‚Äù

original: gcig po de dang tha dad pa rnams la ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni gcig dang ma 'brel pa spyi'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig po de dang tha dad pa rnams la ni ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis ni gcig dang ma 'brel pa spyi'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The non-connection of the one with the different is a universal, because it is a property of the different in the manner explained.

original: de lta na yang ldog pa spyir 'gyur ba ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: de lta na yang ldog pa spyir 'gyur ba ni ma yin te ;
translated: But even so, the negation is not a universal,

original: khra po la sogs pa la so sor ba lang ma yin pa la med pas spyir brjod kyi 'ga' zhig yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khra po la sogs pa la so sor ba lang ma yin pa la med pas spyir brjod kyi 'ga' zhig yod pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: because the non-cow in the variegated and so on is a universal, but not because it exists in some.

original: ba lang ma yin ba zhes re re la med pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ba lang ma yin ba zhes re re la med pa yin gyi /
translated: The non-cow is not in each individual,

original: 'ga' zhig bdog pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig bdog pa ni ma yin no //
translated: but it is not that it exists in some.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de lta bu'i ldog pa spyir rtogs pa'i sa bon yin no zhes sngar bstan pa mdun du sgrub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de lta bu'i ldog pa spyir rtogs pa'i sa bon yin no zhes sngar bstan pa mdun du sgrub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it was previously taught that such a universal is the seed of the understanding of a universal in general, and this is now being proven.

original: de las tha dad pa rnams gcig dang ma 'brel par mtshungs pa ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de las tha dad pa rnams gcig dang ma 'brel par mtshungs pa ni spyi yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúthat which is similar in the absence of a relation with one is a universal‚Äù is as follows.

original: ma 'brel pa ni 'brel pa med pa tsam yin pas ji ltar dngos su spyi yin par 'gyur /
analyzed: ma 'brel pa ni 'brel pa med pa tsam yin pas ji ltar dngos su spyi yin par 'gyur /
translated: Since the absence of a relation is merely the nonexistence of a relation, how can it be a universal in reality?

original: des na rtogs pa po'i bsam pa la ltos nas de de ltar brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa po'i bsam pa la ltos nas de de ltar brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be so in dependence on the thought of the one who understands.

original: bshad zin pa nyid rgyas par sgrub pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes smos so //
analyzed: bshad zin pa nyid rgyas par sgrub pa'i phyir gzhan yang zhes smos so //
translated: In order to prove in detail what has already been explained, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover. . . .‚Äù

original: blo gang gis rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa de'i lhag par zhen pa la brten nas spyi yod par ni rab tu bsgrags so //
analyzed: blo gang gis rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa de'i lhag par zhen pa la brten nas spyi yod par ni rab tu bsgrags so //
translated: The existence of a universal is proclaimed in dependence on the adherence to the superimposition of that which is the obscuration of the nature of another by an awareness that is essentially different from it.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang zhen pa la ltos nas sgra'i don nyid dang de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid yin pa na /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyang zhen pa la ltos nas sgra'i don nyid dang de bzhin du rjes su dpag pa'i yul nyid yin pa na /
translated: Even a particular is the meaning of a word and the object of inference in dependence on adherence.

original: spyi @223a * //
analyzed: spyi @223a * //
translated: Universal

original: sgra'i don nyid dang rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid la sogs par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni spyi yod par bsgrags pa yin la de yang rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa'i blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don nyid dang rjes su dpag par bya ba nyid la sogs par brjod pa gang yin pa de ni spyi yod par bsgrags pa yin la de yang rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib par byed pa'i blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis yin no //
translated: The universal is proclaimed to exist because of the expression of the meaning of a general term, the expression of what is to be inferred, and so on. And that is due to the power of the thought of the mind that conceals the nature of another by its own nature.

original: don gzhan du gyur pa yin yang gang gis rang gi rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun par rang gi ngo bo sgro btags nas ston par byed pa'i blo des rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgribs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: don gzhan du gyur pa yin yang gang gis rang gi rang bzhin dang rjes su mthun par rang gi ngo bo sgro btags nas ston par byed pa'i blo des rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgribs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even though it is a different object, the mind that reveals it by superimposing its own nature in accordance with its own nature is said to conceal the nature of another by its own nature.

original: blo la ltos pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bo ni phyi'i don nyid do //
analyzed: blo la ltos pa'i gzhan gyi ngo bo ni phyi'i don nyid do //
translated: The nature of another in dependence on the mind is the external object itself.

original: de yang rang gi ngo bo bsgrib pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan du gyur pa de la de lta bur rgyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo sgro 'dogs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang gi ngo bo bsgrib pa nyid kyi phyir gzhan du gyur pa de la de lta bur rgyur pa'i rang gi ngo bo sgro 'dogs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: And because it conceals its own nature, it is said that the mind superimposes its own nature in that way on that which is different.

original: don gzhan nyid du gyur ba la sgro btags pa gang yin pa 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gyur pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: don gzhan nyid du gyur ba la sgro btags pa gang yin pa 'di'i rang gi ngo bo ji ltar gyur pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the nature of this superimposition of difference onto things that are not different?

original: don gcig tu ni snang ba zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: don gcig tu ni snang ba zhes gsungs so //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThey appear as if they were the same.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni blo'i ngo bo tha mi dad pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni blo'i ngo bo tha mi dad pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: This shows that the nature of the cognition is undifferentiated.

original: dngos rnams la zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig gis ni 'di dag phan tshun tha dad pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: dngos rnams la zhes bya ba mang po'i tshig gis ni 'di dag phan tshun tha dad pa nyid brjod do //
translated: The plural particle in ‚Äúthings‚Äù shows that they are mutually different.

original: tha dad ces bya bas ni rigs mi mthun pa la ldog pa nyid do //
analyzed: tha dad ces bya bas ni rigs mi mthun pa la ldog pa nyid do //
translated: The word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù shows that they are of different kinds.

original: 'di'i de dag la brten pa ni ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis de ltar lhag par zhen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di'i de dag la brten pa ni ji ltar sngar bshad pa'i tshul gyis de ltar lhag par zhen pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: The superimposition of difference onto things that are not different is the adherence to the essential nature of things as it is not.

original: de'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: de'i don 'di yin te /
translated: This is what it means.

original: ba lang gi ngo bo phan tshun tha dad pa ba lang gi gsal ba tha dad pa dag kho na la ba lang snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ba lang gi rang bzhin tha mi dad par snang ba'i rnam pa can skyes la /
analyzed: ba lang gi ngo bo phan tshun tha dad pa ba lang gi gsal ba tha dad pa dag kho na la ba lang snyam pa'i rnam par rtog pa ba lang gi rang bzhin tha mi dad par snang ba'i rnam pa can skyes la /
translated: The conceptual thought that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù arises with regard to only the different manifestations of cow that are mutually different in nature, and it has the aspect of appearing as if it were undifferentiated from the nature of cow.

original: de yang don gyi ngo bor lhag par zhen pa'i phyir na des don bsgribs par 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de yang don gyi ngo bor lhag par zhen pa'i phyir na des don bsgribs par 'gyur ro ;
translated: Since it is a superimposition on the entity of the object, it obscures the object.

original: / da ni de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis spyir ji ltar khas blangs pa de ston te /
analyzed: / da ni de'i bsam pa'i dbang gis spyir ji ltar khas blangs pa de ston te /
translated: Now, in terms of its thought, it is taught how it is generally accepted.

original: rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib pa'i ngo bo kun rdzob des dngos po rnams bdag nyid tha dad kyang tha dad pa nyid bsgribs pa'i dngos po rnams ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos tha dad pa min ba lta bur snang ngo //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo sgrib pa'i ngo bo kun rdzob des dngos po rnams bdag nyid tha dad kyang tha dad pa nyid bsgribs pa'i dngos po rnams ba lang nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bos tha dad pa min ba lta bur snang ngo //
translated: Since the entity of the object is obscured by the entity of the superimposition, entities appear as if they are not different by way of their own entity, even though they are different.

original: blo'i ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgribs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na /
analyzed: blo'i ngo bos gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgribs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis na /
translated: Since the entity of the object is obscured by the entity of the superimposition,

original: dngos po rnams tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa med par bsal ba na /
analyzed: dngos po rnams tha dad pa yin yang tha dad pa med par bsal ba na /
translated: entities, even though they are different, are cleared of difference.

original: blo de la ltos nas spyir tha snyad byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: blo de la ltos nas spyir tha snyad byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: In dependence on that cognition, a general term is applied.

original: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa rnams kyang tha dad par @223b snang ba'i phyir de la ltos nas spyi yul du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa rnams kyang tha dad par @223b snang ba'i phyir de la ltos nas spyi yul du bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin nam /
translated: But is it not the case that the object of a universal is taught in dependence on those that are different due to the power of error appearing as different?

original: rang gi ngo bor gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgribs par brjod pa don ci yod /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gzhan gyi ngo bo bsgribs par brjod pa don ci yod /
translated: What is the point of saying that the nature of another is obscured in its own nature?

original: ji ltar don med /
analyzed: ji ltar don med /
translated: How is it pointless?

original: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa'i ngo bo yang brjod par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'khrul pa'i ngo bo yang brjod par bya ba nyid de /
translated: Because the nature of error is also to be expressed.

original: ji ltar 'di tha dad pa tha mi dad par rtogs par byed /
analyzed: ji ltar 'di tha dad pa tha mi dad par rtogs par byed /
translated: How is it that it is understood to be neither different nor non-different?

original: tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin de gal te phyi rol na med na 'o na bsal ba de gang zhig ces brjod par bya ba na /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin de gal te phyi rol na med na 'o na bsal ba de gang zhig ces brjod par bya ba na /
translated: If that nature which is not different does not exist externally, then when it is said, ‚ÄúWhat is that exclusion?‚Äù

original: don gcig tu ni snang ba'i blo //
analyzed: don gcig tu ni snang ba'i blo //
translated: The mind that appears as a single object

original: zhes bya bas de blo'i ngo bor bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya bas de blo'i ngo bor bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that it is the nature of the mind.

original: blo nyid rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa na don tha dad pa med par snang ngo zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
analyzed: blo nyid rnam pa de lta bur gyur pa na don tha dad pa med par snang ngo zhes bya ba 'di ga las she na /
translated: If the mind itself appears in that way, how is it that it appears without a difference of object?

original: blo'i rang gi ngo bo nyid don du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo'i rang gi ngo bo nyid don du mngon par zhen pa'i phyir te /
