translated: because of the adherence to the intrinsic reality of the mind as an object.

original: de tha dad pa med par gsal ba na /
analyzed: de tha dad pa med par gsal ba na /
translated: When it is manifest without distinction,

original: don tha dad pa med par snang ngo zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩspyi de yang don nyid mtshungs pa yin no zhes rang bzhin 'dis blos ji ltar kun brtags pa de ltar de dam pa'i don du med /
analyzed: don tha dad pa med par snang ngo zhes rtogs pa'i phyir ro // spyi de yang don nyid mtshungs pa yin no zhes rang bzhin 'dis blos ji ltar kun brtags pa de ltar de dam pa'i don du med /
translated: it is understood that the object appears without distinction.üîΩAnd that universal is the same as the object itself.

original: de dag ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are not ultimately as they are imagined by the mind, because of their different natures.

original: re zhig tshigs su bcad pa dang po rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
analyzed: re zhig tshigs su bcad pa dang po rnam par 'grel pa bshad pa ni /
translated: The first verse is explained as a commentary.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The mind that is conceptual.

original: khra bo la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa de las ldog pa can te ;
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa de dag las gzhan pa rta la sogs pa de las ldog pa can te ;
translated: It is the opposite of that, i.e., the horse, etc., which is different from those, i.e., the variegated, etc.

original: khra bo la sogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa nyid do //
translated: It is the variegated, etc., itself.

original: 'dis ni log pa nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni log pa nyid brjod do //
translated: This expresses the falsity of the conceptual.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po rnams la brten nas skye ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni de lta bur gyur pa'i dngos po rnams la brten nas skye ba yin no //
translated: The conceptual arises in dependence upon things that are such.

original: brten pa yang ji skad brjod pa bzhin lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis sam yang na nyams su myong bas chos pas rgyu nyid du 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rtog pa ni dngos po nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'brangs nas skye ba'i phyir dngos po
analyzed: brten pa yang ji skad brjod pa bzhin lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis sam yang na nyams su myong bas chos pas rgyu nyid du 'dzin pa'i rnam pa rtog pa ni dngos po nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed kyi rjes su 'brangs nas skye ba'i phyir dngos po
translated: and the conceptual thought that apprehends the cause of the experience of an entity, in the aspect of the adherence to the entity as it is expressed, arises in dependence on the formative forces that experience the entity.

original: la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: la brten pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is said that conceptual thought is based on entities.

original: dngos po de dag gi ngo bo tha dad pa mi snang bar byas nas dngos po de rnams kun du ston to //
analyzed: dngos po de dag gi ngo bo tha dad pa mi snang bar byas nas dngos po de rnams kun du ston to //
translated: Having made the different natures of those entities invisible, it presents those entities.

original: ji ltar tha dad par mi snang bar byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar tha dad par mi snang bar byed ce na /
translated: How does it make them invisible as different?

original: 'dres par byed pa ste dngos po rnams sre bar byed pas na'o //
analyzed: 'dres par byed pa ste dngos po rnams sre bar byed pas na'o //
translated: It mixes them, because it combines those entities.üîΩAnd how does it do that?

original: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de yang ji ltar zhe na /
translated: It makes them appear as if they were not different in their aspects.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their aspects, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.üîΩWhen it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.

original: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa tha mi dad pa zhen par byas te'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa tha mi dad pa zhen par byas te'o //
translated: When it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures, it makes them appear as if they were not different in their natures.

original: de don nyid du lhag par zhen par byas pa na don bzhin du byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir na /üîΩdon de nyid du lhag par zhen pa nyid don la lhag @224a * //
analyzed: de don nyid du lhag par zhen par byas pa na don bzhin du byas par 'gyur ba'i phyir na /üîΩdon de nyid du lhag par zhen pa nyid don la lhag @224a * //
translated: When it makes them

original: par zhen pa yin no //
analyzed: par zhen pa yin no //
translated: It is the attachment to the object.

original: des na don 'di yin te bdag nyid kyi tha mi dad pa la don du lhag par zhen pas don tha mi dad par zhen par byas par 'gyur ba des na 'di dag 'dres par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te bdag nyid kyi tha mi dad pa la don du lhag par zhen pas don tha mi dad par zhen par byas par 'gyur ba des na 'di dag 'dres par byas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: because of the attachment to the object as not different from the self, the object is conceived as not different from the self. Therefore, they are mixed.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams don nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed la rtogs pa nyid kyis don la brten pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa rnams don nyams su myong ba'i 'du byed la rtogs pa nyid kyis don la brten pa yin na /
translated: If the conceptualizations are based on the object because of the experience of the object,

original: nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du don du snang ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ji lta ba bzhin du don du snang ba'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: then they would have the nature of the appearance of the object as it is experienced.

original: rang gi bag chags kyi rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ba yin na yang don la brten pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rang gi bag chags kyi rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ba yin na yang don la brten pa nyid nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: But if they are of the nature of one‚Äôs own habitual tendencies, then the claim that they are based on the object is undermined,

original: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan tshun 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because these two are mutually exclusive.

original: cha dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir na nyams su myong ba las ni don du snang ba nyid yin la rang gi bag chags las ni phyin ci log tu yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus so zhes dogs pa la /
analyzed: cha dang rjes su 'brel pa ma yin pa'i phyir na nyams su myong ba las ni don du snang ba nyid yin la rang gi bag chags las ni phyin ci log tu yin no zhes kyang brjod par mi nus so zhes dogs pa la /
translated: Since it is not a part or a consequence, it cannot be said that the appearance of the object is due to experience and the error is due to one‚Äôs own habitual tendencies.

original: bsgrub par bya ba dang zhes smos so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba dang zhes smos so //
translated: The word ‚Äúprobandum‚Äù is supplied.üîΩThe word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is supplied.

original: bsgrub par bya ba gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba gcig pa nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa'i bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If the probandum is the same, then the proof is the same.

original: gal te gsal pa so so'i bzho ba tha dad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gsal pa so so'i bzho ba tha dad pa ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the clarity of the individual proofs different?

original: bden te / 'di ni bzho ba nyid du gyur pa na tha dad pa yin gyi chu 'chu ba nyid yin pas ni ma yin pas tha mi dad par brjod do //
analyzed: bden te / 'di ni bzho ba nyid du gyur pa na tha dad pa yin gyi chu 'chu ba nyid yin pas ni ma yin pas tha mi dad par brjod do //
translated: It is true that they are different in being the proof, but they are not different in being the proof of water, so they are said to be the same.

original: de bzhin du ba lang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gcig gis sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa gcig pa yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang gi mtshan nyid kyi dngos po gcig gis sgrub pa'i phyir sgrub pa gcig pa yin te /
translated: In the same way, the proof is the same because it establishes the same thing, the entity that is the characteristic of a cow.

original: ba lang thams cad ba lang gis sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gcig pa can nyid nges so //
analyzed: ba lang thams cad ba lang gis sgrub pa yin pa'i phyir sgrub pa gcig pa can nyid nges so //
translated: because all cows are established by cow.

original: ba lang gi gsal ba re re zhing skyed par byed pa'i ba lang tha dad pa yin yang ba lang nyid du gyur pas tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad par brjod de snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: ba lang gi gsal ba re re zhing skyed par byed pa'i ba lang tha dad pa yin yang ba lang nyid du gyur pas tha dad pa'i phyir tha mi dad par brjod de snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Although each individual cow is a different producer, they are not different because they are cows, just as before.

original: des na don 'di yin te bzho pa dang bkal ba'i nus pa re re la phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des na don 'di yin te bzho pa dang bkal ba'i nus pa re re la phan tshun rjes su 'gro ba med pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning: because each individual ability to churn and weave does not mutually follow the other.

original: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nye bar mtshon pa yin te /
translated: This is an illustration.

original: ji ltar mdun nas 'chad pa bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar mdun nas 'chad pa bzhin du /
translated: Just as explained before,

original: 'di dag la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i ba lang nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i ba lang nyid kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: these do not have cowhood that does not follow.

original: de'i phyir ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rtogs pa byed pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir ba lang ngo snyam pa'i rtogs pa byed pa nyid yin la /
translated: Therefore, the cognition that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù is the cause,

original: de lta yin na yang mi 'dra bar ma rtogs pa'i phyir rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin na yang mi 'dra bar ma rtogs pa'i phyir rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i yin no //
translated: and even though that is so, because it is not cognized as different, it is not a different cognition.

original: des na rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i rnam par @224b rtog pa med pa la /
analyzed: des na rnam par rtog pa'i sa bon dang ldan pa'i rnam par @224b rtog pa med pa la /
translated: Therefore, in the case of non-conceptual cognition, which is endowed with the seeds of conceptualization,

original: don gyi rang bzhin gnas pa na rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i rnam pa skye ba'i phyir dngos po las skye ba 'di tha dad pa med par snang ba gang yin par snang ba 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: don gyi rang bzhin gnas pa na rnam par rtog pa de lta bu'i rnam pa skye ba'i phyir dngos po las skye ba 'di tha dad pa med par snang ba gang yin par snang ba 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: when the nature of the object is present, that kind of conceptualization arises. Therefore, this appearance of non-difference from the entity is the nature of entities.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i don nye bar 'god pas kun rdzob ces bya ba rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gnyis pa'i don nye bar 'god pas kun rdzob ces bya ba rnam par 'grel to //
translated: The meaning of the second verse is summarized: ‚ÄúThe so-called conventional is explained.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir 'di rnam par 'grel zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'di rnam par 'grel zhe na /
translated: Why is this explained?

original: kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di blo zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel par brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun rdzob ces bya ba 'di blo zhes bya ba 'di dang 'brel par brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because this so-called conventional is related to this so-called cognition.

original: gzhan du na kun rdzob tu tha dad pa med pa nyid du snang ngo zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na kun rdzob tu tha dad pa med pa nyid du snang ngo zhes rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be understood that the non-difference in the conventional appears.

original: tha mi dad pa ni kun rdzob kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: tha mi dad pa ni kun rdzob kyang ma yin te /
translated: Non-difference is also not conventional,

original: yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yod par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that it exists.

original: brtags pa 'di med pa nyid do zhes de phyir don la gcig bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog 'di 'khrul pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: brtags pa 'di med pa nyid do zhes de phyir don la gcig bdag tu 'dzin pa'i rnam rtog 'di 'khrul pa zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: This investigation is not nonexistent, therefore, this conceptualization that apprehends the object as a single self is called an error.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni yod kyang kun rdzob ma yin te mi 'thad pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rnam pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa ni yod kyang kun rdzob ma yin te mi 'thad pa med pa'i phyir mngon sum gyi rnam pa bzhin no //
translated: Although the form of conceptualization exists, it is not conventional, because it is not untenable, like the form of direct perception.

original: rnam par shes par smra ba la ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa yang kun rdzob kho na'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes par smra ba la ni mngon sum gyi rnam pa yang kun rdzob kho na'o //
translated: For the Vij√±ƒÅnavƒÅdins, the form of direct perception is only conventional.

original: blo ni 'khrul ba'i yul bzhin du mi 'thad pa nyid kyis kun rdzob tu mi brjod de /
analyzed: blo ni 'khrul ba'i yul bzhin du mi 'thad pa nyid kyis kun rdzob tu mi brjod de /
translated: The mind is not described as conventional because it is untenable, like the object of error.

original: des na ji ltar grags pa'i kun rdzob kyi don spangs te 'di bstan pa yin no zhes ston pa ni tha mi dad pa bzhin du snang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na ji ltar grags pa'i kun rdzob kyi don spangs te 'di bstan pa yin no zhes ston pa ni tha mi dad pa bzhin du snang ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, this is taught, abandoning the meaning of conventional as it is known, as it appears as if not different.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni /
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù is mentioned.

original: dngos su tha mi dad pa rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos su tha mi dad pa rig pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no awareness of the actual nondifference.

original: de ltar yang ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yang ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be taught.

original: de ni de'i bsam ba'i dbang gis na zhes bya ba 'chad do //
analyzed: de ni de'i bsam ba'i dbang gis na zhes bya ba 'chad do //
translated: It is said that this is due to the power of the mind.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore means for that reason.

original: rjes su byed pa rnams kyis blo'i snang ba la tha mi dad par snang ba'i dngos po de dag kho na'i spyi yin par brjod do //
analyzed: rjes su byed pa rnams kyis blo'i snang ba la tha mi dad par snang ba'i dngos po de dag kho na'i spyi yin par brjod do //
translated: The universal of those things that appear undifferentiated to the cognition that conforms to them is said to be the universal of those things.

original: tha mi dad par snang ba na yang blo la gnas pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang ba na yang blo la gnas pa thob par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: Even when they appear undifferentiated, they are said to be established in the cognition.

original: blo la snang ba'i zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i zhes bya bas so //
translated: This is stated by the words in the appearance to the cognition.üîΩWhen they are the universal of those things that appear to the cognition, how is it that they are said to obscure their own nature by means of another nature? This is shown by the words:

original: de blo la snang ba rnams kho na'i spyi yin pa na ji ltar gzhan gyi ngo bos rang gi ngo bo sgrib par brjod pa de ston pa ni phyi rol lta bur kun du 'phro ba zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de blo la snang ba rnams kho na'i spyi yin pa na ji ltar gzhan gyi ngo bos rang gi ngo bo sgrib par brjod pa de ston pa ni phyi rol lta bur kun du 'phro ba zhes bya ste /
translated: The universal of those things that appear to the cognition is said to obscure its own nature by means of another nature, like the universal of the external.

original: phyi rol nyid du zhen par byas pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to /
analyzed: phyi rol nyid du zhen par byas pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that they are conceived as external.

original: de nyid ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: de nyid ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes smos so //üîΩphyi'i don gyi @225a * //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir zhes smos so //üîΩphyi'i don gyi @225a * //
translated: It is said: because it apprehends the particular aspect.üîΩThe universal of those things that appear to the cognition is said to obscure its own nature by means of another nature, like the universal of the external.

original: rnam pa'i khyad par gyi myong pa'i phyir de rnam pa de lta bur shes pa la rnam pa'i khyad par gsal ba don du lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i khyad par gyi myong pa'i phyir de rnam pa de lta bur shes pa la rnam pa'i khyad par gsal ba don du lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Because of the experience of the specific aspect, there arises a nature of adherence to the specific aspect as something extra in the cognition of that aspect.

original: gal te blo'i bsam pa la ltos nas spyi yin na /
analyzed: gal te blo'i bsam pa la ltos nas spyi yin na /
translated: If the universal is in dependence on the idea of the cognition,

original: gzhan sel ba spyi'i rang bzhin du brjod pa 'gal lo zhes brtan pa'i phyir pha rol po dag ni zhes brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba spyi'i rang bzhin du brjod pa 'gal lo zhes brtan pa'i phyir pha rol po dag ni zhes brjod do //
translated: then it is contradictory to say that the exclusion of other is the nature of the universal.

original: lan bshad pa de nyid ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: lan bshad pa de nyid ces bya ba ste /
translated: The answer to that is ‚ÄúThat itself . . .‚Äù

original: blo'i snang ba nyid gzhan sel ba yin no //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba nyid gzhan sel ba yin no //
translated: The exclusion of other is the appearance in the cognition itself.

original: ji ltar blo'i snang ba nyid gzhan sel ba yin /
analyzed: ji ltar blo'i snang ba nyid gzhan sel ba yin /
translated: How is the exclusion of other the appearance in the cognition itself?

original: gang gi phyir rtogs pa po sgro btags kyang rang bzhin dang gcig tu 'gyur ba'i don gzhan las log par 'gyur ba des na de nyid gzhan sel ba yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir rtogs pa po sgro btags kyang rang bzhin dang gcig tu 'gyur ba'i don gzhan las log par 'gyur ba des na de nyid gzhan sel ba yin no //
translated: Because the cognizer, even though he superimposes, becomes one with the nature of the object, and the object becomes the opposite of other objects. Therefore, that itself is the exclusion of other.

original: des na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba gzhan sel ba nyid yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba gzhan sel ba nyid yin /
translated: How then is the appearance in the conceptual cognition the exclusion of other?

original: de la ni sgro btags pa bsal ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gzhan las log pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de la ni sgro btags pa bsal ba sngon du 'gro ba can gyi gzhan las log pa nyid yod pa ma yin no //
translated: In that case, there is no exclusion from other that precedes the removal of superimposition.

original: sgro 'dogs ni don nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs ni don nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because superimposition engages the object itself,

original: blo'i snang ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: not the appearance to the mind.

original: de bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to remove that,

original: de ni de kho na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de ni de kho na zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚Äúthat is reality.‚Äù

original: rang gi snang ba nyid rtogs pa na blo 'khrul pa'i dbang gis dngos po 'dzin pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: rang gi snang ba nyid rtogs pa na blo 'khrul pa'i dbang gis dngos po 'dzin pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: When one realizes one‚Äôs own appearance, it appears as if one grasps an entity due to the power of the error of the mind.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kho na la dngos por lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kho na la dngos por lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one engages by superimposing an entity onto one‚Äôs own nature.

original: de'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyi snang ba 'dzin pa na dngos po 'dzin pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir de la ltos nas de dngos po yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi bdag nyid kyi snang ba 'dzin pa na dngos po 'dzin pa bzhin du snang ba'i phyir de la ltos nas de dngos po yin la /
translated: Therefore, when one grasps one‚Äôs own appearance, it appears as if one grasps an entity. In dependence on that, it is an entity.

original: dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ni gzhan gyis dben pa yin pas de bas na de 'dzin pa na gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po la sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ni gzhan gyis dben pa yin pas de bas na de 'dzin pa na gzhan sel ba'i yul can nyid do //
translated: Because it is an exclusion from other due to superimposing an entity, therefore, when one grasps that, it is the subject that has the object of the exclusion of other.

original: des na snang ba dngos po lta bur snang ba'i phyir de dngos po nyid yin pas na /
analyzed: des na snang ba dngos po lta bur snang ba'i phyir de dngos po nyid yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, because the appearance appears as if it were a thing, it is a thing.

original: dngos po gzhan sel ba nyid de /
analyzed: dngos po gzhan sel ba nyid de /
translated: It is the exclusion of other things,

original: gzhan gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dben pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is isolated from other things.

original: des na blo gzhan sel ba'i blo nyid yin pas na gzhan sel ba spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na blo gzhan sel ba'i blo nyid yin pas na gzhan sel ba spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable that the exclusion of other things is the nature of a universal, because it is the cognition that excludes other things.

original: de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: de bshad pa ni /
translated: The explanation of that is:

original: de ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the cognition.

original: des ni de ltar rtogs pa'i bsam pa la ltos nas blo'i snang ba nyid spyi'i rang bzhin du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni de ltar rtogs pa'i bsam pa la ltos nas blo'i snang ba nyid spyi'i rang bzhin du bshad pa yin te /
translated: Thus, in dependence on the thought that understands in that way, the appearance of the cognition itself is explained to be the nature of a universal,

original: de dag gis spyir rtogs pa de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis spyir rtogs pa de ltar khas blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they assert that the understanding of a universal is like that.

original: rang gi snang ba nyid de ltar snang ba'i phyir de nyid spyi yon no //
analyzed: rang gi snang ba nyid de ltar snang ba'i phyir de nyid spyi yon no //
translated: Because it appears as if it were its own appearance, it is a universal.

original: de yang gzhan sel ba'i rang @225b bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de yang gzhan sel ba'i rang @225b bzhin yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is the nature of the exclusion of other things.

original: sgro 'dogs dang bral bar gyur pa gzhan gyis dben pa gang yin pa de'i yul can nyid kyi sna blo 'di gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs dang bral bar gyur pa gzhan gyis dben pa gang yin pa de'i yul can nyid kyi sna blo 'di gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The subject of that is the cognition that has the exclusion of other as its object.

original: de yang don kho na la rang gi snang ba yang don bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang don kho na la rang gi snang ba yang don bzhin du snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, the object itself appears to it in the same way that it appears to the sense faculty.üîΩBecause it appears as if it were a real thing, the cognition that apprehends it is understood to apprehend a real thing.

original: de la dngos po bzhin du snang ba'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i blo dngos po 'dzin pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma rtogs pa na /
analyzed: de la dngos po bzhin du snang ba'i phyir de 'dzin pa'i blo dngos po 'dzin pa nyid du rtogs pa'i phyir dngos po nyid ma rtogs pa na /
translated: When a real thing is not understood,

original: gzhan dag rtsod par byed pa ni phyi rol zhes bya ba'o //üîΩde la gzhan gyis dben pa'i dngos po rnams la rang snang ba'i yul can gyi blo yod par ma grub ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag rtsod par byed pa ni phyi rol zhes bya ba'o // de la gzhan gyis dben pa'i dngos po rnams la rang snang ba'i yul can gyi blo yod par ma grub ste /
translated: others argue that it is external.üîΩIn that regard, the existence of a cognition that has the appearance of things that are excluded from other is not established.

original: gang gi phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid sgro 'dogs dang bral ba las dben par gyur pa yin na de dag la ni rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir phyi rol gyi don nyid sgro 'dogs dang bral ba las dben par gyur pa yin na de dag la ni rnam par rtog pa rnams mi 'jug ste /
translated: Because the external object itself is free from superimposition, it is excluded from other. Conceptual thoughts do not engage with it.

original: des na gang gi tha dad pa'i yul can du gyur pa tha dad pa rnams la blo 'di ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: des na gang gi tha dad pa'i yul can du gyur pa tha dad pa rnams la blo 'di ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, how could this cognition occur in regard to those that are different, which are the objects of different cognitions?

original: 'di bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di bsal ba'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to dispel this doubt, he says:

original: 'chad par byed pa rnams zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'chad par byed pa rnams zhes smos so //
translated: Those who explain

original: gang dag dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po nyid las rtogs nas 'chad par byed pa de dag de ltar rnam pa 'byed de /
analyzed: gang dag dngos po'i rang bzhin dngos po nyid las rtogs nas 'chad par byed pa de dag de ltar rnam pa 'byed de /
translated: Those who explain, having understood the nature of things from things themselves, they distinguish in that way.

original: 'di lta ste phyi rol dag la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'di lta ste phyi rol dag la rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug go zhes bya bar ro //
translated: For example, conceptualization does not engage external things.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams ni ma yin te de dag la ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pas bskyed ba'i rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams ni ma yin te de dag la ni dngos po'i rang bzhin rnam par dpyad pas bskyed ba'i rnam par 'byed pa'i gnas skabs 'ga' yang med do //
translated: But not those who designate, because for them there is never an occasion for distinguishing that is produced by analyzing the nature of things.

original: de dag la ni gang la ji ltar rtogs pa de la de ltar rtogs pa de la de ltar rtogs pa las ma rtogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de dag la ni gang la ji ltar rtogs pa de la de ltar rtogs pa de la de ltar rtogs pa las ma rtogs pa'i rnam par dpyod pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: For them, there is no analysis at all of what is not understood, in the form of understanding it as it is understood or not understanding it as it is not understood.

original: de dag la yang dpyod pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de dag la yang dpyod pa 'ga' zhig yod pa yang yin te /
translated: Some of them do analyze,

original: 'di ltar 'dir ba lang yod pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang yin no zhes smras pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dir ba lang yod pa'i rang bzhin yang yin pa med pa'i rang bzhin yang yin no zhes smras pa na /
translated: for in this way, when it is said, ‚ÄúHere, the nature of the cow is existent and the nature of nonexistence,‚Äù

original: dmun po yang gal te yod pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: dmun po yang gal te yod pa kho na yin na /
translated: the fool thinks, ‚ÄúIf it is only existent,

original: ji ltar med pa yin zhes rnam par rtog par byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar med pa yin zhes rnam par rtog par byed do //
translated: how can it be nonexistent?‚Äù

original: 'di dag shes rab phul du byung bas thob par byed pa de ltar ni rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
analyzed: 'di dag shes rab phul du byung bas thob par byed pa de ltar ni rnam par dpyod par mi byed do //
translated: But those who attain this through the highest wisdom do not analyze in this way.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni snang ba dag rnam par rtog par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug go zhes bya ba tha snyad du byed do //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni snang ba dag rnam par rtog par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug go zhes bya ba tha snyad du byed do //
translated: Those who make conventional expressions make them by taking the objects of the conceptualization of appearances as one.

original: de dag gcig tu byed pa gang zhe na /üîΩrang gi dmigs @226a * //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu byed pa gang zhe na / rang gi dmigs @226a * //
translated: What is their oneness?

original: pa kho na zhes smos te /
analyzed: pa kho na zhes smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚Äúonly their own object.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi dmigs pa bdag nyid kyi rnam par rtog pas rtogs pa'i rang bzhin te /
translated: The nature of the object of the conceptualization of the self is the nature of the object of the conceptualization of the self.

original: de yang bdag nyid kyi snang ba ste 'dis ni rnam par brtag par bya bar brjod do //
analyzed: de yang bdag nyid kyi snang ba ste 'dis ni rnam par brtag par bya bar brjod do //
translated: Moreover, it is the appearance of the self. This indicates the object of conceptualization.

original: de la don byed par rung bar sems shing ste /
analyzed: de la don byed par rung bar sems shing ste /
translated: With regard to that, one thinks that it is suitable to perform the function of the self.

original: 'dis ni mthong ba dang gcig tu byed par brjod do //
analyzed: 'dis ni mthong ba dang gcig tu byed par brjod do //
translated: This indicates the unification with seeing.

original: dngos su snang ba las rnam par brtag bar bya ba gzhan yin yang 'di la snang ba nyid du nges pa gang yin pa de nyid snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas pa yin gyi /
analyzed: dngos su snang ba las rnam par brtag bar bya ba gzhan yin yang 'di la snang ba nyid du nges pa gang yin pa de nyid snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas pa yin gyi /
translated: Although the object of conceptualization is different from the appearance that actually appears, the very ascertainment of that as an appearance is the unification of the appearance and the object of conceptualization.

original: de ltar rnam par brtag par bya ba mthong ba nyid du byas pas gcig tu byas par ni mi brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par brtag par bya ba mthong ba nyid du byas pas gcig tu byas par ni mi brjod do //
translated: However, it is not said that the unification is made by making the object of conceptualization into what is seen.

original: 'on kyang snang ba nyid du nges pas snang ba lta bur bsgrub pa la brjod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang snang ba nyid du nges pas snang ba lta bur bsgrub pa la brjod do //
translated: However, it is said that the appearance is established as if it were an appearance by the ascertainment of that as an appearance.

original: de'i de yang 'jug pa nyid las shes pas ni 'jug go zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i de yang 'jug pa nyid las shes pas ni 'jug go zhes brjod do //
translated: Moreover, it is said that the object of conceptualization is engaged by the consciousness that engages it.

original: 'di ltar don mi snang bzhin du yang don gyis bsgrub par bya'i dgos pa don du gnyer bar 'jug pa ni /
analyzed: 'di ltar don mi snang bzhin du yang don gyis bsgrub par bya'i dgos pa don du gnyer bar 'jug pa ni /
translated: Thus, even though the object does not appear, one engages in the pursuit of the goal that is to be accomplished by the object.üîΩ

original: don las bzlog pa de la don du lhag par zhen pa med par mi srid do //
analyzed: don las bzlog pa de la don du lhag par zhen pa med par mi srid do //
translated: Thus, even though the object does not appear, it is impossible for one to engage in the pursuit of the goal that is to be accomplished without superimposing the object on that which is not the object.üîΩBut how can this response be applied to the objection that external objects are of different aspects?

original: de lta na yang phyi rol rnam pa tha dad pa la zhes brtsad pa ji ltar spang bar 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir de dag gi zhes smos so //
analyzed: de lta na yang phyi rol rnam pa tha dad pa la zhes brtsad pa ji ltar spang bar 'gyur ba de bstan pa'i phyir de dag gi zhes smos so //
translated: To show this, he says, ‚Äúin regard to those . . . ‚Äù

original: tha snyad pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: tha snyad pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis de skad ces brjod do //
translated: This is said from the perspective of conventional thought.

original: ji skad brjod pa ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: ji skad brjod pa ston par byed pa ni /
translated: To show what is said, he says,

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba de byed pa nyid kyi de byed pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis te rgyur gyur pa gang dag de byed pa ma yin pa de dag las tha dad pa rnams te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba de byed pa nyid kyi de byed pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa'i rnam pa de nyid kyis te rgyur gyur pa gang dag de byed pa ma yin pa de dag las tha dad pa rnams te /
translated: ‚Äúin the same way . . . ‚Äù The same aspect that distinguishes the agent from that which is not the agent is the cause. Those that are distinguished from that which is not the agent are

original: de byed pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba de dag ston par byed do //
analyzed: de byed pa ma yin pa'i sgro 'dogs pa dang bral ba de dag ston par byed do //
translated: free from the superimposition of that which is not the agent.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te dngos su na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de byed pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa yin pa de lta na yang rtogs pa po de dag gis de nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te dngos su na rang gi mtshan nyid kho na de byed pa ma yin pa las tha dad pa yin pa de lta na yang rtogs pa po de dag gis de nyid rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is what is being said: although in reality the particular itself is not different from that which is not its effect, still, those who understand it conceive of it as the object of a conceptual cognition.

original: yongs su rtogs par byed pa rnams la yang tha snyad byed pa'i cha yod pas na de dag gi yongs su rtogs pa las langs te /
analyzed: yongs su rtogs par byed pa rnams la yang tha snyad byed pa'i cha yod pas na de dag gi yongs su rtogs pa las langs te /
translated: And since the things that are the bases of the expressions also exist, they arise from the conceptual cognitions.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid kyi don la 'jug pa'i phyir /
translated: And because they engage the objects that are the referents of the conceptual cognitions,

original: sgra rnams kyi don gyi yul can gyi tha snyad mi ldog go /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyi don gyi yul can gyi tha snyad mi ldog go /
translated: the expressions that have those as their referents do not cease.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa'i snang @226b ba don nyid dang / don yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa'i snang @226b ba don nyid dang / don yang rnam par rtog pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba'i spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the appearance of the conceptual cognition itself is the referent and the referent is the object of the conceptual cognition, it is tenable that it is the nature of the universal that is the exclusion of other.

original: dngos su ni snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag tha dad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: dngos su ni snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag tha dad pa kho na ste /
translated: In reality, the appearance and the object of conceptual cognition are different.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar snang ba nyid dmigs pa de ltar 'di gsal ba ma yin la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa yang mi rung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar snang ba nyid dmigs pa de ltar 'di gsal ba ma yin la gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa yang mi rung ngo //
translated: Thus, just as it appears, the object is not clearly evident, and it is not possible for there to be a common locus, etc.

original: de nyid ston par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de nyid ston par byed pa ni /
translated: He demonstrates just this:

original: de kho na nyid sems par byed pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na nyid sems par byed pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those who reflect on reality, etc.

original: des na de ltar lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas don gyi yul can nyid yin pa na /
analyzed: des na de ltar lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas don gyi yul can nyid yin pa na /
translated: Thus, in dependence upon such adherence, the object is the domain of the object.

original: spyi'i rang bzhin nyid kyang zhen pa las yin par nges par bya'o //
analyzed: spyi'i rang bzhin nyid kyang zhen pa las yin par nges par bya'o //
translated: One should ascertain that the nature of the universal is also due to adherence.

original: gang gi tshe zhen pa'i dbang gis don 'brel bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de la ltos nas blo'i snang ba spyi'i ngo bor 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhen pa'i dbang gis don 'brel bar 'gyur ba de'i tshe de la ltos nas blo'i snang ba spyi'i ngo bor 'thad pa yin no //
translated: When the object is related by virtue of adherence, then in dependence upon that, the appearance of cognition is tenable as the nature of the universal.

original: de nyid kyi phyir don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir don gyi ngo bo nyid kyis spyi zhes 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: For this very reason, the nature of the object itself is explained as the universal.

original: 'dir gal te zhes smras te /
analyzed: 'dir gal te zhes smras te /
translated: In this regard, if one says,

original: de kho na nyid bsam pa na ni rnam par rtog pa rang gi snang ba tsam gyi yul can du bshad do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid bsam pa na ni rnam par rtog pa rang gi snang ba tsam gyi yul can du bshad do //
translated: when one reflects on reality, conceptualization is explained as having an object that is merely one‚Äôs own appearance.

original: gal te lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas spyir brjod na ni /
analyzed: gal te lhag par zhen pa la ltos nas spyir brjod na ni /
translated: If you say that in general, it is in dependence on the adherence to the special,

original: des na rtogs pa po'i bsam pa'i rjes su yang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na rtogs pa po'i bsam pa'i rjes su yang byed pa yin no //
translated: then it also follows that it is in dependence on the thought of the cognizer.

original: khyod ni rtogs pa po'i rtogs pa la mi ltos pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: khyod ni rtogs pa po'i rtogs pa la mi ltos pa kho na yin no //
translated: But you do not depend on the cognition of the cognizer.

original: de dag kyang gal te de rtogs pa'i bsam pa'i rjes su yang 'jug na ni gzhan sel ba'i spyi yin par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang gal te de rtogs pa'i bsam pa'i rjes su yang 'jug na ni gzhan sel ba'i spyi yin par mi 'gyur te /
translated: And if those also were to follow the thought of the cognition of that, then they would not be universals that are the exclusion of other,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar rtogs pa ni med do //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar rtogs pa ni med do //
translated: because there is no such cognition.

original: don la log pa nyid du zhen pa ni med do //üîΩsgro 'dogs kyi dben pa la ni 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul khas blangs ba med par dgag pa tsam gyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba ma rtogs pa'i nyes pa spangs kyang rtogs pa'i bsam pa khas len pa
analyzed: don la log pa nyid du zhen pa ni med do // sgro 'dogs kyi dben pa la ni 'jug pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i tshul khas blangs ba med par dgag pa tsam gyi rang bzhin khas ma blangs pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba ma rtogs pa'i nyes pa spangs kyang rtogs pa'i bsam pa khas len pa
translated: There is no adherence to the object as being otherwise.üîΩIt is the engagement in the freedom from superimposition.üîΩSince one does not accept the mode of that and so on, one does not accept the nature of mere negation that is free from superimposition.

original: la ltos par thal ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: la ltos par thal ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, although the fault of not cognizing the exclusion of other is avoided, it follows that it is in dependence on the thought of the cognizer.

original: 'di bsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di bsal ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to dispel that,

original: de ltar mi rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes smos so//
analyzed: de ltar mi rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi zhes smos so//
translated: Thus, not only is it not understood, but also...

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin thams cad rtogs pas grub par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin thams cad rtogs pas grub par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: This is what is being said: The nature of that which is being understood is not established by understanding,

original: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du mi srid pa'i dbang gis 'di'i rigs rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin las phyi rol du gyur pas mi @227a * //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i rang bzhin gzhan du mi srid pa'i dbang gis 'di'i rigs rnam par gzhag pa gang yin pa de rtogs bzhin pa'i rang bzhin las phyi rol du gyur pas mi @227a * //
translated: because the category that is posited on the basis of the impossibility of another nature of that which is being understood is not possible as something external to the nature of that which is being understood.

original: srid par brjod pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: srid par brjod pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not said that it is impossible.

original: gal te de ltar gyur na ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can gyi phyogs la ji ltar log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir de spyi'i ngo bo ma yin par brjod pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: gal te de ltar gyur na ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can gyi phyogs la ji ltar log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir de spyi'i ngo bo ma yin par brjod pa de bzhin du /
translated: If that were the case, then just as it is said that the object of a cognition that has an object of exclusion of other is not a universal,

original: spyi khas len pa'i phyogs la yang tha dad pa la sogs par rtogs pa med do //
analyzed: spyi khas len pa'i phyogs la yang tha dad pa la sogs par rtogs pa med do //
translated: in the same way, in the position that accepts universals, there is no cognition of difference, etc.

original: des na gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin ltar de yang 'dod par mi bya'o //
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin ltar de yang 'dod par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, just as the nature of exclusion of other, it should not be accepted.

original: des na 'di ltar 'brel pa yin te /
analyzed: des na 'di ltar 'brel pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the connection is as follows.

original: gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin du mi rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ji srid du tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs par yang mi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin du mi rtogs pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi ji srid du tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa la sogs par yang mi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Not only is the nature of the exclusion of other not understood, but as long as there is no understanding of the nature of difference, non-difference, and so on,

original: des na gal te ma rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba mi 'gyur zhes zer na /
analyzed: des na gal te ma rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba mi 'gyur zhes zer na /
translated: if you say that the exclusion of other does not occur because it is not understood,

original: tha dad pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha dad pa la sogs pa'i ngo bor yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then difference and so on also would not occur.

original: de ltar mtshungs pa nyid bsgrubs nas lan 'debs pa ni blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can zhes smos te tha mi dad pa can du snang ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar mtshungs pa nyid bsgrubs nas lan 'debs pa ni blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can zhes smos te tha mi dad pa can du snang ba'o //
translated: Having thus established the similarity, the reply is: ‚ÄúThe cognition has an undifferentiated aspect,‚Äù that is, it appears undifferentiated.

original: de skye ba la gcig gis ni de'i yul tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid can dngos por yod pa'i spyi yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de skye ba la gcig gis ni de'i yul tha mi dad pa'i bdag nyid can dngos por yod pa'i spyi yin par brjod do //
translated: In its arising, one [aspect] is said to be the existent universal that has the nature of an undifferentiated object.

original: de ltar de yang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i rten du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: de ltar de yang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i rten du 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Thus, that [universal] is the very basis for the understanding of non-difference.

original: de'i rang bzhin tha mi dad par rtogs pa tsam gyis grub pa la brten nas de'i rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar brtags pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin tha mi dad par rtogs pa tsam gyis grub pa la brten nas de'i rang bzhin gzhan du mi 'thad pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa la sogs pa'i chos ji ltar brtags pa de bzhin du /
translated: and the nature of that is not different from that.

original: kho bo cag kyang rtogs pas grub pa tha mi dad pa tsam gyi rang bzhin la brten nas gzhan du mi srid pa'i dbang kho nas de snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin du brjod cing de bzhin du sgro 'dogs rnam par gcod par grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid
analyzed: kho bo cag kyang rtogs pas grub pa tha mi dad pa tsam gyi rang bzhin la brten nas gzhan du mi srid pa'i dbang kho nas de snang ba tsam gyi rang bzhin du brjod cing de bzhin du sgro 'dogs rnam par gcod par grub pa'i rang bzhin nyid
translated: We also, in the same way, on the basis of the nature of mere nondifference that is established by the cognition, because it is not possible for it to be different, say that it is the nature of mere appearance, and in the same way, we also eliminate misconceptions.

original: kyi gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: kyi gzhan sel ba'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: The nature that is established is the nature of the exclusion of other.

original: des na rgol ba gnyi ga yang rtogs pa la bye brag med do //
analyzed: des na rgol ba gnyi ga yang rtogs pa la bye brag med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no difference between the two parties in terms of cognition.

original: rtogs pas grub pa 'dis ma gtogs pa'i ngo bo khas blangs par grub pa bsgrubs pa bzhin du nged kyis kyang brtags so //
analyzed: rtogs pas grub pa 'dis ma gtogs pa'i ngo bo khas blangs par grub pa bsgrubs pa bzhin du nged kyis kyang brtags so //
translated: We also investigate the nature that is accepted by the opponent, which is not included in the nature that is established by the cognition, just as the opponent establishes the probandum.

original: 'on kyang nged kyis brtags pa'i tshul khas ma blangs par ni tha dad pa la sogs pas kyang spyi 'grub pa legs par bsgrub par mi 'gyur pa des ni de skad brjod par zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang nged kyis brtags pa'i tshul khas ma blangs par ni tha dad pa la sogs pas kyang spyi 'grub pa legs par bsgrub par mi 'gyur pa des ni de skad brjod par zad do //
translated: But since you do not accept the way I analyze this, I have said this much to you, who maintain that a universal is established by difference, etc.

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thams cad du rtogs pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni bsgrub pa ma yin gyi 'on kyang thams cad du rtogs pa nyid bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: A universal is not something to be established; rather, the very cognition of it in all cases is what is to be established.

original: des na 'di gal te rang grub par bya ba'i don du rtogs pa'i @227b rang bzhin grub pa 'phen na ni dngos po 'grub po //
analyzed: des na 'di gal te rang grub par bya ba'i don du rtogs pa'i @227b rang bzhin grub pa 'phen na ni dngos po 'grub po //
translated: Therefore, if it is the nature of a cognition that is established in order to establish itself that is projected, then an entity is established.

original: de ste grub pa de nyid rang 'gal na ni yul med pa'i rtogs pa tsam zhig grub pa la 'chel bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ste grub pa de nyid rang 'gal na ni yul med pa'i rtogs pa tsam zhig grub pa la 'chel bar bya ba yin te /
translated: But if that very establishment is self-contradictory, then it is only a mere cognition without an object that is clung to as established.

original: dngul la sogs pa shes pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dngul la sogs pa shes pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the cognition of silver, etc.

original: de'i phyir nged kyi gzhung kho na la mi rtogs pa de ltar grub pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrubs par 'grub pa'i phyir blo la snang ba'i spyi gzhan sel bar brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir nged kyi gzhung kho na la mi rtogs pa de ltar grub pa'i rang bzhin du bsgrubs par 'grub pa'i phyir blo la snang ba'i spyi gzhan sel bar brjod do //
translated: Therefore, only in our system is it established that a non-cognition is a nature that is established in that way, and so we speak of the exclusion of other as the universal that appears to the mind.

original: de nyid bshad pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa de ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That is what is being explained.

original: dngos po gzhan las log pa yin pa'i phyir de la gzhan sel ba yod do //
analyzed: dngos po gzhan las log pa yin pa'i phyir de la gzhan sel ba yod do //
translated: Since it is the opposite of other entities, it is the exclusion of other.

original: spyi'i yul can la 'gog par byed pa'i 'gal ba yod pa ltar gzhan sel ba'i yul can la ni med do //
analyzed: spyi'i yul can la 'gog par byed pa'i 'gal ba yod pa ltar gzhan sel ba'i yul can la ni med do //
translated: Just as there is an incompatibility in the case of a cognition that has a universal for its object, there is none in the case of a cognition that has an exclusion for its object.

original: sgra'i rten can gyi tha snyad kyang de ltar snang ba yin te /
analyzed: sgra'i rten can gyi tha snyad kyang de ltar snang ba yin te /
translated: The convention that has sound for its basis also appears in that way,

original: dngos po'i yul can du dmigs pa'i phyir dang de yang gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i yul can du dmigs pa'i phyir dang de yang gzhan sel ba'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is observed to have an entity for its object, and that is the nature of the exclusion of other.

original: de ltar bsam pa'i dbang gis na spyi yod pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bsam pa'i dbang gis na spyi yod pa yin no zhes bstan nas /
translated: Having thus demonstrated that a universal exists by the power of thought,

original: da ni dam pa'i don du med ces bya ba bshad pa'i phyir blo 'di zhes smos so //
analyzed: da ni dam pa'i don du med ces bya ba bshad pa'i phyir blo 'di zhes smos so //
translated: now, in order to explain that it does not exist in the highest sense, he says, ‚ÄúThis cognition. . . . ‚Äù

original: bsam pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa med pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo'i gzung ba gzhan sel bar brjod kyi /
analyzed: bsam pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa med pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo'i gzung ba gzhan sel bar brjod kyi /
translated: The exclusion of other is said to be the object of a cognition that has the form of nondifference by the power of thought.

original: spyi zhes bya ba ni med do //
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba ni med do //
translated: But there is no such thing as a universal.

original: ji ltar blo rnams tha mi dad pa can skye ba de'i rten zhes bya bas ni snang ba brjod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ji ltar blo rnams tha mi dad pa can skye ba de'i rten zhes bya bas ni snang ba brjod pa yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe basis of the arising of nondistinct cognitions‚Äù refers to the appearance of the object.

original: de de'i rten nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //üîΩda ni de'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de de'i rten nyid ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to // da ni de'i gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning of the phrase ‚Äúit is not the basis of that‚Äù is that the object is not the basis of the cognition.üîΩNow, in order to demonstrate the meaning of that, he says:

original: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes smos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way.‚ÄùüîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.

original: khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams ni rjes su mi 'gro zhing phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te /üîΩkhra bo ser skya ma yin la ser skya yang khra bo ma yin no //üîΩrjes su mi 'gro bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
analyzed: khra bo la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams ni rjes su mi 'gro zhing phan tshun rjes su 'jug pa ma yin te / khra bo ser skya ma yin la ser skya yang khra bo ma yin no // rjes su mi 'gro bar ji ltar rtogs she na /
translated: The manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.

original: gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro //üîΩspyi ni gsal ba yod na 'gyur te /
analyzed: gsal ba nyid kyi phyir ro // spyi ni gsal ba yod na 'gyur te /
translated: The manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.

original: de la brten pa'i phyir dang de yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su 'gro na ni khra bo la ser skya yod pa'i phyir khra bo gang yin pa de nyid ser skyar 'gyur ro ;
analyzed: de la brten pa'i phyir dang de yang phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrjes su 'gro na ni khra bo la ser skya yod pa'i phyir khra bo gang yin pa de nyid ser skyar 'gyur ro ;
translated: The manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not a particular because it is not the basis of nondistinct cognitions.üîΩThe manifestation of a multicolored object is not a universal because it does not pervade all cognitions and it is not

original: ; da ltar gsal ba rnams gcig pa yin na spyi nyid du gal 'gyur /
analyzed: ; da ltar gsal ba rnams gcig pa yin na spyi nyid du gal 'gyur /
translated: If the present manifestations are identical, then what is the universal?

original: mtshungs pa rnams kyi de ltar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni spyi yin na gcig tu gyur na ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir dngos po gang gi spyir 'gyur /üîΩde'i @228a * //
analyzed: mtshungs pa rnams kyi de ltar 'gyur ba'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa'i rang bzhin ni spyi yin na gcig tu gyur na ni mtshungs pa zhes bya ba cung zad kyang med pa'i phyir dngos po gang gi spyir 'gyur / de'i @228a * //
translated: If the nature which is the cause of being the same in the case of the similar is the universal, then when they become identical, there is not the slightest difference in what is called ‚Äúsimilar,‚Äù so what thing would be the universal?

original: phyir gsal ba nyid kyis gsal ba rnams rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir 'dir rigs pa gzhan ma bshad do //
analyzed: phyir gsal ba nyid kyis gsal ba rnams rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir 'dir rigs pa gzhan ma bshad do //
translated: Therefore, since the manifestations themselves do not pervade the manifestations, no other reasoning is explained here.

original: gsal ba rnams rjes su mi 'gro mod /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams rjes su mi 'gro mod /
translated: Granted that the manifestations do not pervade,

original: de dag la rjes su 'brel pa mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi spyi gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de dag la rjes su 'brel pa mtshungs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyi spyi gzhan yod par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: but there is another universal which is the cause of their similar pervasion.

original: med do zhes bshad pa ni rjes 'gro gzhan ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: med do zhes bshad pa ni rjes 'gro gzhan ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The response is that there is no other pervasion, as stated in the line ‚ÄúAnother pervasion is not tenable.‚Äù

original: gsal ba dag las 'brel to //
analyzed: gsal ba dag las 'brel to //
translated: It is related to the manifestations.

original: des na de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba can gsal ba gcig la yod pa gsal ba gzhan la yang gnas par ni snang ba med do //
analyzed: des na de lta bu'i rjes su 'gro ba can gsal ba gcig la yod pa gsal ba gzhan la yang gnas par ni snang ba med do //
translated: Therefore, the existence of a single manifestation with such a pervasion in another manifestation is not seen.

original: gsal ba la rjes su 'gro ba can tha dad pa ni 'ga' yang mngon sum la snang ba med de zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsal ba la rjes su 'gro ba can tha dad pa ni 'ga' yang mngon sum la snang ba med de zhes pa'i don to //
translated: There is no appearance of any difference in the direct perception of the manifestation.

original: 'dir ni mngon sum du mi snang bar sgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir ni mngon sum du mi snang bar sgrub pa yin te /
translated: Here, the non-appearance in direct perception is being proven.

original: ji ltar brtags pa ltar ni rnam par rtog pas kyang rtogs pa med pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar brtags pa ltar ni rnam par rtog pas kyang rtogs pa med pa ni 'og nas 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: As for the non-apprehension by conception in accordance with the way it is imagined, that will be explained later.

original: rjes su 'gro ba gzhan mngon sum gyis ma rtogs so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba gzhan mngon sum gyis ma rtogs so zhes bya ba ji ltar rtogs /
translated: How is it known that the other, the universal, is not apprehended by direct perception?

original: 'di ltar gsal ba tha dad pa dag la gsal ba de dang de mtshams sbyor bas stong pa'i rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba tha dad pa dag la gsal ba de dang de mtshams sbyor bas stong pa'i rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, there is the apprehension of a single aspect in different manifestations, which is empty of the connection with that manifestation.

original: khra bo ba lang yin la ser skya yang ba lang ngo zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: khra bo ba lang yin la ser skya yang ba lang ngo zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: For example, a multicolored cow is a cow, and a tawny cow is also a cow.

original: khra bo gang yin pa de nyid ser skya yin no zhes ni ma yin no //
analyzed: khra bo gang yin pa de nyid ser skya yin no zhes ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not that the multicolored one is the tawny one.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni yod pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa dang rjes su 'brel pa ni yod pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, there is a connection with difference.

original: tha mi dad na gsal ba mtshams sbyor bar thal ba'i phyir dang / mtshams sbyor ba med na yang rtogs pa gcig pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mi dad na gsal ba mtshams sbyor bar thal ba'i phyir dang / mtshams sbyor ba med na yang rtogs pa gcig pa mi 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are not different, then it follows that the manifestation would be connected to the object, and if there is no connection, then the single cognition is not established.

original: de ni rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du 'di'i ba lang nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid ces tha dad par 'dzin pa kho na'o //üîΩdes na / rjes 'gro gzhan ni snang ba med //
analyzed: de ni rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin du 'di'i ba lang nyid dam mi rtag pa nyid ces tha dad par 'dzin pa kho na'o // des na / rjes 'gro gzhan ni snang ba med //
translated: It is just as if one apprehends the cow‚Äôs cowness or impermanence in accordance with its own nature.

original: ces ji ltar brjod /
analyzed: ces ji ltar brjod /
translated: How can it be said that the other, the subsequent cognition, is without appearance?

original: mngon sum gyis snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di nyid mngon sum ma yin no zhes ga las rtogs /
analyzed: mngon sum gyis snang ba med pa'i phyir ro zhe na 'di nyid mngon sum ma yin no zhes ga las rtogs /
translated: Because it is not a direct perception. How do you know that it is not a direct perception?

original: mngon sum ma yin na ni long ba la yang ba lang ngo snyam du rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin na ni long ba la yang ba lang ngo snyam du rtogs pa yod par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not a direct perception, then even the blind would have the conception ‚ÄúThis is a cow.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no zhe na ma yin te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i phyir mngon sum ma yin no zhe na ma yin te 'gal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not a direct perception because it is conceptual. No, because there is no contradiction.

original: de med na ni rtog pa dang bral ba nyid mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na ni rtog pa dang bral ba nyid mngon sum gyi mtshan nyid du ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it does not exist, then the definition of direct perception is not established as being free from conceptual thought.

original: des na rjes su 'gro ba gzhan mi snang bar ma grub bo zhe na /
analyzed: des na rjes su 'gro ba gzhan mi snang bar ma grub bo zhe na /
translated: Therefore, since the other, namely, the subsequent cognition, does not appear, it is not established.

original: 'di la brjod @228b pa tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dag ni mngon sum gyi chos su ma grub pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rtog pa mngon sum dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin yang 'di mngon sum du snang ba nyid dam /
analyzed: 'di la brjod @228b pa tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba dag ni mngon sum gyi chos su ma grub pa'i phyir ro // tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i rtog pa mngon sum dang lhan cig 'byung ba yin yang 'di mngon sum du snang ba nyid dam /
translated: In this regard, the difference and the subsequent cognition are not established as the property of the direct perception.üîΩEven though the thought of difference and the subsequent cognition occur together with the direct perception, it is not direct perception because it is not like the appearance of direct perception.üîΩOr, because the two, the conceptual thought and the nonconceptual thought, operate simultaneously, it is conceptual.

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i yid gnyis cig car 'jug pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa nyid yin zhes rnam par dpyad pa na mngon sum gyi snang ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa mngon sum nyid yin pa bsal bas na 'di ni rnam par
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dang / rtog pa med pa'i yid gnyis cig car 'jug pa'i phyir na rnam par rtog pa nyid yin zhes rnam par dpyad pa na mngon sum gyi snang ba dang mi 'dra ba nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa mngon sum nyid yin pa bsal bas na 'di ni rnam par
translated: When it is analyzed in this way, since it is not like the appearance of direct perception, it is excluded from being direct perception.

original: rtog pa yin gyi nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rtog pa yin gyi nyams su myong ba ni ma yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said that this is conceptual but not an experience.

original: 'di ltar gang gis sngon po rig pa med kyang mig byed pa med pa sngon po mngon du byas par rtogs pa med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gis sngon po rig pa med kyang mig byed pa med pa sngon po mngon du byas par rtogs pa med la /
translated: Thus, even though there is no awareness of blue, there is no awareness of the eye as inactive, as not manifesting blue.

original: mig byed pa dang ldan pa la ni yod par 'gyur ba mngon sum dang / rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba gnyis kyi dbang po'i byed pa yod pa dang med pa dag gi rnam pa'i khyad par ni nye bar mtshon par gyur pa'i sngon po rtogs pa yod pa na gtan la phebs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: mig byed pa dang ldan pa la ni yod par 'gyur ba mngon sum dang / rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba gnyis kyi dbang po'i byed pa yod pa dang med pa dag gi rnam pa'i khyad par ni nye bar mtshon par gyur pa'i sngon po rtogs pa yod pa na gtan la phebs pa kho na'o //
translated: But when the eye is active, the difference in the mode of the activity of the sense faculty, in the two cases of the presence and absence of the manifestation of the object and the conceptualization, is ascertained only when there is the awareness of the blue that is being perceived.

original: de'i phyir dngos po snang ba'i nyams su myong ba yang gzhan du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po snang ba'i nyams su myong ba yang gzhan du gyur pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the experience of the manifestation of the object is one thing,

original: de mi snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang gzhan du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de mi snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa yang gzhan du gyur pa yin no //
translated: and the nonmanifestation of that is another, namely, the conceptualization.

original: de bzhin du tha dad pa snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang nyams su myong ba dag la rang bzhin tha dad par rtogs pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tha dad pa snang ba yang rnam par rtog pa dang nyams su myong ba dag la rang bzhin tha dad par rtogs pa kho na'o //
translated: In the same way, the manifestation of difference is only the awareness of the difference in the nature of the conceptualization and the experience.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ba lang gang yin pa ni /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ba lang gang yin pa ni /
translated: The cow that appears in the conceptualization

original: rang gi ngo bo bzhin du tha dad pa yang mi gsal ba yin te de ni rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo bzhin du tha dad pa yang mi gsal ba yin te de ni rang gi ngo bo las tha mi dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not clear, like its own nature, because it is not different from its own nature.üîΩIn the case of experience, it is clear, like its own nature, and what is to be imagined is clear, and what is to be perceived is clear.

original: nyams su myong ba la ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gsal ba kho na snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag las snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni thag ring pos bskalüîΩpa ma yin par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba la ni rang gi ngo bo bzhin du gsal ba kho na snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gsal ba dang mi gsal ba dag las snang ba tha dad pa zhes bya ba gang yin pa de ni thag ring pos bskal pa ma yin par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: The difference between what is clear and what is not clear is not a matter of remoteness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir thag ring po nas nyams su myong ba'i mi gsal ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dang mi mthun pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir thag ring po nas nyams su myong ba'i mi gsal ba nyid ni rnam par rtog pa'i snang ba dang mi mthun pa nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, the unclearness of what is experienced remotely is not incompatible with the clarity of the appearance of the imagination.

original: gang gis der ni mthong ba nyid rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gis der ni mthong ba nyid rtogs pa yin la /
translated: By that, one understands what is seen there,

original: rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: but not what is imagined.

original: des na 'dir sngon po rtogs pa na 'di ni sngon po nyid ces tha dad par rtogs pa'i sngon po nyid kyang gsal bar @229a * //
analyzed: des na 'dir sngon po rtogs pa na 'di ni sngon po nyid ces tha dad par rtogs pa'i sngon po nyid kyang gsal bar @229a * //
translated: Therefore, when blue is perceived here, the blue that is perceived as different, as in ‚ÄúThis is blue,‚Äù is clear.

original: snang ba ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not an appearance.

original: de nyid du tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de nyid du tha dad pa'i dngos po gzhan yin no //
translated: It is a different thing from that.

original: 'di dag gi tha dad pa ni mi gsal ba kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi tha dad pa ni mi gsal ba kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that their difference is not manifest,

original: dngos po ni mi gsal ba zhes bya bar mi srid do //
analyzed: dngos po ni mi gsal ba zhes bya bar mi srid do //
translated: it is not possible for a thing to be nonmanifest.

original: thag ring po nas mi gsal ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ni bstan zin to //
analyzed: thag ring po nas mi gsal ba nyid kyi rang bzhin ni bstan zin to //
translated: The nature of nonmanifestness has already been explained as being far away.

original: gsal ba'i dngos po la mi gsal pa'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yin /
analyzed: gsal ba'i dngos po la mi gsal pa'i tha dad pa zhes bya ba gang zhig yin /
translated: What is the difference of nonmanifestness from a manifest thing?

original: tha dad pa ni gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo mthar thug par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni gnyis kyi rang gi ngo bo mthar thug par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Difference is the final nature of a duality.

original: de'i phyir sngon po'i bdag nyid kho na la /
analyzed: de'i phyir sngon po'i bdag nyid kho na la /
translated: Therefore, in the nature of blue itself,

original: ser po la sogs pa 'ga' zhig las tha dad par rang bzhin gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: ser po la sogs pa 'ga' zhig las tha dad par rang bzhin gzhan dang ma 'dres pa'i rang gi ngo bo dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gsal ba yin te /
translated: there is nothing that is different from something else, such as yellow, which has a nature that is not mixed with any other.

original: des na tha dad par rtogs pa nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad par rtogs pa nyams su myong ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the experience of the difference is not a valid cognition.

original: rjes su 'gro ba yang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba yang nyams su myong ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Nor is there an experience of concomitance.

original: khra bo dang ser skya dag bdag nyid thams cad kyis rang gi bdag nyid dang rang gi yul las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid dang / yul dag na snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khra bo dang ser skya dag bdag nyid thams cad kyis rang gi bdag nyid dang rang gi yul las gzhan pa'i bdag nyid dang / yul dag na snang ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the variegated and the tawny are not seen in their entirety in their own nature and in a nature other than their own object.

original: gsal ba ni mi gsal ba'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba ni mi gsal ba'i rnam pas rjes su 'gro ba ma yin no //
translated: And the manifest is not followed by the unmanifest.

original: gal te rang gi bdag nyid dang rang gi yul las gzhan du snang ba yod pa yin la /üîΩkhra bo ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de la yod pa'i ba lang nyid do //
analyzed: gal te rang gi bdag nyid dang rang gi yul las gzhan du snang ba yod pa yin la / khra bo ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang de la yod pa'i ba lang nyid do //
translated: If it were to exist as seen in a nature other than its own nature and its own object,üîΩthen it would be the cowhood that exists in the variegated,

original: 'di ltar khra bo ba lang yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khra bo ba lang yin la /
translated: because the variegated is a cow.

original: ser skya ba lang nyid du snang ba yin te /
analyzed: ser skya ba lang nyid du snang ba yin te /
translated: And the tawny is seen as cowhood,

original: ba lang ma yin na ma he la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang ma yin na ma he la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du snang bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because if it were not a cow, it would follow that it would be seen as having the nature of a buffalo and so on.

original: de'i phyir gcig la yod pa gang yin pa de gzhan na yang yod pa'i phyir ji ltar rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ba med ce na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gcig la yod pa gang yin pa de gzhan na yang yod pa'i phyir ji ltar rang bzhin rjes su 'gro ba med ce na /
translated: Therefore, since what exists in one thing exists in another, how can there be no following of intrinsic nature?

original: 'di la brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di la brjod pa /
translated: To this we reply:

original: bden te / ma he la sogs pa dang mi 'dra pa'i rang bzhin du khra bo dang ser skya snang ba yin mod kyi khra bo la yod pa gang yin pa de nyid ser skya la yang yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bden te / ma he la sogs pa dang mi 'dra pa'i rang bzhin du khra bo dang ser skya snang ba yin mod kyi khra bo la yod pa gang yin pa de nyid ser skya la yang yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: for it appears to have a variegated or tawny nature. But what exists in the variegated does not exist in the tawny,

original: yul la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir des na ba lang ma yin na /
analyzed: yul la sogs pa tha dad pa'i phyir des na ba lang ma yin na /
translated: because the object, etc., are different. Therefore, if it is not a cow,

original: gnyi ga yang ba lang ma yin pa las ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang ba lang ma yin pa las ldog par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not possible to negate both that it is not a cow.

original: khra bo ba lang yin pa na /
analyzed: khra bo ba lang yin pa na /
translated: If the variegated is a cow,

original: ser skya yang ba lang nyid yin pa de lta na yang gcig la yod pa'i ba lang nyid gang yin pa des ni gzhan la yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ser skya yang ba lang nyid yin pa de lta na yang gcig la yod pa'i ba lang nyid gang yin pa des ni gzhan la yod pa ma yin te /
translated: then the tawny is also a cow. But the cowness that exists in one does not exist in the other,
