original: @229b lhan cig skye pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @229b lhan cig skye pa la sogs par thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that they are coexistent, etc.

original: de'i phyir khra bo la sogs ba lang gi gsal ba dag ni ba lang kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir khra bo la sogs ba lang gi gsal ba dag ni ba lang kho na ste /
translated: Therefore, the manifestations of the variegated, etc., are cows,

original: ba lang nyid ma yin na /
analyzed: ba lang nyid ma yin na /
translated: but not cowness.

original: ma he la sogs pa bzhin ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma he la sogs pa bzhin ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If they are not cows, it is not possible to negate that they are not cows, like a buffalo, etc.

original: 'on kyang gcig gi ba lang nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan la med pas na rjes su 'gro ba med kyang ba lang nyid du snang bar grub po //
analyzed: 'on kyang gcig gi ba lang nyid gang yin pa de ni gzhan la med pas na rjes su 'gro ba med kyang ba lang nyid du snang bar grub po //
translated: But since the cowness that belongs to one cow is not present in another, there is no concomitance. Still, the appearance of cowness is established.

original: 'grel pa ni gsal ba 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'grel pa ni gsal ba 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The commentary is the passage beginning ‚ÄúThese manifest things . . . .‚Äù

original: phan tshun rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su mi 'jug pa'i phyir tha dad par 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin to //
translated: It has already been explained that they are different because they do not mutually pervade each other.

original: rjes 'gro gzhan yang zhes bshad pa'i phyir de rnams la zhes smos so //
analyzed: rjes 'gro gzhan yang zhes bshad pa'i phyir de rnams la zhes smos so //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúamong them‚Äù is used because it is explained that there is another kind of concomitance.

original: gang la ltos nas gzhan yin pa de bstan pa ni /
analyzed: gang la ltos nas gzhan yin pa de bstan pa ni /
translated: The passage ‚ÄúIn dependence on what is different . . .‚Äù teaches what is different.

original: de rnams las zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de rnams las zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúamong them‚Äù means ‚Äúamong those things.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan du gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù means ‚Äúhaving a different object.‚Äù

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa nyid du'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case‚Äù means ‚Äúin the case of difference.‚Äù

original: de lta na yang tha dad pa ma mthong pas med par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang tha dad pa ma mthong pas med par brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even so, because difference is not seen, it is said to be nonexistent.

original: gang gi mthong ba la rtogs pa'i 'du byed yod pa de med par 'grub pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi mthong ba la rtogs pa'i 'du byed yod pa de med par 'grub pa yin te /
translated: That which is established as nonexistent is that which is perceived by conceptual mental activity.

original: bum pa la sogs pa lta bu mthong ba ni dmigs pa ga la brtan par gyur pa de la rnam par 'jig pa'i yan lag yin na /
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa lta bu mthong ba ni dmigs pa ga la brtan par gyur pa de la rnam par 'jig pa'i yan lag yin na /
translated: The object of seeing, such as a pot, is not stable, but is a part of destruction.

original: de ltar bltar mi rung ba'i spyi ni nges par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar bltar mi rung ba'i spyi ni nges par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, a universal that cannot be seen cannot be ascertained.

original: rnam par rtog pa nyid nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa nyid nges pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because conceptual thought itself has the nature of ascertainment.

original: brjod pa snang ba rang gi ngang gis ji ltar mi rtogs pa de ltar rtogs pa ma yin yang 'di ni 'di ltar yin no zhes nges par brtag par nus pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa snang ba rang gi ngang gis ji ltar mi rtogs pa de ltar rtogs pa ma yin yang 'di ni 'di ltar yin no zhes nges par brtag par nus pa yin no //
translated: We reply: Just as an appearance is not cognized in the way that it is, it is cognized in that way. It can be ascertained that ‚Äúthis is like this.‚Äù

original: dper na rnam par rtog pa'i myong bar bya ba'i rang bzhin snang ba nyid du rtogs pa yin yang myong bar bya ba'i rang bzhin du nges par brtag par nus pas yongs su rtogs par byed pas snang ba dang mi mthun par 'jog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par rtog pa'i myong bar bya ba'i rang bzhin snang ba nyid du rtogs pa yin yang myong bar bya ba'i rang bzhin du nges par brtag par nus pas yongs su rtogs par byed pas snang ba dang mi mthun par 'jog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, although the nature of the object of conceptual thought is cognized as an appearance, it can be ascertained as having the nature of an object of experience. Thus, it is posited as not being in accord with appearance.

original: de bzhin du ba lang la sogs pa snang ba yang gal te tha mi dad pa'i rnam par snang ba rtogs pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba de lta na yang nges par brtag par nus pa tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bos stong pa nyidüîΩrnam par 'jog pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ba lang la sogs pa snang ba yang gal te tha mi dad pa'i rnam par snang ba rtogs pa'i mthar thug par 'gyur ba de lta na yang nges par brtag par nus pa tha dad pa dang rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bos stong pa nyid rnam par 'jog pa yin no //
translated: Likewise, even if the appearance of a cow, etc. were to be the final realization of the appearance of something non-different, still, it is possible to analyze it, and it is established as empty of the nature of a separate, unitary entity.

original: de ltar rnam par gnas pa yang mngon sum gyi snang ba la brten nas rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba'i @230a * //
analyzed: de ltar rnam par gnas pa yang mngon sum gyi snang ba la brten nas rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba'i @230a * //
translated: Thus, even though it is established in that way, it is established on the basis of the appearance of direct perception.

original: phyir na / 'dir mngon sum nyid tshad mar byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: phyir na / 'dir mngon sum nyid tshad mar byas par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this case, direct perception itself is taken to be valid cognition.

original: de bzhin du snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag snang ba tha dad pa yang mngon sum nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du snang ba dang rnam par brtag pa dag snang ba tha dad pa yang mngon sum nyid kyis rnam par gzhag par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, even though the appearance and the conceptualization are different appearances, they are established by direct perception itself.

original: gang du rang gi ngang gis 'du byed pa can gyi mngon sum der yang de lta bu'i yul snang ba tsam las 'di'i byed pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: gang du rang gi ngang gis 'du byed pa can gyi mngon sum der yang de lta bu'i yul snang ba tsam las 'di'i byed pa gzhan ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: And in the case of direct perception that naturally engages its object, there is no other function of that perception than the mere appearance of such an object.

original: 'on kyang de ltar na yang ji ltar de'i rang bzhin shes par nus pa de ltar 'du byed pa rab tu chags pa 'bad pa la mi ltos pa tsam du zad do //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ltar na yang ji ltar de'i rang bzhin shes par nus pa de ltar 'du byed pa rab tu chags pa 'bad pa la mi ltos pa tsam du zad do //
translated: However, in that case, it is only that the one who is able to know its nature does not depend on the effort of the one who is fully engaged.üîΩJust as it is not possible to know the nature of the one who is fully engaged, in the same way, it is possible to know the nature of the one who is not fully engaged.

original: ji ltar nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'du byed pa med pa de ltar nges par brtag par nus pa la ni de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rtogs pa de nyid las yin te /üîΩji skad bshad pa bzhin no //üîΩji ltar nges par brtag par mi nus par de ltar rtogs pa ni /
analyzed: ji ltar nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir 'du byed pa med pa de ltar nges par brtag par nus pa la ni de sngon du 'gro ba can gyi rtogs pa de nyid las yin te / ji skad bshad pa bzhin no // ji ltar nges par brtag par mi nus par de ltar rtogs pa ni /
translated: This is because the one who is not fully engaged is the one who is able to know the nature of the one who is fully engaged, as has been explained.

original: de'i rtsa ba can ma yin pa kho na ste /
analyzed: de'i rtsa ba can ma yin pa kho na ste /
translated: Just as it is not possible to know the nature of the one who is not fully engaged, in the same way, it is possible to know the nature of the one who is fully engaged.üîΩThis is because the one who is fully engaged is the one who is able to know the nature of the one who is not fully engaged, as has been explained.

original: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin ni snang ba ma yin la /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rang bzhin ni snang ba ma yin la /
translated: The nature of the momentary is not apparent.

original: snang ba nyid las nges par brtag par nus pa ma yin pa'i snang ba la brten nas rnam par gnas pa ma yin pas rtags nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba nyid las nges par brtag par nus pa ma yin pa'i snang ba la brten nas rnam par gnas pa ma yin pas rtags nyid kyi rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: And it is not possible to know the nature of the momentary through what is apparent. Therefore, the establishment of the sign is based on what is apparent, not on what is real.

original: de'i phyir med pa la sogs pa ni yongs su rtogs par byed pa rnams kyi mngon sum yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i phyir med pa la sogs pa ni yongs su rtogs par byed pa rnams kyi mngon sum yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, non-existence, etc. are perceived by those who understand them,

original: tha snyad pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no //üîΩgang las 'di mi snang yang med par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni mi snang bar khas blangs par nus pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: tha snyad pa rnams kyi ni ma yin no // gang las 'di mi snang yang med par mi 'gyur ba 'di ni mi snang bar khas blangs par nus pa ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: but not by those who do not understand them.üîΩIt is not possible to accept that something is not perceived, but still exists,

original: mi snang na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi snang na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: as was explained in the statement, ‚ÄúIf it is not perceived, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di la ji ltar rang gis skye ba'i rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa bzhin du /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar rang gis skye ba'i rnam par shes pa la mig la sogs pa bzhin du /
translated: In this regard, just as the eye, etc. are causes of the arising of consciousness,

original: de lta bur gyur pa nyid khyad par kho nar rtogs pa'am /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa nyid khyad par kho nar rtogs pa'am /
translated: in the same way, the universal is the cause of the perception of the particular.

original: rjes su dpag pa yang der 'gyur ba gang yin pa spyi tha dad pa yang don dang 'brel pa tsam gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa yang der 'gyur ba gang yin pa spyi tha dad pa yang don dang 'brel pa tsam gyi rang bzhin ni ma yin no //
translated: But the universal is not the nature of the mere connection with the object, because it is a different entity from the particular.

original: des na rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang rang gi rten tha mi dad par gsal ba yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin tha dad pa yin yang rang gi rten tha mi dad par gsal ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the universal is a different entity, it manifests as if it were not different from its basis.

original: 'di ba lang zhes gzhi mthun par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ba lang zhes gzhi mthun par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the universal and the particular are perceived as a common basis, as in ‚Äúthis is a cow.‚Äù

original: des na gsal ba gzhan la yang rang bzhin de nyid rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir der yang de kho na bzhin rtogs pas na tha mi dad par rtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: des na gsal ba gzhan la yang rang bzhin de nyid rtogs pa yin pa'i phyir der yang de kho na bzhin rtogs pas na tha mi dad par rtogs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the intrinsic reality of the other, the manifest, is also realized, it is realized just as it is. Thus, it is realized as not being different.

original: des na 'di ni de ltar bdag nyid du gzhan 'dzin pa'am tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di ni de ltar bdag nyid du gzhan 'dzin pa'am tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this is how one apprehends or imputes the nature of the other.

original: @230b rnam pa de lta bu ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: @230b rnam pa de lta bu ni mi snang bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: That kind of appearance does not disappear.

original: des na snang ba nyid du 'gyur pa las de med pa'i phyir med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: des na snang ba nyid du 'gyur pa las de med pa'i phyir med pa kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, since it is just an appearance, it is not nonexistent because it does not exist.

original: spyi khas blangs kyang dngos po rnams rigs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa las ldog pa brjod pa yin pas nyes pa de'i stobs kyis kyang spyi dngos por gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: spyi khas blangs kyang dngos po rnams rigs mthun pa dang / mi mthun pa las ldog pa brjod pa yin pas nyes pa de'i stobs kyis kyang spyi dngos por gyur pa yod pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa ni /

analyzed: de dag dang 'brel ba zhes bya ba yin no //

original: gal te gcig po de dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'di dang mtshungs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de dag dang 'brel pa gcig yod pa yin pa'i phyir spyir 'gyur pa zhig na /
analyzed: gal te gcig po de dang 'brel ba'i phyir 'di dang mtshungs par 'gyur na ni de'i tshe de dag dang 'brel pa gcig yod pa yin pa'i phyir spyir 'gyur pa zhig na /
translated: If it were similar to that, because of being related to that one, then at that time, because of the existence of a single relation with those, it would be a universal.

original: de ltar yang ma yin pas spyi'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang ma yin pas spyi'i ngo bo ma yin te /

analyzed: grangs la sogs pa la yang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: 'di bzlog pa'i phyir pha rol po dag / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas grangs la sogs pa dag las spyi khyad par du brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that a universal is a single relation with many things, then number and so on would also be universals.‚Äù

analyzed: gang du tha mi dad pa'i brjod pa dang / blo'i rgyu yin pa mi brjod pa des na /
translated: In response to that, the Autocommentary states:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is said that a universal is a single relation with many things, then number and so on would also be universals.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, the Autocommentary states:

original: de dag dang 'brel ba gcig yod pa zhes bya ba der de dang zhes brjod pa dang / de dag la zhes rnam par 'byed pa bsgyur te 'brel to //
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel ba gcig yod pa zhes bya ba der de dang zhes brjod pa dang / de dag la zhes rnam par 'byed pa bsgyur te 'brel to //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that a universal is a single relation with many things, then number and so on would also be universals.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, the Autocommentary states:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is said that a universal is a single relation with many things, then number and so on would also be universals.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, the Autocommentary states:üîΩ‚ÄúIf it is said that a universal is a single relation with many things, then number and so on would also be universals.‚ÄùüîΩIn response to that, the Autocommentary states:

original: de dag dang 'brel pa gcig spyi'i rang bzhin du brjod pa na /
analyzed: de dag dang 'brel pa gcig spyi'i rang bzhin du brjod pa na /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that a universal is a single relation with many things, then number and so on would also be universals.‚Äù

original: de nyid du brjod pa dang rtogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid du brjod pa dang rtogs pa 'jug pa'i rgyu mtshan du rigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the reason for the engagement of expression and understanding.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar gzhan gyi sgo nas gzhan la zhes bya ba'i lan yang rung ba yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar gzhan gyi sgo nas gzhan la zhes bya ba'i lan yang rung ba yin te /
translated: For this very reason, the response, ‚ÄúHow can one thing be the object of the engagement of two different consciousnesses?‚Äù is also appropriate.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: Otherwise,

original: 'di ma brtsad bzhin du brgal zhing brtag par ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: 'di ma brtsad bzhin du brgal zhing brtag par ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: how could this be a response to the question, ‚ÄúHow can one thing be the object of the engagement of two different consciousnesses?‚ÄùüîΩThe reason for the engagement of expression and understanding is the same for those specific characteristics.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de dag la shes brjod tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig po gang yin pa de ni spyi yin no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de dag la shes brjod tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig po gang yin pa de ni spyi yin no //
translated: That is the universal.

original: grangs la sogs pa de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa de lta ma yin te /
translated: Number, etc., are not like that.

original: gnyis nyid kyi grangs brten pa yin yang rigs mi mthun pa dag la tha mi dad pa'i brjod pa dang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyis nyid kyi grangs brten pa yin yang rigs mi mthun pa dag la tha mi dad pa'i brjod pa dang rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though the number two is based on two, there is no undifferentiated expression and understanding of different types.

original: 'di la ji ltar zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar zhes gsungs te /
translated: Here, how is it?

original: dngos po tha dad pa gzhan gyi sgo nas don gzhan la shes pa 'jug pa ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa gzhan gyi sgo nas don gzhan la shes pa 'jug pa ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: How can the engagement of consciousness in one thing be through another different thing?

original: de skad dris pa na gzhan dag gal te log na gnas pa'i spyi'i ngo bo las mig las gzugs shes pa ltar de dag la de ltar rtogs pa skyed na ni /üîΩde'i tshe de dag la rnam pa de lta bu'i rang @231a * //
analyzed: de skad dris pa na gzhan dag gal te log na gnas pa'i spyi'i ngo bo las mig las gzugs shes pa ltar de dag la de ltar rtogs pa skyed na ni / de'i tshe de dag la rnam pa de lta bu'i rang @231a * //
translated: If, when asked in this way, others generate the realization that, like the consciousness of form from the eye, the consciousness of form is from the eye, then

original: bzhin med pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: bzhin med pa'i phyir na /
translated: at that time, because they do not have a nature that is that kind of aspect,

original: dmigs pa med pas 'khrul par thal te rang gi nye bar len pa'am gzhan las kyang rung te /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pas 'khrul par thal te rang gi nye bar len pa'am gzhan las kyang rung te /
translated: they are without an object. It follows that they are mistaken, whether it is from their own appropriation or from another.

original: rnam pa de lta bur rtogs pa khyad par ci yod snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: rnam pa de lta bur rtogs pa khyad par ci yod snyam du bsams nas /
translated: What is the difference between the realization that is that kind of aspect?

original: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
analyzed: de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes smos so //
translated: Thinking in this way, he says, ‚ÄúBecause they are related to it.‚Äù

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gang gi tshe tha mi dad pa'i dngos po 'di tha dad pa de dag la gnas pa de'i tshe bdag la dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i shes pa de dag la 'jug par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tha mi dad pa'i dngos po 'di tha dad pa de dag la gnas pa de'i tshe bdag la dmigs pa tha mi dad pa'i shes pa de dag la 'jug par byed pa yin te /
translated: When this undifferentiated thing is in those differentiated things, at that time it causes the engagement of those consciousnesses that are undifferentiated and observe the self.

original: de dag de dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i phyir de dag la tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin la de la dmigs pa'i rtogs pas de dag kyang rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'ga' yang med ngo zhes bya ba yin no
analyzed: de dag de dang tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i phyir de dag la tha mi dad par rtogs pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba yin la de la dmigs pa'i rtogs pas de dag kyang rtogs pa yin pa de'i tshe 'gal ba 'ga' yang med ngo zhes bya ba yin no
translated: Because they are realized to be non-different from that, they become the cause of the realization of non-difference. When they are realized by the realization that observes that, then there is no contradiction at all.

original: // de lta na 'o na grangs la sogs pa yang rang bzhin de nyid du thal lo zhes bshad pa ni /
analyzed: // de lta na 'o na grangs la sogs pa yang rang bzhin de nyid du thal lo zhes bshad pa ni /
translated: If that is so, then it follows that number and so on are also of that nature.

original: grangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This is explained in the line ‚ÄúNumber and so on,‚Äù and so forth.

original: de la bsam pa ma rtogs par sngar brjod pa'i bsam pas rtsod pa ni /
analyzed: de la bsam pa ma rtogs par sngar brjod pa'i bsam pas rtsod pa ni /
translated: Without understanding the intention, the opponent argues as stated above.

original: gal te spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause they are not of the nature of the universal.‚Äù

original: ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'di dag ni tha mi dad pa'i rjod pa dang rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pas na grangs la sogs pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa bzhin du 'di dag ni tha mi dad pa'i rjod pa dang rtogs pa'i rgyu ma yin pas na grangs la sogs pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: As explained, since these are not the cause of non-different expressions and realizations, number and so on are not of that nature.

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bsam pa gang gis brjod pa de gsal bar byed pa'i sgo nas de bzlog pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid 'di gang yin zhes dpyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa de bsam pa gang gis brjod pa de gsal bar byed pa'i sgo nas de bzlog pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid 'di gang yin zhes dpyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù and so forth, by what intention is this said?  This is clarified.  Is it not an analysis of ‚Äúwhat is the nature of the universal?‚Äù

original: shes pa dang brjod pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig ni spyi yin no zhes spyi'i lus brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa dang tha mi dad pa'i rgyu mtshan gcig ni spyi yin no zhes spyi'i lus brjod pa yin te /
translated: The body of the universal is stated as follows: ‚ÄúThe single reason that is not different from cognition and expression is the universal.‚Äù

original: spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa grangs la sogs pa thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa grangs la sogs pa thal bar mi 'gyur ro zhes gang brjod pa yin no //
translated: What is stated is that the universal is not a number and so on, because it is not subject to overextension.

original: de spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji ltar zhes dpyod ba yin no //
analyzed: de spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin gyi gzhan du 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ji ltar zhes dpyod ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúHow is it that it is not the nature of the universal, but is something else?‚Äù This is the analysis.

original: dpyod pa de la skabs su bab pa'i spyi dang 'brel pa yod na /
analyzed: dpyod pa de la skabs su bab pa'i spyi dang 'brel pa yod na /
translated: If that analysis is related to the universal that is the present topic,

original: 'brel pa can gzhan la shes pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'brel pa can gzhan la shes pa 'jug ste /
translated: then cognition engages the other relata.

original: des na spyi yin no zhes spyi'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi yin no zhes spyi'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is the universal, because it is the nature of the universal.

original: de lta na yang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta na yang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod pa yin no //
translated: Even so, it is said that it is because of the relation.

original: spyi'i bdag nyid de lta bu yin pa de la bshad pa /
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid de lta bu yin pa de la bshad pa /
translated: The explanation of that general nature is as follows.

original: du ma dang 'brel pa can dag las @231b kyang ste /
analyzed: du ma dang 'brel pa can dag las @231b kyang ste /
translated: It is also related to many.

original: rdzas ni yan lag du ma dang 'brel pa gcig de dag la yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rdzas ni yan lag du ma dang 'brel pa gcig de dag la yod pa yin la /
translated: A substance is one that is related to many parts.

original: grangs kyang grangs dang ldan pa la /
analyzed: grangs kyang grangs dang ldan pa la /
translated: And number is that which is possessed by those that possess number.

original: bya ba byed pa po rnams la yin pas gcig du ma las yod pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rgyu nyid yod pas na /
analyzed: bya ba byed pa po rnams la yin pas gcig du ma las yod pa'i mtshan nyid rtogs pa tha mi dad pa'i rgyu nyid yod pas na /
translated: Since the characteristic of existence is understood to be the cause of non-difference in the case of actions and agents,

original: de dag las du ma la shes pa 'jug ste /
analyzed: de dag las du ma la shes pa 'jug ste /
translated: consciousness engages with many.

original: gtan tshigs de'i phyir du ma dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas la sogs pa rnams spyi'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gtan tshigs de'i phyir du ma dang 'brel pa can gyi rdzas la sogs pa rnams spyi'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: For that reason, substances and so on that are related to many are the general nature.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: rang gi nye bar bsgyur ba'i sgo nas shes pa skyed pa na /
analyzed: rang gi nye bar bsgyur ba'i sgo nas shes pa skyed pa na /
translated: When a substance generates consciousness through its own transformation,

original: shas pa 'khrul pa med pa'i rgyu nyid dang / spyi nyid du yang 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: shas pa 'khrul pa med pa'i rgyu nyid dang / spyi nyid du yang 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: it is the cause of non-erroneous consciousness and is also a universal.

original: de dang 'brel pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel pas byas pa yin te /
translated: It is produced by being related to that.

original: de lta ma yin na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na /
translated: If it were not so,

original: gcig po gang yin pa de nyid gcig nyid du rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir na gsal ba rnams la gcig tu shes pa'i rten du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig po gang yin pa de nyid gcig nyid du rtogs par 'gyur pa'i phyir na gsal ba rnams la gcig tu shes pa'i rten du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because that which is one is realized to be one, it does not serve as the basis for the cognition of the manifestations as one.

original: des na de dag la 'bral pas na de dag nyid du 'dzin par byed pa yin pas spyi nyid yin par rnam par gnas pa na grangs la sogs pa dang khyad par ci yod /
analyzed: des na de dag la 'bral pas na de dag nyid du 'dzin par byed pa yin pas spyi nyid yin par rnam par gnas pa na grangs la sogs pa dang khyad par ci yod /
translated: Therefore, since they are apprehended as those very manifestations, when they are established as universals, what is the difference between them and number and so on?

original: 'di ltar de dag kyang bdag nyid gcig du ma la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag kyang bdag nyid gcig du ma la gnas pa yin no //
translated: In that case, they too would be related to one and many.

original: des na rdzas dang grangs dang las kyang gcig du ma dang 'brel pa yin pas na /
analyzed: des na rdzas dang grangs dang las kyang gcig du ma dang 'brel pa yin pas na /
translated: Therefore, substance, number, and action are also related to one and many.

original: ji ltar rang gi nya bar bsgyur bas gsal ba 'dzin par byed pa ma yin /
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi nya bar bsgyur bas gsal ba 'dzin par byed pa ma yin /
translated: So how is it that, by changing to their own form, they do not apprehend the manifestations?

original: gal te spyi ba lang nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir des ba lang ngo zhes gsal ba 'dzin par byed par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te spyi ba lang nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir des ba lang ngo zhes gsal ba 'dzin par byed par 'gyur na /
translated: If, because the nature of the universal cow is a cow, it apprehends the manifestation as a cow,

original: grangs kyang gnyis nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir re re la yang gnyis gnyis so zhes rtogs pa skyed par byed par 'gyur la /
analyzed: grangs kyang gnyis nyid kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir re re la yang gnyis gnyis so zhes rtogs pa skyed par byed par 'gyur la /
translated: Also, since the number two has the nature of two, the thought that each of them is two would arise.

original: de bzhin yang lag can yang yan lag rnams su las yan lag so so la yan lag can no snyam pa dang bya ba yang shing la sogs pa la tshos pa tshos pa snyam pa'i rtogs pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin yang lag can yang yan lag rnams su las yan lag so so la yan lag can no snyam pa dang bya ba yang shing la sogs pa la tshos pa tshos pa snyam pa'i rtogs pa skyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Likewise, the thought that the possessor of parts is in the parts would arise, and the thought that the action is in the wood and so on would arise.

original: 'on te yang rtogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa 'di ni spyi kho na'i yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te yang rtogs pa skyed pa'i nus pa 'di ni spyi kho na'i yin gyi /
translated: But if you think that the capacity to generate such thoughts belongs to universals alone,

original: grangs la sogs pa la ni yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa la ni yod pa ma yin no snyam na /
translated: and that it does not belong to number and so on,

original: de ni ma 'brel te /
analyzed: de ni ma 'brel te /
translated: that is not so,

original: de ltar brtags pa la de lta bu' rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir gcig du ma dang 'brel pa la de ltar rtogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ltar brtags pa la de lta bu' rtogs pa mthong ba'i phyir gcig du ma dang 'brel pa la de ltar rtogs pa 'jug pa'i phyir la /
translated: because when one examines in that way, one sees that such thoughts arise in that way, and because such thoughts engage in relation to one and many.

original: de yang de ltar ma nges par @232a * //
analyzed: de yang de ltar ma nges par @232a * //
translated: And that is not ascertained in that way.

original: byas pa yin te /
analyzed: byas pa yin te /
translated: It is done in that way.

original: gal te gcig du ma dang 'brel pa 'dir rang la brten pa'i shes pa nye bar sdud na grangs la sogs pas kyang sdud par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gcig du ma dang 'brel pa 'dir rang la brten pa'i shes pa nye bar sdud na grangs la sogs pas kyang sdud par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the relationship of one to many were to be included in the cognition that is based on it, then number and so on would also be included.

original: gal te 'brel kyang de tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir de de la brten pa'i shes pa yul gzhan la thob par byed pa ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel kyang de tsam gyi mthar thug pa'i phyir de de la brten pa'i shes pa yul gzhan la thob par byed pa ma yin na /
translated: If, although related, it is not the case that the cognition based on it obtains another object because it is limited to just that much,

original: spyi yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: spyi yang de kho na bzhin du 'gyur ro //
translated: then the universal would be just the same.

original: 'di ltar gal te nus pa la yang rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te nus pa la yang rnam pa de lta bu'i shes pa dmigs pa dang bcas pa nyid yin na /
translated: In this way, if the capacity also has the same kind of cognition that has an object,

original: 'o na 'di dmigs pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o na 'di dmigs pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i phyir grangs la sogs pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: then it would also be number and so on, because it is the nature of an object.

original: sngon po gcig la sngon po'o snyam du shes pa nus pa de la brten par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes par 'gyur ba gzhan dag la yang mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po gcig la sngon po'o snyam du shes pa nus pa de la brten par 'gyur ba'i phyir shes par 'gyur ba gzhan dag la yang mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not the case that the cognition of one blue as ‚Äúblue‚Äù would not also occur in other cognitions, because the capacity is based on that.

original: 'on te 'di dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / ma 'khrul ba ma yin na nus pa la yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te 'di dmigs pa dang bcas pa dang / ma 'khrul ba ma yin na nus pa la yang 'gyur ro //
translated: But if it is not associated with an object and is not non-erroneous, then it is a potentiality.

original: de bshad pa ni de ltar na ni zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bshad pa ni de ltar na ni zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The explanation of that is ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: de ltar ngo bo 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo 'chol ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is a confused entity.

original: gal te gnyis kho na la gnyis su 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te gnyis kho na la gnyis su 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: If it is a duality only in the case of two things,

original: gcig la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnyi ga la gnyis gnyis zhes rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: gcig la ni ma yin pa'i phyir ji ltar gnyi ga la gnyis gnyis zhes rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: and not in the case of one thing, how can one understand the statement ‚Äúa duality in both‚Äù?

original: des na ji ltar shes pa tha mi dad pa'i yul nyid yin /
analyzed: des na ji ltar shes pa tha mi dad pa'i yul nyid yin /
translated: Thus, how can it be the object of a non-different cognition?

original: de bzhin du rdzas kyang yan lag rnams la yan lag re re la yan lag tu 'dzin pa 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin te spyi bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du rdzas kyang yan lag rnams la yan lag re re la yan lag tu 'dzin pa 'jug pa'i rgyu ma yin te spyi bzhin no //
translated: In the same way, a substance is not the cause of the application of the cognition of a part in each part, as in the case of a universal.

original: brjod pa gnyis nyid la gnas pa na /
analyzed: brjod pa gnyis nyid la gnas pa na /
translated: If it is said that it exists in the duality itself,

original: gal te re re la gnas pa ma yin na ni 'ga' la yang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te re re la gnas pa ma yin na ni 'ga' la yang gnas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if it does not exist in each, it will not exist in any.

original: 'on te gnas na ji ltar re re la de ltar mi rtogs 'di ltar gal te gnyis re ri la yongs su rdzogs par ni mi gnas pa de ltar ni yang gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: 'on te gnas na ji ltar re re la de ltar mi rtogs 'di ltar gal te gnyis re ri la yongs su rdzogs par ni mi gnas pa de ltar ni yang gnas pa yin pa'i phyir de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ro /
translated: If it does not abide in each part, then it would be realized in that way, because it would abide in that way.

original: cha med pa ni du ma la gnas pa na /
analyzed: cha med pa ni du ma la gnas pa na /
translated: If a partless thing abides in many things,

original: re re la yongs su ma rdzogs par mi 'gyur te cha dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: re re la yongs su ma rdzogs par mi 'gyur te cha dang bcas pa nyid du thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then it would not be incomplete in each one, because it would follow that it would have parts.

original: des na de ltar de ni dam pa'i don du med //
analyzed: des na de ltar de ni dam pa'i don du med //
translated: Therefore, it is established that it does not exist in the ultimate sense.

original: ces bya ba bsgrubs pa na //üîΩgang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: ces bya ba bsgrubs pa na // gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúBy what is it known?‚ÄùüîΩIt is explained that the appearance of cognition is the universal,üîΩon the basis of the refutation of a different universal by such statements as

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi tha dad pa bkag pa'i sgo nas blo'i snang ba spyi'i ngo bor bshad pa la brten nas /üîΩde ni dam pa'i don du med //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas spyi tha dad pa bkag pa'i sgo nas blo'i snang ba spyi'i ngo bor bshad pa la brten nas / de ni dam pa'i don du med //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its own nature.‚Äù

original: ces bya ba bzlog pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ces bya ba bzlog pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to reverse the statement,üîΩ‚ÄúIt does not exist in the ultimate sense,‚Äù

original: gzhan dag de lta @232b 'o na zhes smra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag de lta @232b 'o na zhes smra'o //
translated: others say, ‚ÄúIn that case, it is not tenable that it exists conventionally.‚Äù

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis /
translated: In the way that has been explained,

original: phyi rol gyi spyi med kyang /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi spyi med kyang /
translated: although there is no external universal,

original: blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis spyi khas blangs pas /
analyzed: blo'i bsam pa'i dbang gis spyi khas blangs pas /
translated: The universal is accepted as a mental object.

original: blo'i snang ba kho na spyi yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba kho na spyi yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the universal is only the appearance in cognition.

original: 'di ltar blo'i bsam pas spyir bstan pa na /
analyzed: 'di ltar blo'i bsam pas spyir bstan pa na /
translated: In this way, when the universal is indicated by the mental object,

original: bdag nyid kyi tha mi dad par snang ba sgro btags nas 'dres par bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi tha mi dad par snang ba sgro btags nas 'dres par bshad pa yin te /
translated: it is explained as mixed by superimposition, appearing as non-different from itself.

original: des na tha mi dad pa 'di nyid spyi yin no //
analyzed: des na tha mi dad pa 'di nyid spyi yin no //
translated: Therefore, this non-difference itself is the universal.

original: de yang yod pa nyid yin pas de ni dam pa'i don du med ces bya ba mi rigs so //
analyzed: de yang yod pa nyid yin pas de ni dam pa'i don du med ces bya ba mi rigs so //
translated: And since it exists, it is not correct to say that it does not exist ultimately.

original: de ji ltar yod ce na /
analyzed: de ji ltar yod ce na /
translated: How does it exist?

original: smras pa shes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa shes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If it is said to exist because it is the nature of cognition,

original: de bzlog pa'i don du med pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir de ni ma yin no zhes smras so //
analyzed: de bzlog pa'i don du med pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir de ni ma yin no zhes smras so //
translated: that is not so, because the text is composed for the purpose of refuting that.

original: gal te yang shes pa'i snang ba tha mi dad pa yin pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: gal te yang shes pa'i snang ba tha mi dad pa yin pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even if the appearance in cognition is non-different,

original: 'di dag gi phyir 'gyur ba gang yin pa des don mtshungs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi phyir 'gyur ba gang yin pa des don mtshungs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: the existence of these is not the same as the existence of that.

original: des de dag rnams mtshungs pa med par ni de dag gi spyir 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: des de dag rnams mtshungs pa med par ni de dag gi spyir 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: But that does not make them similar in general.

original: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: And that is not possible.

original: 'di ltar blo'i snang ba ni shes pa dang tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo'i snang ba ni shes pa dang tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: Because the appearance in cognition is not different from cognition.

original: phyi'i don gyi dngos po nyid ni de las tha dad pa kho na yin no zhes ston pa ni /
analyzed: phyi'i don gyi dngos po nyid ni de las tha dad pa kho na yin no zhes ston pa ni /
translated: To show that the thing that is the external object is just different from that, he says:

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúA different object.‚Äù

original: don tha dad pa ni don gzhan te shes pa la ltos pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: don tha dad pa ni don gzhan te shes pa la ltos pa nyid kyis so //
translated: A different object is a different thing, because it depends on cognition.

original: de lta bur gyur pa der 'di ji ltar 'brang bar 'gyur te gang gis 'di de'i spyir 'gyur ba ji ltar de dang 'dre bar 'gyur /
analyzed: de lta bur gyur pa der 'di ji ltar 'brang bar 'gyur te gang gis 'di de'i spyir 'gyur ba ji ltar de dang 'dre bar 'gyur /
translated: How could that which is like that be extended to that, by which it would be its universal? How could it be mixed with that?

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: He explains just that:

original: shes pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bor zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn the nature of cognition.‚Äù

original: 'di ni shes pa yin la 'di dag ni don yin no zhes tha dad pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni shes pa yin la 'di dag ni don yin no zhes tha dad pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is cognition, and these are objects. This is the explanation of the difference.

original: da ni gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
analyzed: da ni gang gis rang gi ngo bo yis //
translated: Now, by what is it similar in nature?

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung du shes pa'i snang ba ji ltar spyi'i rang bzhin du bshad pa de bstan pas rtsod par byed pa ni gal te de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i gzhung du shes pa'i snang ba ji ltar spyi'i rang bzhin du bshad pa de bstan pas rtsod par byed pa ni gal te de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:

original: don nyid du zhen pa'i phyir de skabs kyi blo'i snang ba la'o //
analyzed: don nyid du zhen pa'i phyir de skabs kyi blo'i snang ba la'o //
translated: The appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo don rnams kyi phyir 'khrul pas tha snyad 'dogs so zhe na /üîΩ'di skad brjod pa yin te /üîΩba lang ngo zhes tha mi dad par snang ba shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin yang don nyid du nges pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni shes pa'i ngo bo don rnams kyi phyir 'khrul pas tha snyad 'dogs so zhe na / 'di skad brjod pa yin te / ba lang ngo zhes tha mi dad par snang ba shes pa'i rang gi ngo bo yin yang don nyid du nges pa yin no //
translated: The opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.

original: des na ba lang zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di don yin par 'gyur la /üîΩde yang @233a * //
analyzed: des na ba lang zhes bya ba'i rnam pa 'di don yin par 'gyur la / de yang @233a * //
translated: The opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:üîΩThe appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.üîΩThe opponent argues that the appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness, as is explained in such passages as:

original: blo'i snang ba nyid yin pas des don mtshungs par brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba nyid yin pas des don mtshungs par brjod pa yin no //
translated: The appearance of objects is the nature of consciousness.

original: 'dir de la zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir de la zhes gsungs te /
translated: The opponent

original: 'dis ni ji ltar btsad pa ma bkag pas brtan pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni ji ltar btsad pa ma bkag pas brtan pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: This shows that the universal is not refuted by the fact that it is not perceived.

original: 'on kyang brgal zhing brtag pa gzhan gyis /üîΩrtsod pa pos bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan 'phangs par byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang brgal zhing brtag pa gzhan gyis / rtsod pa pos bsgrub par bya ba'i dngos po gzhan 'phangs par byas pa yin no //
translated: But the opponent has raised another objection:üîΩ‚ÄúThe universal is not perceived, but the particulars are perceived.‚Äù

original: blo'i snang ba de la de ltar de'i ngo bor zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin na /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba de la de ltar de'i ngo bor zhen pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes pa skye ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin na /
translated: What is the cause of the arising of the cognition that apprehends the universal as having that nature in the appearance of the object?

original: gang gis 'di don rnams kyi spyir 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis 'di don rnams kyi spyir 'gyur /
translated: What is the cause of the universal being the object?

original: rgyu mtshan med bzhin du 'khrul pa skye na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med bzhin du 'khrul pa skye na yang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa ni /
translated: If error arose without a cause, it would follow, absurdly, that there would be no error.

original: rten med par zhes bya ba'o //üîΩdes na de ltar blo'i snang ba tha mi dad kyang de don rnams kyi spyi ma yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: rten med par zhes bya ba'o // des na de ltar blo'i snang ba tha mi dad kyang de don rnams kyi spyi ma yin no zhes bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: This is what is shown by the phrase ‚Äúwithout a basis.‚ÄùüîΩThus it is established that although the appearance of the object is not different from the cognition, it is not the universal of the objects.

original: des na spyi tha dad pa'i tshul 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na spyi tha dad pa'i tshul 'di la yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus it is shown that this way of positing the universal as different does not exist.

original: da ni blo'i snang ba'i snang ba tha mi dad pa nyid gsal ba'i phyir mdo 'di nyid sbyor bar byed pa ni /
analyzed: da ni blo'i snang ba'i snang ba tha mi dad pa nyid gsal ba'i phyir mdo 'di nyid sbyor bar byed pa ni /
translated: Now, in order to clarify the non-difference of the appearances of cognition, he applies this very s≈´tra:

original: rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOr, in one way, all are not different from themselves.‚Äù

original: thams cad rang gi bdag nyid la ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rang gi bdag nyid la ni tha dad pa ma yin no //
translated: All are not different from themselves.

original: gal te shes pa'i snang ba blo gzhan la yod pa shes pa'i snang ba gzhan dang tha mi dad pa ni spyi tha dad par smra ba'i phyogs su 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i snang ba blo gzhan la yod pa shes pa'i snang ba gzhan dang tha mi dad pa ni spyi tha dad par smra ba'i phyogs su 'gyur ro //
translated: If the appearance of cognition that exists in another cognition is not different from the appearance of another cognition, then it would follow that the position of the proponents of difference is correct.

original: shes pa gcig pa tha dad pa ma yin pa blo'i snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi spyi ji ltar shes pa gzhan gyi ngo bo yin /
analyzed: shes pa gcig pa tha dad pa ma yin pa blo'i snang ba'i bdag nyid kyi spyi ji ltar shes pa gzhan gyi ngo bo yin /
translated: How can the universal that is the nature of the appearance of cognition, which is not different from a single cognition, be the nature of another cognition?

original: don gzhan zhes bya bas ni shes pa gzhan brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya bas ni shes pa gzhan brjod pa yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúanother object‚Äù is that it expresses another cognition.

original: ba lang ngo zhes zhes bya ba shes pa'i snang ba rta'i shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin mod /
analyzed: ba lang ngo zhes zhes bya ba shes pa'i snang ba rta'i shes pa'i rang bzhin ma yin mod /
translated: The appearance of the cognition ‚Äúcow‚Äù is not the nature of the cognition ‚Äúhorse.‚Äù

original: gzhan la yang ba lang ngo snyam pa nyid kyi shes pa gnyis pa'i ni yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan la yang ba lang ngo snyam pa nyid kyi shes pa gnyis pa'i ni yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is the nature of the second cognition that thinks ‚Äúcow‚Äù in another person.

original: de dgag pa'i phyir gsal ba gzhan la 'byung ba'i zhes smras so //
analyzed: de dgag pa'i phyir gsal ba gzhan la 'byung ba'i zhes smras so //
translated: In order to refute that, he says, ‚Äúfrom another manifestation of the universal.‚Äù

original: ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i spyi dang 'brel pa can ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan las gzhan gang yin pa de las 'byung ba ba lang ngo snyam par shes pa gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ba lang nyid ces bya ba'i spyi dang 'brel pa can ba lang gi gsal ba gzhan las gzhan gang yin pa de las 'byung ba ba lang ngo snyam par shes pa gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The manifestation of a cow that is related to the universal called ‚Äúcowhood‚Äù is different from another manifestation of a cow. The cognition that arises from that is not the nature of another. This is the meaning.

original: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan ni gzhan gyi ngo bo ma yin no //
translated: Another is not the nature of another.

original: de ltar rnam par shes pa ni gnyi ga ltar yang spyi'i ngo bor srid pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par shes pa ni gnyi ga ltar yang spyi'i ngo bor srid pa ma yin no zhes bshad pa bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: Thus, consciousness is not possible as the nature of either. This is the meaning of the summary statement.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means for that reason.

original: @233b de lta ma yin na de med par nye bar bkod pa 'di ni rnam par brtags pa yin no zhes dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: @233b de lta ma yin na de med par nye bar bkod pa 'di ni rnam par brtags pa yin no zhes dogs pa yin no //
translated: Otherwise, this statement of the absence of the other would be a mere fabrication. This is the doubt.

original: shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni bshad pa phyi ma'i phyogs la yin la /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba ni bshad pa phyi ma'i phyogs la yin la /
translated: ‚ÄúAnother cognition‚Äù is in the context of the latter explanation.

original: gsal ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni snga ma la'o //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni snga ma la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAnother manifestation‚Äù is in the context of the former.

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe shes pa de snga ma'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba la rjes su mi 'gro ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe shes pa de snga ma'i rang bzhin gyis gsal ba la rjes su mi 'gro ba de'i tshe /
translated: Thus, when that cognition does not follow the clarity of the previous nature,

original: ji ltar de'i gsal ba'i rang bzhin de'i gsal ba gzhan la rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i gsal ba'i rang bzhin de'i gsal ba gzhan la rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur /
translated: how could the nature of its clarity follow the clarity of another?

original: de lta bu nyid kyi phyir na 'di ni spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu nyid kyi phyir na 'di ni spyi ma yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is not a universal.

original: gal te snang bzhin pa'i ngo bo ni don du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te snang bzhin pa'i ngo bo ni don du 'gyur ro //
translated: If the appearing form is an object,

original: don med na ni shes pa kho na ste /
analyzed: don med na ni shes pa kho na ste /
translated: then it is cognition alone,

original: de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid kyis de snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i rnam par shes pa yod pa nyid kyis de snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that cognition exists in that form, and it appears.

original: gnod par byed pa dang ldan pa las de med kyang snang bzhin ba'i ngo bo la mi gnod pa'i phyir shes pa'i ngo bo'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa dang ldan pa las de med kyang snang bzhin ba'i ngo bo la mi gnod pa'i phyir shes pa'i ngo bo'i mthar thug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if it does not exist, it is not undermined by the appearing form, because it is associated with an undermining factor. Therefore, it is the ultimate nature of cognition.

original: shes pa'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa srid pa ma yin na ni spyi snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bsam pa'i dbang gis na /
analyzed: shes pa'i rang bzhin du yang yod pa srid pa ma yin na ni spyi snang ba nyid du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir bsam pa'i dbang gis na /
translated: If it is not possible for it to exist as the nature of cognition, then the universal would not appear. Therefore,

original: spyi yod par ni rab tu bsgrags //
analyzed: spyi yod par ni rab tu bsgrags //
translated: the existence of universals is proclaimed due to the power of thought.

original: zhes ci ste brjod /
analyzed: zhes ci ste brjod /
translated: Why is this?

original: 'di ltar spyi ni mi snang ba yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi ni mi snang ba yin la /
translated: Because a universal does not appear.

original: mi snang na yang blo'i bsam pa'i spyi gang zhig yin zhes de ltar dogs na de bshad pa ni /
analyzed: mi snang na yang blo'i bsam pa'i spyi gang zhig yin zhes de ltar dogs na de bshad pa ni /
translated: If it does not appear, then what is the universal that is the object of the mind?

original: de phyir zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de phyir zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore means that because of that.

original: 'di ni don rnams la gcig gi bdag tu 'dzin pa mngon par zhen pa lhag par rlom pa yin gyi gsal ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ni don rnams la gcig gi bdag tu 'dzin pa mngon par zhen pa lhag par rlom pa yin gyi gsal ba ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that the mind apprehends the nature of a single object, but it does not apprehend a real universal.

original: gal te spyi 'di gsal ba yin na ni de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la de de ltar gsal ba'i phyir shes pa nyid spyi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: gal te spyi 'di gsal ba yin na ni de'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la de de ltar gsal ba'i phyir shes pa nyid spyi'i bdag nyid du 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: If this universal were a real thing, then because it would appear in the form of that cognition, cognition itself would have the nature of a universal,

original: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin no //
analyzed: zla ba gnyis la sogs pa'i ngo bo bzhin no //
translated: like the nature of two moons and so on.

original: gang gi tshe shes pa yang spyi'i ngo bor 'gal ba de'i tshe 'di la gsal ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'di spyir zhen pa tsam mo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe shes pa yang spyi'i ngo bor 'gal ba de'i tshe 'di la gsal ba nyid med pa'i phyir 'di spyir zhen pa tsam mo //
translated: When it is contradictory for cognition to have the nature of a universal, then because it does not have the nature of a real thing, it is merely conceived to be a universal.

original: dper na rnam par rtog pa dngos po rig pa ma yin yang dngos por lhag par zhen pa nyid dngos po rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du brjod kyi dngos po gsal ba'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rnam par rtog pa dngos po rig pa ma yin yang dngos por lhag par zhen pa nyid dngos po rtogs pa'i rang bzhin du brjod kyi dngos po gsal ba'i ngo bos ni ma yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, although a conceptual cognition is not a thing, the nature of the conceptual cognition is said to be the realization of a thing, because it is the conception of a thing, but not because it is the nature of the manifestation of a thing.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig rtogs pa na ba lang la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu rtogs pa gang yin pa de lta bu rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan rtogs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid gcig rtogs pa na ba lang la sogs pa'i rnam pa de lta bu rtogs pa gang yin pa de lta bu rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan rtogs na /
translated: Therefore, when one realizes one particular characteristic, if one realizes another particular characteristic in the same way, that is, in the aspect of a cow, and so on,

original: de rnam pa gcig tu zhen pa'i phyir spyir @234a * //
analyzed: de rnam pa gcig tu zhen pa'i phyir spyir @234a * //
translated: then it is explained as a universal because it is conceived as a single aspect.

original: bshad do // gal te ji ltar rags pa'i rang bzhin nyid gcig mi srid kyang rnam par rig pa tsam la shes pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gal ba de bzhin du spyi'i ngo bo phyi rol la mi srid pa yang phyi'i smra ba la rnam par shes par 'gyur ro zhe
analyzed: bshad do // gal te ji ltar rags pa'i rang bzhin nyid gcig mi srid kyang rnam par rig pa tsam la shes pa'i rang bzhin du mi 'gal ba de bzhin du spyi'i ngo bo phyi rol la mi srid pa yang phyi'i smra ba la rnam par shes par 'gyur ro zhe
translated: If you say that just as it is not impossible for a single nature to be coarse, and for it to be the nature of consciousness in terms of vij√±aptimƒÅtra, in the same way, even though an external object does not exist as a universal, it becomes consciousness,

original: na / de ltar ni mi nus te /
analyzed: na / de ltar ni mi nus te /
translated: we say that is not possible.

original: shes pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin na de lta bu'i ngo bor mi 'grub pa'i phyir te yang mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: shes pa gzhan gyi bdag nyid ma yin na de lta bu'i ngo bor mi 'grub pa'i phyir te yang mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: If it is not the nature of another cognition, it is not established as such a nature, because it is not tenable.

original: gcig yod na gzhan nges par nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de med par yang de de'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig yod na gzhan nges par nye ba ma yin pa'i phyir dang / de med par yang de de'i rang bzhin du mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because when one exists, the other is not necessarily proximate, and because it is not tenable that it is the nature of that without it.

original: de nyid kyi phyir spyi ni rags pa'i rnam pa bzhin du kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir spyi ni rags pa'i rnam pa bzhin du kun rdzob tu yang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, like the form of the gross, the universal does not exist even conventionally.

original: 'on kyang ri bong gi rva bzhin med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang ri bong gi rva bzhin med pa kho na'o //
translated: However, like the horn of a rabbit, it does not exist at all.

original: des na shes pa'i bdag nyid dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang skad cig ma'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di phyi rol dang thun mong pa nyid dang sngon mthong ba nyid du rtogs pa ni lhag par zhen pa kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: des na shes pa'i bdag nyid dang / thun mong ma yin pa dang skad cig ma'i sngon po la sogs pa'i rnam pa 'di phyi rol dang thun mong pa nyid dang sngon mthong ba nyid du rtogs pa ni lhag par zhen pa kho na yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, the cognition of the form of blue, etc., which is of the nature of cognition, is not shared, and is momentary, as being shared with external things and as being seen previously is mere adherence.

original: rig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not knowledge.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid la ji skad brjod pa las gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i rnam pa ma yin pa de dang de rig pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid la ji skad brjod pa las gzhan du ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir dang / de lta bu'i rnam pa ma yin pa de dang de rig pa nyid med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not tenable that it is other than the nature of consciousness, and it is not the case that it is not the cognition of this and that, which are not of such a kind.

original: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explained:

original: don rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: don rnams ni zhes bya ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe objects are not the universal.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyi khas blangs pa'am shes pa'i bdag nyid ni tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan gyi khas blangs pa'am shes pa'i bdag nyid ni tha dad pa ste /
translated: The nature of the other‚Äôs assertion or cognition is different.

original: shes pa'i bdag nyid dngos por yod pa'i gcig pa nyid ma grub pas spyi'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i bdag nyid dngos por yod pa'i gcig pa nyid ma grub pas spyi'i ngo bo ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since the nature of consciousness does not exist as a real unity, it is not a universal.

original: don rnams la de ltar spyi nyid du 'dzin pa ste lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni log pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: don rnams la de ltar spyi nyid du 'dzin pa ste lhag par zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni log pa nyid yin no //
translated: The conception of the objects as a universal, that is, the conception of the universal as a real entity, is a false conception.

original: spyi bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la yang 'di log pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho na ma yin nam /
analyzed: spyi bzhin du sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin la yang 'di log pa'i rnam par rtog pa kho na ma yin nam /
translated: Isn‚Äôt the conception of the nature of blue, etc., as a universal also a false conception?

original: bden mod kyi 'on kyang phyi rol nyid kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: bden mod kyi 'on kyang phyi rol nyid kyis yin gyi /
translated: This is true, but it is due to the external object,

original: sngon po'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po'i ngo bos ni ma yin te /
translated: not due to the nature of blue, etc.

original: de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis rang rig pa'i yul yin pas log pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shes pa'i bdag nyid kyis rang rig pa'i yul yin pas log pa nyid ma grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the object of reflexive awareness, which is by nature cognition, it is not established as false.

original: 'di ji ltar mi bden pa de ltar rtog pa ni lag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin na shes pa nyid du mi bden pa ma yin te phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i phyi rol bzhin du shes pa nyid du yang sngon po 'gal ba med pa'i
analyzed: 'di ji ltar mi bden pa de ltar rtog pa ni lag pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin na shes pa nyid du mi bden pa ma yin te phyi rol gyi don du smra ba'i phyi rol bzhin du shes pa nyid du yang sngon po 'gal ba med pa'i
translated: The conception of it as not real in that way is the conception of the hand. It is not unreal as cognition itself, because it is not contradictory for blue to be cognition itself, just as it is external objects for the proponents of external objects.

original: phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir lhag par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kho nas rnam par rtog pa log pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir na rnam par @234b rtog pa 'khrul zhes bya bas ni phyin ci log tu lhag par zhen pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: phyir ro // de nyid kyi phyir lhag par zhen pa'i bdag nyid kho nas rnam par rtog pa log pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir na rnam par @234b rtog pa 'khrul zhes bya bas ni phyin ci log tu lhag par zhen pa nyid brjod pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because it is the nature of a misconception that it is only a conception that is a superimposition, the statement ‚Äúconception is mistaken‚Äù expresses the fact that it is a superimposition that is erroneous.

original: gal te yang mdo'i 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis bshad pa de ltar na yang de ltar 'dzin pa ni lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin no zhes rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i 'dis brjod pa'i phyir mchog tu legsüîΩpa yin no //
analyzed: gal te yang mdo'i 'dzin pa zhes bya ba nyid kyis bshad pa de ltar na yang de ltar 'dzin pa ni lhag par zhen pa'i rang bzhin no zhes rnam par rtog pa ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no zhes bya ba'i 'dis brjod pa'i phyir mchog tu legs pa yin no //
translated: Even if it is explained in this way, by the so-called grasping of the s≈´tra, the thought that such grasping is the nature of attachment is just a mistake. This is what is being said, and so it is excellent.

original: da ni de'i ngo bor zhen pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i phyogs khas len pas /
analyzed: da ni de'i ngo bor zhen pa'i phyir zhes smras pa'i phyogs khas len pas /
translated: Now, accepting the position stated as ‚Äúbecause of the attachment to its nature,‚Äù

original: de la de ltar shes pa skye ba'i rten gang yin zhes bya bas brjod par bya ba gzhan la 'phangs pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la de ltar shes pa skye ba'i rten gang yin zhes bya bas brjod par bya ba gzhan la 'phangs pa gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to show the response to the question, ‚ÄúWhat is the basis for the arising of such cognition?‚Äù which is raised in the other,

original: ming don gang ldan zhes smos so //
analyzed: ming don gang ldan zhes smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúWhat is the name that possesses the meaning?‚Äù

original: 'di la ji ltar chos tha dad par rnam par rtog pa'i rten gzhan sel ba yin par sngar bshad pa de bzhin du chos rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa'i yang yin par 'dis brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di la ji ltar chos tha dad par rnam par rtog pa'i rten gzhan sel ba yin par sngar bshad pa de bzhin du chos rjes su 'gro bar rtogs pa'i yang yin par 'dis brjod pa yin no //
translated: Just as it was previously explained that the basis for the conception of different phenomena is exclusion, this also expresses the basis for the conception of phenomena that are concordant.

original: de la dngos po gang dang gang las tha dad pa de dang tha mi dad par thal ba sel ba na byed pa tha dad pa'i yul gyis rang bzhin yang tha dad par rnam par brtags pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dngos po gang dang gang las tha dad pa de dang tha mi dad par thal ba sel ba na byed pa tha dad pa'i yul gyis rang bzhin yang tha dad par rnam par brtags pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin te /
translated: When one eliminates the consequence that it is different from or not different from any entity, one should analyze whether the nature of the object of different activity is also different.

original: des na chos tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon ldog pa yin no //
analyzed: des na chos tha dad pa 'di'i sa bon ldog pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the seed of this different phenomenon is eliminated.

original: de bzhin du de lta bu ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams la spyir rtogs pa yang rgyu mtshan med pa can ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du de lta bu ma yin pa'i dngos po rnams la spyir rtogs pa yang rgyu mtshan med pa can ma yin te /
translated: Similarly, the understanding of other such entities is not without a reason,

original: tha dad pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: tha dad pa rgyu mtshan yin pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: because the reason is different.

original: /'di ltar khra bo la sogs pa ba lang gi rang bzhin rnams ni so sor ba lang ma yin pa las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: /'di ltar khra bo la sogs pa ba lang gi rang bzhin rnams ni so sor ba lang ma yin pa las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the nature of a variegated cow, etc., is different from the individual non-cow.

original: des na ji ltar khra bo ba lang ma yin pa las tha dad pa da bzhin du /
analyzed: des na ji ltar khra bo ba lang ma yin pa las tha dad pa da bzhin du /
translated: Therefore, just as the variegated cow is different from the non-cow,

original: ser skya yang yin zhing gsal ba'i dbye ba gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: ser skya yang yin zhing gsal ba'i dbye ba gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: so is the tawny cow, and other distinctions of manifestation are also like that.

original: des na 'di dag rigs mi mthun pa dang / tha mi dad par thal ba na gcig la sgro btags pa'i ba lang ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhan du yin pa'i phyir de dang tha mi dad pa bzlog pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis ba lang gi khyad par mtha' dag la ba lang giüîΩrnam par rtog pa gcig 'jug pa mi mthun pa med do //
analyzed: des na 'di dag rigs mi mthun pa dang / tha mi dad par thal ba na gcig la sgro btags pa'i ba lang ma yin pa gang yin pa de nyid gzhan du yin pa'i phyir de dang tha mi dad pa bzlog pa'i 'bras bu can nyid kyis ba lang gi khyad par mtha' dag la ba lang gi rnam par rtog pa gcig 'jug pa mi mthun pa med do //
translated: Therefore, if these are not of a different type, and if they are not different, then the cow that is not a non-cow is the same as the other, and therefore, since they have the same result, the exclusion of non-difference, the single concept of cow applies to all the particulars of cow without distinction.

original: 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni gcig tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir na /
analyzed: 'di dag gi rang bzhin ni gcig tu mi 'thad pa'i phyir na /
translated: Since their nature is not tenable as one,

original: de dag la rang bzhin rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni mi 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag la rang bzhin rtogs pa'i 'bras bu can gyi rnam par rtog pa ni mi 'jug go //
translated: the concept that has the result of understanding their nature does not apply to them.

original: de dag las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ni gcig yin la /
analyzed: de dag las tha dad pa'i rang bzhin ni gcig yin la /
translated: The nature that is different from them is one,

original: de yang de rnams la log pa'i shes pas re re la sgro btags pa yin no //üîΩyang dag pa'i @235a * //
analyzed: de yang de rnams la log pa'i shes pas re re la sgro btags pa yin no // yang dag pa'i @235a * //
translated: and that is superimposed on each one by a mistaken consciousness.

original: shes pa ni tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par dmigs pa 'gal gyi /
analyzed: shes pa ni tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad par dmigs pa 'gal gyi /
translated: A correct consciousness does not observe a difference in what is not different.

original: gzhan ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the other way around.

original: log pa ni phyin ci log sgro 'dogs pa nyid kyis log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: log pa ni phyin ci log sgro 'dogs pa nyid kyis log pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúWrong‚Äù because it is a superimposition, a distortion.

original: ba lang gi khyad par mtha' dag las gzhan pa'i gcig po yang ba lang ma yin pa yin la /
analyzed: ba lang gi khyad par mtha' dag las gzhan pa'i gcig po yang ba lang ma yin pa yin la /
translated: The one that is different from all the particulars of cow is not a cow.

original: gcig po de ni 'khrul pa des de thams cad la sgro btags te /
analyzed: gcig po de ni 'khrul pa des de thams cad la sgro btags te /
translated: And that one is superimposed on all of them by that error.

original: des na 'di de ltar 'jug pa 'thad pa'i phyir rang bzhin la yang gcig tu rtogs pa'i 'khrul pa 'dir 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang dbye bar bya ba'i don du de dag la gcig tu rtogs pa zhugs pa las bzlog pa yang 'thad pa yin no
analyzed: des na 'di de ltar 'jug pa 'thad pa'i phyir rang bzhin la yang gcig tu rtogs pa'i 'khrul pa 'dir 'gyur ba gang yin pa de dang dbye bar bya ba'i don du de dag la gcig tu rtogs pa zhugs pa las bzlog pa yang 'thad pa yin no
translated: Therefore, since it is tenable that it engages in that way, it is also tenable that the error of conceiving the nature of things as one is reversed in terms of the objects that are differentiated.

original: // rang bzhin gcig tu ma rtogs par ni rnam par rtog pa gcig 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: // rang bzhin gcig tu ma rtogs par ni rnam par rtog pa gcig 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: Without conceiving the nature of things as one, the conception of a single universal does not occur.

original: 'di gcig 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir spyir nor ba ni 'jug pa'i mthus byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di gcig 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir spyir nor ba ni 'jug pa'i mthus byas pa yin no //
translated: Since this occurs, the error of conceiving universals is made by the power of engagement.

original: 'jug pa yang sgro 'dogs la brten pa yin la de yang tha dad pa las yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa 'di ni tha dad pa'i sa bon can yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa yang sgro 'dogs la brten pa yin la de yang tha dad pa las yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa 'di ni tha dad pa'i sa bon can yin no //
translated: and the engagement is based on reification, and that is based on difference, therefore this cognition has a seed of difference.

original: gal te tha dad pa ni spyir rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa yin gyi sa bon ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa ni spyir rnam par rtog pa'i dmigs pa yin gyi sa bon ni ma yin pa ma yin nam /
translated: But isn‚Äôt difference the object of a concept, not a seed?

original: bden te / 'on kyang de ni de la'ang gzhan las log pa dang zhes bshad pa khyad par dag las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
analyzed: bden te / 'on kyang de ni de la'ang gzhan las log pa dang zhes bshad pa khyad par dag las tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid yin no //
translated: That is true, but it is the nature of a thing that is not different from the particulars that are explained as ‚Äúthe exclusion of other.‚Äù

original: ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid med phyir //
analyzed: ldog pa'i ngo bo nyid med phyir //
translated: Because there is no nature of exclusion.

original: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dngos po gzhan ldog pa tsam gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: zhes 'chad par 'gyur ba dngos po gzhan ldog pa tsam gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa ma yin gyi /
translated: As will be explained, the mere exclusion of other entities is not an object.

original: 'on kyang sa bon kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang sa bon kho na yin te /
translated: But it is a seed.

original: ji skad bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is as explained.

original: de nyid ni sa bon du 'thad pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni ming don gang ldan zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid ni sa bon du 'thad pa nyid do zhes bshad pa ni ming don gang ldan zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúIt is just the seed‚Äù explains that it is just tenable as a seed.

original: sgra ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin te /
analyzed: sgra ni gzhan sel ba'i yul can yin te /
translated: A word has the exclusion of other as its object.

original: des na gzhan sel ba nyid spyir shes pa'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: des na gzhan sel ba nyid spyir shes pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: Therefore, the seed of the cognition of universals is the exclusion of other.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid sgra'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid sgra'i don yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the object of conceptual cognition is the meaning of a word.

original: ming ni phan tshun tha dad pa'i don can yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ming ni phan tshun tha dad pa'i don can yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught that a name has a meaning that is mutually exclusive.

original: 'dir ming don gang ldan zhes bshad pa'i phan tshun tha dad pa nges pa nyid sa bon yin par brjod pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: 'dir ming don gang ldan zhes bshad pa'i phan tshun tha dad pa nges pa nyid sa bon yin par brjod pa'i don du'o //
translated: Here, the meaning of the statement ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of a name?‚Äù is that mutual exclusion is the seed.

original: 'di ltar dngos po gzhan la med pa yang tha dad pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po gzhan la med pa yang tha dad pa kho na yin na /
translated: Thus, what does not exist in other things is just mutual exclusion.

original: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang rtogs 'brel 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: de ni rnam par rtog pa dang rtogs 'brel 'ga' yang med do //
translated: That has no connection whatsoever with conceptual cognition.

original: sgro 'dogs rnam par gcad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon yin no zhes bya bar rigs te /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs rnam par gcad pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha dad pa gang yin pa de ni sa bon yin no zhes bya bar rigs te /
