translated: It is reasonable to say that the mutual exclusion that has the characteristic of eliminating superimposition is the seed.

original: sgra yang de'i don du yin par sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: sgra yang de'i don du yin par sngar bstan zin to //
translated: And it has been taught earlier that a word is for that purpose.

original: des na tha dad pa de'i sa bon yin no zhes brjod pa'i ched du ming don gang ldan zhes bshad pa @235b yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad pa de'i sa bon yin no zhes brjod pa'i ched du ming don gang ldan zhes bshad pa @235b yin no //
translated: Therefore, in order to say that mutual exclusion is the seed of that, it is explained that ‚ÄúWhat is the meaning of a name?‚Äù

original: gal te de de la med pa'i phyir te sgro 'dogs par byed par 'khrul pa yin la /
analyzed: gal te de de la med pa'i phyir te sgro 'dogs par byed par 'khrul pa yin la /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWhy is that?‚Äù it is because it does not exist there.üîΩIt is a mistaken superimposition.

original: de ltar na yang de zlog par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir nge yang sa bon nyid du srid pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar na yang de zlog par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'jug pa'i phyir nge yang sa bon nyid du srid pa ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, is it not possible that the conception that reverses that is also a seed?

original: bden mod kyi dngos kyis sa bon gyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid brjod pa'i phyir de ltar nye bar bkod do //
analyzed: bden mod kyi dngos kyis sa bon gyi ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid brjod pa'i phyir de ltar nye bar bkod do //
translated: It is true, but it is stated in that way in order to express just that which is the nature of the seed.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par 'grel pa yang phan tshun tha dad pa de ni sa bon yin no zhes so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par 'grel pa yang phan tshun tha dad pa de ni sa bon yin no zhes so //
translated: For that very reason, the commentary also says, ‚ÄúThat which is different from that is a seed.‚Äù

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes smos so //
analyzed: gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes smos so //
translated: It is stated in order to know that.

original: sgro 'dogs rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: It is the elimination of superimposition.

original: zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning.

original: gal te ji ltar khra bo bum pa las tha dad pa de bzhin du ser skya las kyang yin pas khra bo dang bum ba dag bzhin du khra bo dang ser skya gnyis kyang yin te tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gis stong ba'i
analyzed: gal te ji ltar khra bo bum pa las tha dad pa de bzhin du ser skya las kyang yin pas khra bo dang bum ba dag bzhin du khra bo dang ser skya gnyis kyang yin te tha dad pa'am tha mi dad pa'i chos 'ga' zhig gis stong ba'i
translated: If it is the case that just as a multicolored thing is different from a pot, so it is also different from a tawny thing, then just like a multicolored thing and a pot, a multicolored thing and a tawny thing are different, because they are empty of any phenomenon that is either different or not different.

original: phyir ro // des na khra bo ba lang nyid yin pas na de las gzhan gang yin pa de ba lang ma yin pas bum pa ba lang ma yin pa nyid yin na /üîΩser skya yang ba lang ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyir ro // des na khra bo ba lang nyid yin pas na de las gzhan gang yin pa de ba lang ma yin pas bum pa ba lang ma yin pa nyid yin na / ser skya yang ba lang ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since a multicolored thing is a cow, whatever is different from it is not a cow. Thus, a pot is not a cow.üîΩBut if a tawny thing is not a cow, then it follows that it is not a cow.

original: 'on te tha dad pa de nyid ma yin pa'i yan lag ma yin na ni bum pa la yang ba lang kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te tha dad pa de nyid ma yin pa'i yan lag ma yin na ni bum pa la yang ba lang kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if that difference is not a part of it, then a pot is just a cow.

original: des na gang gis 'dir spyi'i blor 'gyur ba khra bo dang ser skya gnyis ba lang ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir ba lang ma yin par sgro 'dogs rnam par bcad pa'i rten du ji ltar 'gyur /
analyzed: des na gang gis 'dir spyi'i blor 'gyur ba khra bo dang ser skya gnyis ba lang ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir ba lang ma yin par sgro 'dogs rnam par bcad pa'i rten du ji ltar 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, since a multicolored thing and a tawny thing are not cows, how could they be the basis for the elimination of the superimposition that they are not cows, because they are the opposite of the cognition of a general object?

original: des na phan tshun tha dad pa ni sa bon ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na phan tshun tha dad pa ni sa bon ma yin te med pa nyid kyi phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, they are not seeds because they are different from each other and do not exist.

original: de ltar dogs pa 'di bsu nas ji ltar khra bo dang ser skya gnyis ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa grub kyi khra bo dang bum pa gnyis la ni ma yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar dogs pa 'di bsu nas ji ltar khra bo dang ser skya gnyis ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa grub kyi khra bo dang bum pa gnyis la ni ma yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that the reversal of not being a cow is established for both a multicolored cow and a tawny cow, but not for both a multicolored cow and a pot, this passage responds to that doubt.

original: bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa can gyi zhes smos so //
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa can gyi zhes smos so //
translated: It says, ‚ÄúThat which has a nondifferent object of affirmation . . .‚Äù

original: bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa gang la yod pa rnams ni bum pa la sogs pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba can ma yin pa de dag las tha dad pas te gzhan nyid du shes par byas te /
analyzed: bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa bsgrub par bya ba tha mi dad pa gang la yod pa rnams ni bum pa la sogs pa de'i bsgrub par bya ba can ma yin pa de dag las tha dad pas te gzhan nyid du shes par byas te /
translated: Those that have a nondifferent object of affirmation, such as being milked and being fed, are known to be different, that is, other than those that are not its object of affirmation, such as a pot.

original: sgro 'dogs kyi sgo nas rab tu 'brel pa de dag yongs su spangs nas te rnam par bcad nas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis na tha dad pa gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir brda byed pa ste de lta bu de yang sgro 'dogs pa rnam
analyzed: sgro 'dogs kyi sgo nas rab tu 'brel pa de dag yongs su spangs nas te rnam par bcad nas 'jug par 'gyur ba'i gtan tshigs kyis na tha dad pa gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir brda byed pa ste de lta bu de yang sgro 'dogs pa rnam
translated: Having completely eliminated, having completely cut off, the connection by superimposition, the reason for engaging in the elimination of superimposition is that one makes a convention in order to understand something different.

original: par bcad pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: par bcad pa kho na yin no //
translated: That is also the elimination of superimposition.

original: de'i don ni 'di yin te khra bo dang ser skya gnyis rang bzhin gcig dang ldan pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gang las tha dad kyang thams cad khyad par med par mi 'gyur ba don rnams la mi @236a * //üîΩ'dra ba yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i don ni 'di yin te khra bo dang ser skya gnyis rang bzhin gcig dang ldan pa ma yin pa de lta na yang gang las tha dad kyang thams cad khyad par med par mi 'gyur ba don rnams la mi @236a * // 'dra ba yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The meaning of this is as follows: Although multicolored and tawny do not have the same nature, still, since they are different but not all without distinction, objects do have differences.

original: 'di ltar rang bzhin gcig med kyang ji ltar khro bo bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa la nus pa de bzhin du tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa ni ma yin la ser skya ni tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yang nus pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang bzhin gcig med kyang ji ltar khro bo bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa la nus pa de bzhin du tha dad pa'i rang bzhin gyi bum pa ni ma yin la ser skya ni tha dad pa'i rang bzhin yang nus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, although they do not have the same nature, just as multicolored is able to be a cow and a horse, etc., a pot is not able to be a different nature, but tawny is able to be a different nature.

original: des na tha dad pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni tha dad pa rnams khyad par med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: des na tha dad pa zhes bya ba tsam gyis ni tha dad pa rnams khyad par med pa ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, mere difference does not make all differences the same,

original: 'ga' zhig kho na don bya ba de byed pa'i phyir dang / thams cad dam tshig nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ga' zhig kho na don bya ba de byed pa'i phyir dang / thams cad dam tshig nyid ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because some things perform a certain function, but not all things do.

original: 'di yang khyad par rnams so so rang gi rang bzhin kho nas byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba 'di ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'di yang khyad par rnams so so rang gi rang bzhin kho nas byed pa yin pa'i phyir mi 'dra ba 'di ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid kho na'o //
translated: Moreover, this difference is just the nature of the differences themselves, because they perform their functions by their own individual natures.

original: de las tha dad par khyad par med kyang de ni mi 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
analyzed: de las tha dad par khyad par med kyang de ni mi 'dra ba'i bdag nyid kho na ste /
translated: Although there is no difference in the nature of the differences from the nature of the thing itself, the thing itself is just the nature of the differences.

original: ji ltar 'di rnams kyi mi 'dra ba yin pa de bzhin du 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di rnams kyi mi 'dra ba yin pa de bzhin du 'ga' zhig kho na'i yin no //
translated: Just as the thing itself is the nature of the differences, so it is the nature of some of the differences.

original: phan tshun ma 'brel pa ba lang gi ngo bo yin gyi tha dad kyang gzhan ni ma yin pas nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: phan tshun ma 'brel pa ba lang gi ngo bo yin gyi tha dad kyang gzhan ni ma yin pas nyes pa 'ga' yang med do //
translated: Although the thing itself is different from the differences, it is not different from the differences that are not related to each other, because it is the nature of the cow. Therefore, there is no fault.

original: 'di ltar shes brjod tha mi dad pa'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'di dag la spyi dgos pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes brjod tha mi dad pa'i dngos po nyid kyi phyir 'di dag la spyi dgos pa yin gyi rang gi ngo bo'am /
translated: Because the object of knowledge and expression are not different, universals are necessary for these.üîΩ

original: rang gi ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bos bsgrub par bya ba'i 'bras bu la ni ma yin no //
translated: Because the thing itself is not different from the cognition and the expression, the universal is necessary for these, but not for the effect which is to be accomplished by the intrinsic nature.

original: 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bo ni spyi la ltos pa 'ga' yang med de ni rang gi rgyu kho na las grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di dag gi rang gi ngo bo ni spyi la ltos pa 'ga' yang med de ni rang gi rgyu kho na las grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The intrinsic nature of these does not depend on the universal at all, because it is established from its own cause alone.

original: spyi'i stobs kyis ni der shes pa tha mi dad par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: spyi'i stobs kyis ni der shes pa tha mi dad par 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: By the power of the universal, there is only the non-difference of cognition in that.

original: de bzhin du 'bras bu yang de'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid tsam la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'bras bu yang de'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa nyid tsam la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: Similarly, the effect also depends on the mere existence of its intrinsic nature.

original: spyis ni de la cung zad kyang mi dgos te nus pa yod pa tsam nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyis ni de la cung zad kyang mi dgos te nus pa yod pa tsam nyid las 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The universal does not need anything at all in that, because it arises from the mere existence of the capacity.

original: des na tha dad kyang 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin mi 'dra ba yod pa dang med pa dag ni khyad par 'ga' zhig kho nar grub pa yin no //
analyzed: des na tha dad kyang 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid can gyi rang bzhin mi 'dra ba yod pa dang med pa dag ni khyad par 'ga' zhig kho nar grub pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though they are different, the existence and non-existence of a different intrinsic nature of this kind are established as some kind of distinction.

original: des na ldog pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de spyi'i rtogs pa'i sa bon du 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: des na ldog pa la 'gal ba med pa'i phyir de spyi'i rtogs pa'i sa bon du 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no contradiction in the reversal, it is reasonable that it is the seed of the understanding of the universal.

original: de nyid sa bon du gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di ni de kho na 'dzin pa na zhes smos so //
analyzed: de nyid sa bon du gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa 'di ni de kho na 'dzin pa na zhes smos so //
translated: In order to establish that very thing as the seed, he says, ‚ÄúWhen apprehending thatness‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: 'dzin pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis ni 'di'i tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid brjod do //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i tshig gi tshul gyis ni 'di'i tha mi dad pa'i rang bzhin nyid brjod do //
translated: By the method of the word ‚Äúapprehending,‚Äù its undifferentiated nature is stated.

original: de kho na zhes spyi la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i bsam pas ji skad brjod pa'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid kho na mi 'dra ba yin pa mi bzod pas yang ji ltar na zhes smras so //
analyzed: de kho na zhes spyi la sogs pa mi 'dzin pa'i bsam pas ji skad brjod pa'i khyad par gyi bdag nyid kho na mi 'dra ba yin pa mi bzod pas yang ji ltar na zhes smras so //
translated: With the thought that ‚Äúthatness‚Äù does not apprehend the universal, etc., he says, ‚ÄúHow can it be‚Ä¶‚Äù because it is not possible that the nature of the particular as stated is not different.

original: tha dad pa gang dag yin pa de rnams kyi 'bras bu tha mi dad pa ji ltar yin te /
analyzed: tha dad pa gang dag yin pa de rnams kyi 'bras bu tha mi dad pa ji ltar yin te /
translated: How can the effect be undifferentiated for those that are different?

original: tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tha dad par khyad par med pa'i phyir /
translated: Because there is no difference in the differentiation.

original: tha dad pa thams cad thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa thams cad thal bar 'gyur ro snyam du sems pa'o //
translated: The consequence is that all differences would be nonexistent.

original: des na khyad par rnams la rnam pa de lta bu'i @236b mi 'dra ba med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig dang tha dad par gal 'gyur zhes ston pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na khyad par rnams la rnam pa de lta bu'i @236b mi 'dra ba med pa'i phyir 'ga' zhig dang tha dad par gal 'gyur zhes ston pa ni gang gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore, since the particulars do not have such a different aspect, how could they be different from something?

original: da la bshad pa ni dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da la bshad pa ni dngos po rnams kyi zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Now, the explanation is ‚Äúof things.‚Äù

original: ji ltar 'bras bu tha mi dad //
analyzed: ji ltar 'bras bu tha mi dad //
translated: How is the effect not different?

original: ces pha rol pos dris pa gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no //
analyzed: ces pha rol pos dris pa gang yin pa 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin yin no //
translated: This is the question asked by the opponent.

original: 'di nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
analyzed: 'di nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir bshad pa /
translated: In order to formulate the treatise, it is explained:

original: 'di ltar gcig gi rtogs pa ni gcig rtogs te spyi'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar gcig gi rtogs pa ni gcig rtogs te spyi'i shes pa'o //
translated: Thus, the understanding of one is the understanding of one, which is the cognition of the universal.

original: don shes pa ni nyams su myong ba'o //
analyzed: don shes pa ni nyams su myong ba'o //
translated: The cognition of the object is the experience.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ba lang la sogs pa rnams kyi bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ba lang la sogs pa rnams kyi bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the milking and chewing of cows, etc.

original: 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid don ta /
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i bdag nyid don ta /
translated: The object has such a nature.

original: dgos pa gcig sgrub la tha dad pa yin yang kha cig rang bzhin gyis nges pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa gcig sgrub la tha dad pa yin yang kha cig rang bzhin gyis nges pa yin gyi thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: Although they are different in accomplishing the same purpose, some are ascertained by nature, but not all.

original: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod pa yin te /
translated: The following is said:üîΩAlthough all things are not different in being particular, there is a single cognition in general, such as ‚Äúcow‚Äù and ‚Äúcow‚Äù with respect to a multicolored object, etc.

original: dngos po thams cad tha dad par khyad par med kyang khra bo la sogs pa nyid ba lang ba lang snyam du spyir shes pa gcig dang / de bzhin du ba lang gi rnam par snang ba'i mngon sum dang / bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi ngang pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad tha dad par khyad par med kyang khra bo la sogs pa nyid ba lang ba lang snyam du spyir shes pa gcig dang / de bzhin du ba lang gi rnam par snang ba'i mngon sum dang / bzho ba dang dgal ba la sogs pa skyed par byed pa yin gyi ngang pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, there is a direct perception that appears in the aspect of a cow, and it is the cause of the production of the cognition ‚Äúmilking‚Äù and ‚Äúcalves,‚Äù etc., but not of the cognition ‚Äúswans,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di ltar de dag nyid de lta bu'i mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa la ni spyi nyid rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de dag nyid de lta bu'i mi 'dra ba dang ldan pa la ni spyi nyid rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Thus, the mere universal itself is the cause of the possession of such dissimilar effects.

original: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin la rgyu de dag kyang de lta bu skyed par byed nus par rang gi rgyu kho na las yin pa'i phyir thog ma med do //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa'i rang bzhin du rang gi rgyu las skyes pa yin la rgyu de dag kyang de lta bu skyed par byed nus par rang gi rgyu kho na las yin pa'i phyir thog ma med do //
translated: The nature of the cause of the production of the effect arises from its own cause, and those causes are able to produce such effects from their own causes alone. Therefore, there is no beginning.

original: 'di ltar spyi yod kyang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i nus pa nges pa 'di ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi yod kyang 'bras bu sgrub pa'i nus pa nges pa 'di ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, although the universal exists, the definite ability to establish the effect is the nature of the particular.

original: des na 'di mi 'dod pa'i khyad par gzhan la brten par thal gyi 'di bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba khas ma blangs par yang bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: des na 'di mi 'dod pa'i khyad par gzhan la brten par thal gyi 'di bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin ma yin no zhes bya ba khas ma blangs par yang bsgrub par 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, it follows that the difference that does not desire this is based on another, and it is not the nature of this itself.

original: spyi de'i rten du 'gyur ba'i khyad par rnams kho na nus pa yin gyi gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi de'i rten du 'gyur ba'i khyad par rnams kho na nus pa yin gyi gzhan rnams ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The difference that becomes the basis of that universal is the only one that is capable, and the others are not.

original: spyi zhes bya ba na tha mi dad par tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: spyi zhes bya ba na tha mi dad par tha snyad byed pa yin gyi /
translated: When it is called a universal, it is a convention that is not different.

original: shes pa tha mi dad pa la sogs pa ltar de dag gi nus pa yang rgyu mtshan la brten pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa tha mi dad pa la sogs pa ltar de dag gi nus pa yang rgyu mtshan la brten pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that its capacity is based on a reason, as is the case with nondifferent cognition, etc.

original: rang gi bdag nyid kyi don rnams nye bar bsgyur bar rtogs par byed pas na rang gi rten tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid kyi don rnams nye bar bsgyur bar rtogs par byed pas na rang gi rten tha mi dad pa'i shes pa'i dmigs par 'gyur bar byed pa yin no //
translated: It is because it causes the understanding of the objects that are its own nature that it causes the object of cognition that is not different from its own basis.

original: nus pa ni spyi'i rang bzhin ma yin te de ni gsal ba kho na'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa ni spyi'i rang bzhin ma yin te de ni gsal ba kho na'i chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Capacity is not the nature of a universal because it is a property of only the manifestation.

original: ci ste yang rang bzhin yin pa de lta na spyi nyid byed pa por 'gyur gyi gsal ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ci ste yang rang bzhin yin pa de lta na spyi nyid byed pa por 'gyur gyi gsal ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But if it is a universal, then the universal itself would be the agent, not the particulars.

original: 'o na te gsal ba'i bdag nyid tha dad par khyad par med kyang nus pa mi 'dra ba @237a * //
analyzed: 'o na te gsal ba'i bdag nyid tha dad par khyad par med kyang nus pa mi 'dra ba @237a * //
translated: But if the particulars are not different in their nature, but are different in their potency,

original: 'di yang grub pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di yang grub pa yin na /
translated: then that is also established.

original: des ci med kyang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des ci med kyang 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the use of the universal?

original: nus pa 'di ni ba lang gi yin gyi rta'i ma yin la ba lang yang khra bo la sogs pa ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir yin te des na nus pa med kyang rnam pa de lta bu'i mi 'dra ba dang ldan ba la ni spyi nyid
analyzed: nus pa 'di ni ba lang gi yin gyi rta'i ma yin la ba lang yang khra bo la sogs pa ba lang nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir yin te des na nus pa med kyang rnam pa de lta bu'i mi 'dra ba dang ldan ba la ni spyi nyid
translated: This potency is of the cow, not of the horse, and the cow is the possessor of cowness, such as being variegated and so on. Therefore, even if there is no potency, that which possesses such a different aspect is the universal itself.
